She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a loan for PHP 15,000 from NWTF to buy more items like bread, soft drinks, noodles, sardines and other groceries. Elma has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF prior to this one. She has run her general store for 15 years and supplements her income by selling food. Her goal is to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items like bread, soft drinks, noodles, sardines and other groceries.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony has owned Love Your Body for more than a decade in San Antonio, Texas. Originally from Emory, Texas, just east of Dallas, Anthony moved to San Antonio and began his retail business.

Anthony sells bath and body products made from the best ingredients, which ensure a silky smooth feel after using them. One particular lotion is made from African shea butter, which is derived from the nut of the African shea tree. The rich fatty acid is crucial to rejuvenating and moisturizing the skin.  Shea butter provides all the essential vitamins needed to make skin feel and look smoother and softer.

Anthony offers many other bath and body products and sets up shop at a local market on the south side of San Antonio. He was able to continue selling his products with the help from Accion Texas Inc., America’s largest microlender dedicated to helping small business owners and entrepreneurs. He discovered Accion while reading the local newspaper. He inquired about applying for a loan and received an approval shortly after completing the loan application process.

The Accion loan allowed Anthony to purchase additional product to sell, retain his one full-time employee, and begin taking steps to hire an additional part-time employee, too.  Anthony continues to sell at the local market in San Antonio and grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell, retain his one full-time employee, and begin taking steps to hire an additional part-time employee.

loans.name: Viktor

texts.ru:
Виктор – из Мелитополя. Он – вдовец, у него двое взрослых детей. Виктор занимается строительными услугами, производством бетонно-керамических изделий. Сейчас строит церковь недалеко от города. 
Виктору необходима сумма в 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы сделать ремонт погрузчика и инструмента, а также купить новый инструмент, так как количество наемных рабочих увеличилось из-за объема работы.
texts.en:
Viktor is from Melitopol. He is a widower and has two grown children. Viktor is involved in construction services, the production of concrete and ceramic products. Now, he is building a church not far from the town.

Viktor needs a sum of 10,000 hryvnia to make repairs to his truck and tools, as well as to buy a new tool as the number of hired workers has increased because of workload.

loans.use: to purchase new tools and repair some of his instruments

loans.name: Dodkhokul

texts.ru: Додхокул с семьей живет в Яване. Яван - маленький район. Жители этого района славятся своим гостеприимством, вежливостью и самое главное трудолюбивым духом. Додхокул из таких людей кто работает, трудиться, зарабатывает и кормит свою семью честно нажитым трудом. Он старается во всем преуспеть и призирает лень. Такими он воспитал своих детей и в будущем воспитает внуков. Додхокулу 68 лет он сам до сих пор работает на грядке. Трудолюбивым духом этого человека можно только позавидовать. Додхокул большую часть времени тратит на земле, но также он успевает ремонтировать машины. Ведь он по профессии механик и работает по специальности более 52 лет. Но основным его делом остается сельское хозяйство. Додхокул собирается развить свой бизнес и приобрести минеральные удобрения, горючей смеси для улучшения своего урожая. По такой причине он берет кредит. От полученной прибыли в будущем Додхокул сможет помочь племяннику сыграть свадьбу.
texts.en: Dodkhokul lives with his family in Yavan. Yavan is a small region. People of Yavan are famous for their hospitality, politeness and, most importantly, their hard work. Dodkhokul is one of those people who likes working hard and be able to take care of his family with honest work. He always tried to be successful and despises laziness. He has raised his children to be hard working and in the future will instill his work ethic in his grand kids as well. Dodkhokul is 68 years old, but he still works out on his fields. One can only envy the industrious spirit of this man! Most of his time is spent tending his crops, but he also manages to find time to repair cars and tractors. Dodkhokul is a trained auto-mechanic and worked in this profession for 52 years. However, his main occupation has always been farming. Dodkhokul wants to expand his business and needs to purchase fertilizer and fuel so that he can improve his future harvest. For this reason Dodkhokul is taking out this loan. He plans to use the profits from this venture to help his nephew pay for his wedding.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fuel and assure a bountiful harvest

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is 33 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 10,000  loan from NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. Jennifer has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF prior to this one. She has been running her general store for five years and also earns money from fishing. Her goal is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Luminada

texts.en: Luminada is 50 years old, married and the mother of  three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 13.000 from NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment. She has been in this business for 18 years and would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Boldu

texts.ru: Болду 31 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Болду - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Болду занимается животноводством, стартовав 5 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Болду, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 5 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Болду обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Болду планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en: Boldu is 31 years old and is raising four kids with her husband. She has a professional degree but makes her living raising livestock. She started five years ago with 10,000 som (KGS) and now owns two milk cows and five sheep. The milk and meat sales allow Boldu to earn 5,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to buy another cow she has turned to the micro-lending bank "Bai-Tushum and partners" for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS). In the future Boldu will use the profits to buy more animals as well as save money to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Fernando Jhonnathan

texts.en:
Fernando dreams of working in the hospitality industry, but without a degree, he knows it may never be possible. Fernando is currently attending the Universidad Los Andes, working towards his degree. He plans on graduating in February 2014, but without a loan from Vittana, he thinks that he may need to take time off to work and save until he can return to school. 

Fernando plans on spending the loan towards purchasing his textbooks. With them, Fernando hopes to be able to better understand his subjects. Fernando currently works 30 hours a week, and one of his biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. With a career in business, he expects to earn $11 a day. 

As the youngest of two, with one older sibling attending college already, Fernando is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замире 52 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Замиры - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Замира занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 30 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Замиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется:  1 лошадь, а также земельный надел размером 0,40 ГА на которой она ежегодно выращивает лук, кукурузу и картошку для продажи. Ежемесячный доход составляет 7,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Замира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Замира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового сарая для содержания скота.
texts.en:
Zamira is 52 years old, married and raises five children together with her husband. Zamira has secondary education. As a main income for her family, Zamira works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, after having started this business 30 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Zamira's persistent work, her farm currently has one horse and also a plot of land of the size of 0.40 hectares, on which she every year grows onions, sweet corn and potatoes to sell. The monthly income is 7,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Zamira turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS), to purchase sheep to fatten and consequently sell at the market at a higher price. Zamira plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of household animals and plans to save money for building a new barn for the livestock.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Isabel Maria

texts.es: Isabel es madre de 2 hijos en edades e 17 a 30 años, con quienes habita en un municipio a orillas del mar caribe. En el año 1995 cuando acompañó a una amiga a comprar mercancía variada para vender,  en otro departamento del caribe Colombiano, se dio cuenta que era muy buen negocio y empezó a vender víveres y a venderlos directamente a los habitantes del pueblo donde habita. Su negocio lo realiza hoy en día a crédito durante todos los días desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde y compra de contado en graneros y almacenes y depósitos en el departamento de la Guajira al norte de Colombia. Sus principales clientes son conocidos y pensionados, que poco a poco ha fidelizado y con ellos ha logrado hacer crecer su negocio. Su meta mas adelante es abrir un local al público y remodelar su vivienda, pero su mayor desafío es incrementar las ventas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará arroz, azúcar, granos, aceite vegetal etc. Con ello se propone aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus utilidades; lo cual hace que su credikiva se torne exitoso.
texts.en: Isabel is the mother of 2 children, aged 17 and 30. She lives with them in a town on the shore of the Caribbean. In 1995, when she accompanied a friend to buy varied merchandise to sell in another department of the Colombian Caribbean, she realized that it was a very good business and she started to sell groceries directly to the residents of the town where she lives. She does her business now on credit every day from 8 in the morning until 6 i the evening. She pays for her merchandise upfront in granaries and stores and warehouses in the department of  La Guajira in northern Colombia. Her main customers are people she knows and retirees whom she has won over little by little, and with whom she has been able to grow her business. Her goal for the future is to open her locale to the public and remodel her store. Her biggest challenge is increasing sales. Right now she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first loan she has taken out with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, she will buy rice, sugar, grains, vegetable oil, etc. Her goal is to increase her sales and her profits, making her Kiva loan successful.

loans.use: to buy rice, vegetable oil, coffee, sugar, grains, pastas, personal hygiene items detergent, etc.

loans.name: Aymaritas De Julian Apaza Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AYMARITAS DE JULIAN APAZA”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Francisca es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: taller de carpintería, venta de productos medicinales, artesanía en mantas, chamarras, tejido de polainas, artesanía en awayo, puerta de madera.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Francisca es integrante, ella indica que hace un ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de awayos y camas; este negocio lo emprendió hace treinta años atrás aprendiendo el mismo de sus amigas a quienes observaba tejer, ya adquirida la técnica decide implementarla como medio de generación de negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The AYMARITAS DE JULIAN APAZA communal bank is beginning its second cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Panamericana center.  The group is made up of eight members and directed by a board, where Francisca serves as the president.  The members’ businesses include a carpentry shop, medicinal products, arts and blankets, jackets, knitted shirts, arts, and wooden doors.

This loan will benefit their small businesses, including Francisca’s, who has been with Pro Mujer for one cycle, having joined on the invitation of a promoter who visited her in her home.  She has an awayo and bedding business, having learned the business 30 years ago from watching her friends knit.  Once she mastered the techniques, she decided to use them to start a business.

She will use the money from this loan to buy yarn from the large stores in El Alto, and then use it to make her wares.  This type of work will allow her to generate income to maintain her household; she is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training in heath and finances.

loans.use: to buy yarn.

loans.name: Leofe

texts.en: Leofe is married, has three children and lives in Lapinig, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte. To make a living, she runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home products to people in her local community. She has been in this business for more than three years and earns approximately PHP 4,000 per month. She supplements this income by buying lampakanay leaves, which she uses to make and weave rope to sell in town. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC that she used to purchase additional products for her store, and another loan to buy more lampakanay leaves for rope binding. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more lampakanay leaves for rope binding.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор 43 года. Она живет в Канибадаме, там где люди с интересной культурой, древние традиции и вкусные лепешки.  Невозможно удержаться и пройти возле лавок горячих, румяных, красиво оформленных канибадамских лепешек. Есть чему завидовать у канибадамских жителей. Гулбахор одна из продавщиц этих знаменитых хлебных шедевров. Она торгует уже в течении 5 лет. У Гульбахор всегда много клиентов, и постоянных набралось не мало. Ее товар востребован и за частую получается, что не все могут полакомится конибадамским хлебом. Гулбахор берет кредит и закупить лепешек побольше. Ей неустанно будут помогать ее сыновья и муж. Гулбахор прекрасная мама двух сыновей и верная жена. Никто не сомневается, ее ждет только удача. Он заранее благодарит всех Вас!
texts.en: Gulbahor is 43 years old, a wonderful mother of two sons and a faithful wife. She lives in Konibodom, a town with an interesting culture, ancient traditions and delicious flatbreads. It is impossible to just walk past the stalls full of hot, golden, beautifully shaped Konibodom flatbreads - you really have to envy the town's residents. Gulbahor is one of the saleswomen of these famous bread masterpieces. She has been selling for five years. Her husband and her sons are helping her at the market stall. Gulbahor has many clients and not just a few regulars. Her goods are in great demand and frequently sell out, so that the latecomers miss their chance to try her Konibodom flatbreads. Gulbahor wants to take out this loan so that she can buy larger batches of flatbreads from the bakers. No-one doubts that this bread venture will be successful but Gulbahor wants to thank all of you in advance!

loans.use: to buy Tajik flatbread and resell them at the market

loans.name: Cherli

texts.es: Cherli, de 39 años, está casada y tiene tres hijos con quienes vive en la casa de su madre. Cherli tiene como actividad económica la venta de productos comestibles, ofrece todo tipo de verduras, tubérculos, arroz, azúcar, pan, huevos, entre otros. Adquiere su mercadería comprando al por mayor en el mercado principal de la ciudad y ya en su establecimiento se encarga de distribuirlos a precio unitario. Lleva cerca de 2 años en este negocio y le está yendo muy bien, tiene una buena cartera de clientes y eso le ayuda a tener siempre buenas ventas y obtener considerables ganancias económicas, recibe el apoyo de su hija mayor y de su mamá quienes atienden cuando ella está ocupada en otras actividades. Le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que puede estar en contacto frecuentemente con sus clientes, lo que no le gusta es que a veces las personas se retrasan en sus pagos, pero aprendió a ser muy paciente y al final siempre consigue que le paguen el monto total que le adeudan. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella para recibir éste crédito, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, pan, aceite, leche entre otros.
texts.en: Cherli is 39 years old.  She is married and has three children with whom she lives at her mother’s house.  Cherli sells food, all types of vegetables, tubers, rice, sugar, bread, eggs, and other things.  She buys her merchandise in quantity at the city’s main marketplace and resells it as single units at her point of sale.  She’s been doing this for about two years and things are going well for her.  She has a good number of customers and this helps her have good sales and obtain good earnings.  She gets help from her oldest daughter and from her mother; they serve customers when she is busy doing other things.  She likes her job very much because she can be in constant contact with her customers.  What she doesn’t like is that sometimes people get behind in their payments, but she learned to be very patient and she has always been able to get them to pay that they owe.  She is asking for a loan of S/ 2,000 and is grateful for the opportunity and confidence placed in her for this loan.  She is committed to making her payments on time and will use the money to buy more groceries such as rice, sugar, bread, cooking oil, milk, and other things.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en: As a married mother of six children, Leonarda works hard to support her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. She is requesting a loan for PHP 30,000 from NWTF in order to buy more items like snack foods, canned goods and other miscellaneous items for her general store. Leonarda has sustained her business activities with 15 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her to save enough money so she continue to send her children college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as snack foods, canned goods and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Roman

texts.es: Roman, tiene 44 años de edad, está casado, tiene cinco hijos y vive en el municipio de Ajuterique, Siguatepeque. Tiene aproximadamente 30 años de dedicarse a la agricultura de arroz, frijoles, maíz y algunos tipos de hortalizas. La producción la vende en el mercado local. El prestamo que solicita es por 17,000 lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de insumos para los cultivos como ser fertilizantes y pago de limpieza. Este prestamo le ayudara a que sus cultivos permanezcan en buen estado y sacar mejor producción. Su meta es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Roman is 44 years old, married, and has five children.  He lives in the city of Ajuterique, Siguatepeque and has been raising rice, beans, corn, and a few types of vegetables for 30 years, and sells his harvest in the local market.  He is asking for this loan of 17,000 Lempiras to buy farming supplies, such as fertilizer, and to pay for labor for weeding.  This loan will help him maintain his crops in a healthy state and increase his production.  His goal is to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Lila

texts.es:
Lila, de 63 años, está casada y tiene seis hijos quienes ya son adultos e independientes, po está razón solo vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo. Lila, se dedica principalmente a la venta de bebidas de diversos tamaños, distintas marcas y sabores variados con los que sus clientes se refrescan y sacian la sed que genera el intenso clima de su región. Tiene un congelador concesionado por la empresa cervecera en donde coloca a diario las cervezas y gaseosas que va vendiendo durante el día en su casa. Sus clientes principalmente son sus vecinos, amigos y familiares. Lleva en este negocio 3 años y lo hace con ayuda de sus hijos. Comparte su trabajo con la siembra de productos regionales. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que puede disponer de su tiempo libre, además desea incrementar su negocio ya que considera que le genera muy buenas ganancias económicas. En está oportunidad solicitará S/. 3800, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero para poder continuar con su trabajo, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado comprará bebidas de todas las marcas, sabores y tamaños para que pueda seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Lila is 63 years old and has six adult children on their own, so she only lives with her husband.  Lila sells drinks of different sizes, brands, and flavors, with which her customers refresh themselves and quench the thirst that comes from the intense climate in her region.  She has one freezer consigned to her by the beer company, where each day she places the beer and soft drinks that she sells from her home throughout the day.  Her main customers are her neighbors, friends, and relatives.  She has been doing this for three years and gets help from her children.  She also raises regional products.  She likes her work very much because she can have free time, and also wants to grow her business, since she considers it to produce very good earnings.  She is asking for a loan of S/ 3,800 and she is very happy to know that she has financial support so she can continue with her work.  She is also committed to making her payments on time.

She will use the money to buy drinks of various brands, flavors, and sizes so she can continue working.

loans.use: to buy drinks.

loans.name: Nevaditas De Corapata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NEVADITAS DE CORAPATA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Copacabana, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: trenzado de mantas, tejidos de chompas, venta de ganado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio artesanía en mantas de alpaca; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años atrás por necesidad, ya que este producto le pedían sus amigas para poder venderlo en las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana de alpaca) que adquirirá de las ferias tradicionales de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración  lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en salud y crédito y los ahorros.
texts.en:
The NEVADITAS DE CORAPATA communal bank will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana center.  The group is made up of nine members and directed by a board of directors, where Juana serves as the president.  The members have different businesses, such as blanket making, sweater knitting, and livestock sales.

This loan will benefit their small businesses, including Juana’s.  This is her first time with Pro Mujer, having joined on the invitation of a promoter who visited her in her home.  She has an alpaca blanket business and says that she learned this business a few years ago out of necessity, since this is a product that her friends request so that they could sell them in the La Paz fairs.

She is asking for this loan to buy alpaca yarn from the traditional fairs in El Alto, and make her wares to order.  This type of work will allow her to generate income in order to maintain her household; she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training in health care, loans, and finance.

loans.use: to buy alpaca yarn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Akkyz

texts.ru: Аккыз 55 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Аккыз - высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Аккыз занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Аккыз, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 дойных коров. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Аккыз обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Аккыз планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en: Akkyz is 55 years old, married and is raising two children with her husband. She has a college degree, but makes her living raising livestock. She started 20 years ago with 10,000 som (KGS) and now owns five milk cows. The monthly profits from milk sales are 8,000 som (KGS). In order to further expand her business Akkyz has turned to micro-finance bank "Bai-Tushum and Parnters" for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS). She will use this loan to buy sheep. Akkyz plans to purchase more animals in the future and also save enough money to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 33 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Mary Jane is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mary Jane has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es: Wilmer de treinta y cinco años es oriundo de la ciudad de Tarija, vive actualmente con su madre a quien le apoya moral y económicamente, se dedica al apoyo administrativo por el día y en la noche al trasporte público (taxista) ya que la situación esta difícil y necesita captar recursos para sobrellevar la vida cotidiana con los gastos que se incurren a diario. Solicita un crédito para la refacción de su vivienda ya que se vienen las lluvias en el mes de noviembre y nos indica que se encuentra en mal estado y teme que las goteras se agraven mas, el indica que le servirá de mucho el crédito por que en la anterior gestión tuvieron bastantes problemas en temporada fluvial por lo que no quieren volver a repetir la mala vivencia.
texts.en: Wilmer is 35 years old and originally from Trija. He currently lives with his mother, whom he supports both emotionally and financially.  He drives a taxi day and night.  The situation is difficult and he needs resources to pay his daily expenses.  He is asking for a loan so he can make repairs to his home, since the rainy season is coming in November and he says that the home is in bad shape and is worried that the leaks will get worse.  He says that this loan will be very helpful because they had a hard time with the last wet season and they don’t want to go through that again.

loans.use: to make home repairs.

loans.name: Julia Ondina

texts.es: Julia, tiene 29 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene tres hijos y reside en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida. Tiene 4 años de dedicarse a la venta de productos de belleza, ropa y artículos para el hogar. El préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 Lempiras y lo utilizara en la compra de ropa (blusas, jeans, camisas, short etc.),  artículos para el hogar (cortina, cameras) y productos de belleza (tintes, espuma, shampo, tratamientos etc.).El negocio lo tiene en su casa y vende por pedidos. Ha solicitado este prestamo para surtir de productos y asi tendrá mejores ventas y ganancias. Su meta es crecer con el negocio y asi mismo poder obtener el titulo de secundaria para desarrollarse de una mejor manera.
texts.en: Julia is 29 years old and lives with her husband in a common law marriage. They have three children and live in the town of Tela, Atlántida.  She has been selling beauty products, clothing, and household articles for four years and is asking for a loan of 10,000 Lempiras to buy clothing (blouses, jeans, shirts, shorts, etc.), household articles (curtains, cameras), and beauty products (tints, foams, shampoos, treatments, etc.).  She sells from her home and on order.  She is asking for this loan to stock up on products and increase her sales and earnings.  Her goal is to grow her business and also to finish secondary school so she can develop in a better way.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: El Cedral 2 Group

texts.es:
José Baudilio, tiene 31 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene tres hijos y reside en el municipio de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la ganadería y hace 10 años se ha  dedicado a la producción de café, maíz y frijol. El préstamo que solicitan es en forma grupal, por su parte solicita 7,000 Lempiras y lo utilizara para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos y limpieza del terreno para sus cultivos de café y otros de granos básicos. Tiene como meta que al final de la temporada cancelar el préstamo  y con las ganancias remodelara su vivienda. El grupo de llama El Cedral 2,y esta formado por 8 personas quienes viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a la agricultura.
En la foto se identifican de izquierda a derecha: José Yovany de camisa morada, José Baudilio de camisa roja con Gorra, luego Jorge, José Aníbal de camisa roja, doña María, sigue José Antonio, agachado a la izquierda camisa gris esta José Ernesto y Elvin de camisa negra a la derecha. El préstamo grupal es por 78,000 Lempiras y lo invertirán en fertilizantes y limpieza de la finca de café
texts.en:
José Baudilio is 31 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a common law marriage.  They live in the town of Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara.  He used to raise livestock, but 10 years ago he began raising coffee, corn, and beans.  This is a group loan request and his part is 7,000 Lempiras that he will use to buy fertilizer, compost, and clean off the fields for his coffee crops and other basic grains  His goal is to repay the loan by the end of the season and remodel his house with his earnings.  The group is called “El Cedral 2,” and is made up of eight persons who live in the same community and who are farmers.

In the photograph we have, from left to right: José Yovany wearing a purple shirt, José Baudilio wearing a red shirt and hat, then Jorge, José Aníbal wearing a red shirt, María, followed by José Antonio, José Ernesto is crouched down on the left wearing a grey shirt, and Elvin wearing a black shirt on the left.  The group loan is for 78,000 Lempiras and they will use the money to buy fertilizer and clean off their coffee fields.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Dolibe

texts.es: Dolibe, de 61 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Dolibe se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles, entre los que se encuentran; arroz, azúcar, leche, panes, huevos, aceite, verduras y mas. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa en donde atiende todos los días. Lleva trabajando 5 años en este rubro. Al inicio tuvo la ayuda de su esposo pero ahora se dedica ella misma a tiempo completo a atender a su clientela. Complementa este trabajo con la venta de postres, quesos y dulces que ella misma elabora. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para cumplir las principales funciones de su hogar, afortunadamente le va muy bien ya que siempre tienen clientes debido a la variedad de productos que ofrece y porque además en la única tienda en su localidad. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, agradece a quienes le brindan la oportunidad para acceder a este crédito financiero que le brinda la seguridad para continuar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará mercadería para su venta en su tienda conformada por arroz, azúcar, huevos, leche, aceites y gaseosas.
texts.en: Dolibe is 61 years old, married and has three children and a house of her own.  Dolibe sells food products such as rice, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, cooking oil, vegetables, and other things.  She runs this business out of her home, where she serves customers every day and has been doing so for five years.  In the beginning she had her husband’s help but now she serves her customers herself.  She also sells desserts, cheeses, and candies that she makes herself.  What she likes about her work is that it also gives her time to do her housework.  Fortunately things are going well for her, and she has customers because of the variety of products she offer, and because hers is the only store in the area.  She is asking for a loan of S/ 1,000 and is grateful to those who provide her the opportunity to have the security to continue with her work.  She also promises to make her payments on time.  She will use the money to buy rice, sugar, eggs, milk, cooking oil, and soft drinks.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.ru: Гузнозе 26 лет. Она разведана и сейчас живет в родительском доме, с мамой. Ее отец и младший брат находятся за границей на заработках. Гулнозе и ее маме они каждый месяц высылают по 600-800 сомони. Гулноза любит животных, зверей, птиц и ухаживает за ними. У них дома одна дойная корова и 5 птиц. Она хочет свое хобби превратит в выгодный бизнес и с помощью кредита она сможет закупить крупнорогатый скот и попробовать почувствовать себя бизнес woman. Ей будет помогать ее мама. Мама Гулнозы всегда поддерживала ее в самые трудные моменты и сейчас не бросит ее. Эти две мужественные женщины смогут всего добиться, в это надо только поверить. И вы можете им помочь.
texts.en:
Gulnoza is 26. She is divorced and now lives with her mother in her parents' home. Her father and younger brother are working abroad and send Gulnoza and her mother 600 to 800 somoni every month. 

Gulnoza loves animals and birds and looks after them. At home they have a milk cow and five birds. She wants her hobby to turn into a profitable business and with the help of a loan will be able to purchase big-horned cattle and consider herself a businesswoman, as well as being able to help her mother, who has always supported her through difficult moments and is not abandoning her now. These two tough women will be able to achieve anything, so long as they believe in it. And you can help them.

loans.use: to purchase big-horned cattle and turn her hobby into a profitable business

loans.name: Erick Jerson

texts.es: El Sr. Erick tiene 40 años, el se dedica  a la fabricación y venta de joyas enchapadas en oro y de plata, tiene su joyería que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Alcoreza  de la ciudad de La Paz,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Erick va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de  materia prima para la fabricación de  joyas y así ofrecer variedad de joyas a sus clientes  y de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a  sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, El Sr. Erick es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en: Erick is 40 years old and makes and sells gold and silver jewelry.  He has his jewelry store located in the Alcoreza area of La Paz.  This loan will be his first through the institution, and Erick will use it to buy supplies for making jewelry and be able to offer a variety to his customers.  In this way he can provide better service and increase his earnings.  He is asking for this loan so he can improve his business.  Erick is a very hardworking person and is happy about this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Hilda is 40 years old and has four children who are in school.

Hilda has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials for her business.

Hilda has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Zachary

texts.en:
At Good Intentions Restoration, Zach focuses on masonry home improvement and restoration. When Zach completed his first construction job, he realized he enjoyed working within the field, decided to obtain his general contractor certification and become his own boss.

“I started working immediately and have been putting almost all my earnings back into the business,” he says. “I hope that the business grows big enough to where I can take on employees and market myself for historic homes and buildings, and specifically, masonry.” 

It’s only been four months since Zach began working as a general contractor. He works alone and plans to grow his business to support himself and then, future employees. For the time being, Zach decided to contact a community partner, Thrive, which then referred him to Accion Texas Inc. After loan approval, he purchased a truck and tools to work on more jobs.

Zach says the loan will help him “build equity in my business and start saving money.” Without the loan, “my growth would definitely become limited,” he says.

Until he creates a website for the business, Zach invites potential customers to like his Facebook page here: http://on.fb.me/1eob6sb

loans.use: to purchase a truck and tools to work on more jobs.

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.en: Leoncio lives in the village of Aurora in Zamboanga del Sur with his three children. Leoncio works as a laborer and at the same time he perfectly manages farming. He is raising cows and piglets. The income is not enough, so Leoncio thinks that if he manages to enlarge his piggery the profit will be much more. That is why he is asking for a loan of  5,000 PHP to buy feed and other supplies for the following months. He dreams to improve his pigs' shelter for expansion.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for the following months

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
La Señora Eugenia, tiene 47 años de edad, es casada, tiene tres hijos, reside en compañía de su familia en una comunidad rural del municipio de Yorito, Departamento de Yoro.
Anteriormente se dedicaba a la agricultura, dicha labor la realizaba junto a su esposo, con el interés de obtener otros ingresos, hace 15 años que se dedica a la venta de combustible (gasolina superior). Ella esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de 30,000 Lempiras, siendo este el quinto ciclo de préstamo con la institución, el cual los va invertir en la compra de mas gasolina superior para vender en la comunidad, ella tiene una clientela en su comunidad, principalmente de personas cuyo transporte es a través de motocicletas.
Eugenia espera invertir una parte de sus utilidad en la mejora del local de su negocio, que le permitan una mayor seguridad en el manejo de dicho carburante.
texts.en:
Eugenia is 47 years old, married, and has three children.  She lives with her family in the rural community of Yorito, within the Yoro department.

She used to be a farmer and worked with her husband, but wanted to have another source of income, so she started selling fuel (bulk gasoline) 15 years ago.  She is asking for this loan of 30,000 Lempiras, this being her fifth cycle within the institution, so she can buy more premium gasoline to sell in the community.  She has customers in her community, mainly persons who provide transportation via motorcycles.

Euginia hopes to invest a part of the money in improving her business location, which will provide her better security in managing said fuel.

loans.use: to buy gasoline.

loans.name: Adali

texts.es:
Adali de 41 años, no asistió a la escuela, por motivo de que sus padres no tenían los recursos para necesarios para pagarle la educación. Actualmente, esta acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, los dos hijos viven con él y trabajan en la pesca.


Él por su parte, se dedica a la pesca, desde hace 25 años, aprendió el trabajo porque su padre lo llevaba para que le ayudara fue así que se fue acostumbrando y le gusto, decidió  dedicarse porque le queda muy cerca la Laguna a unos 5 minutos de su casa, además se dedica a la siembra de maíz y un cuñado le ayuda en las labores agrícolas.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para, mejorar su vivienda especialmente el piso, porque los ladrillos están agrietados y cada vez se va deteriorando, y una parte para compra de abonos ya que siembra 7,000 metros cuadrados. Le hará de mucho beneficio, ya que en varias ocasiones manifestó que se han doblado el pie debido al mal estado del piso.

Espera en un futuro, comprar una canoa propia para tener más benéficos, ya que alquila una para ir a pescar; para ahorrar y más adelante poder comprar otra para que la trabajen sus hijos.
texts.en:
Adali is 41 years old and did not attend school because his parents did not have the necessary resources top pay for an education.  He is married and his wife works as a housewife.  Both of his children live at home and are fishermen.

He, himself, has been fishing for 25 years and learned this because his father would take him so that he could help.  This is how he became used to it and liked it, so he decided to dedicate himself to this because the lake is only five minutes from his home.  He also raises corn and his brother in law helps him with the farm chores.

He is asking for this loan so he can make improvements to his home, especially the floor because the bricks are worn and they continue to deteriorate.  He will also use part of the money to buy fertilizer, since he plants crops on 7,000 sq. meters.  This will be very helpful to him and he has mentioned that he has twisted his foot several times due to the poor state of the floor.

He hopes to be able to buy a canoe of his own in the future, so he can benefit more.  He currently rents one to fish with.  He also wants to be able to save up to buy a second one that his sons can work from it.

loans.use: to replace his floor.

loans.name: Francisco Ovidio

texts.es: Francisco, tiene 46 años de edad, esta soltero, tiene tres hijos y vive en el municipio de Esparta, Atlántida. Lleva  10 años de dedicarse a la venta de ganado y leche a sus clientes de su comunidad. Con el propósito de aumentar el negocio y sus ganancias ha decidido solicitar un  préstamo que es por 20,000 Lempiras y lo va utilizar en la compra de cuatro terneros más para engordarlos y venderlos.  El tiene como meta tener mas vacas de ordeño y así poder vender mas leche y poder obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Francisco is 46 years old, single, and has three children.  He lives in Esparta, Atlántida and has been selling livestock and milk to his customers in the community for 10 years.  He wants to grow his business and decided to request a loan for 20,000 Lempiras so he can buy four steers to fatten up and sell.  His goal is to have more dairy cows so he can sell more milk and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy steers.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: Marco Antonio de 21 años de edad es un joven que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy emprendedor y responsable. Tiene ya varios años de vivir en la casa de sus padres que da gracias a Dios que es propia. Marco se dedica a la labor de ser Mecánico Automotriz en un taller cercano a su hogar, cada mañana despierta con nuevas ilusiones y deseos de superación, el le ayuda a sus padres económicamente y en esta ocasión se acerco a FUSAI a solicitar un crédito pues con tantos deseos quiere arreglar un muro de su hogar ya que sirva como tapial porque se mantiene en mal estado  y para esto necesita comprar cemento, ladrillos, grava. hierro etc. Desea con mucha ilusión poder realizar esto y sentirse satisfecho de entregarle una buena casa a sus padres
texts.en:
Marco Antonio, 21, is a young man who has always stood out for being enterprising and responsible. For several years now he has been living in his parents' house which, thanks to God, is their own. Marco works as an automobile mechanic in a garage near his house. Every morning he wakes up with new dreams and desires of improvement.

He helps his parents economically and on this occasion he came to FUSAI to seek a loan because he greatly desires to fix a wall at his house that serves as a yard wall, because it is presently in poor condition. For this he needs to buy cement, blocks, gravel, iron, etc. He looks forward greatly to achieving this and feeling satisfied by providing a good house to his parents.

loans.use: to buy cement, blocks, gravel, iron, etc. for construction of a yard wall.

loans.name: Jacqueline Rosmery

texts.es: Jacqueline de 29 años de edad vive con su esposo y tienen un pequeño hijo de 4 años de edad. Hace dos años y medio viven en casa propia. Jacqueline se dedica a la labor de ser promotora de ventas es decir vender productos de belleza por catálogos de casa en casa. Jacqueline tiene un deseo y es poder arreglar su hogar empezando por la reparación del piso e incluir en esta la pintura de su vivienda; es por eso que solicitó a FUSAI un préstamo para la compra de ladrillo de piso, cemento, arena, brochas y pintura para realizar estas mejoras de su vivienda. Está dispuesta de cancelar lo antes posible este crédito y así dejar la posibilidad de adquirir otros con el objetivo de continuar reparando más su vivienda.
texts.en: Jacqueline, 29, lives with her husband and they have a little 4-year-old son.   They’ve lived in their own house for two-and-a-half years.  Jacqueline works as a sales rep. that is; she sells beauty products via catalog from home.  She’d like to make some home improvements and this is why she asked FUSAI for a loan to buy floor bricks, cement, sand, brushes and paint to make these improvements to her home.  She’s determined to repay her loan as soon as possible so that she can keep the option open for other loans to continue making home improvements.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Juanita runs a general store in Tagudalo, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. Juanita is married and has two children. In 2011, Juanita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Juanita has successfully repaid her previous loan, which she she used to improve her business. Recently, she is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase new items like feed and rice for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items like feed and rice to sell

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 52 years old and married. She has six children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lorena has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Lorena has been in the fishing business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Medina

texts.en:
Medina is 57 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Medina has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Medina has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Taylor

texts.en:
Taylor's business was founded with the belief that life is an adventure waiting to be captured. With a camera in her hand, Taylor's goal as a photographer is to provide her clients with candid moments that tell a personal story. Her favorite thing about what she does is the ability to give her clients memories to keep forever. 

Her Kiva loan will give her the opportunity to invest in high-quality photography equipment and marketing techniques that will serve as the tools she needs to tell her story beautifully, while providing her clients with an outstanding finished product.

loans.use: to pay for high-quality photography equipment and marketing techniques.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has always been an entrepreneur; she started her own business at age 12 in Mexico, but was forced to leave the country because of difficult circumstances. She came to the USA in 1988 with her four children and worked non-stop to support her family. 

Now, 25 years later, Maria has worked in almost every position in the restaurant industry and is starting her own café, "De Todo Un Poquito". Raising the funds to start her own business was not easy. She saved what she could out of every paycheck she received to be able to purchase the equipment she would need. Three years later, and with about $60,000 in equipment, she is finally ready to open. She even used the money she got back from her tax returns to pay the down payment for the café’s lease and pay the first few months rent. 

She is requesting a $5,000 Kiva loan, the only amount she has not been able to cover herself, to purchase inventory and pay for inspection and permit costs. With the $5,000 from Kiva, she will finally be able to open the doors of her beloved little café on Van Nuys and Victory Blvd.

loans.use: to purchase inventory, remaining food, and a beverage license in order to finally open the doors of her beloved little café.

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es: Rosa Idalia de 26 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos en casa humilde pero propia. Siempre con deseos de superación se mantiene realizando sus labores con las mejores disposiciones, su forma de ganarse la vida es vendiendo comida en un mercado ella compra, y hace todo ya que le gusta siempre mantener todo con higiene y calidad. Poco a poco ha ido mejorando su casa y desea construir un muro que le sirva de tapial y no tiene los fondos necesarios para realizarlo es por eso que solicito a FUSAI un préstamo para la compra de materiales como cemento, graba, arena, y hierro. Espera pronto su situación mejore y poco a poco sentirse con la seguridad que lograra su sueño lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Rosa Idalia, 26, lives with her two children in a humble house but a house she owns.  Always aiming at improving, she’s constantly doing her work with the best intentions.  Her way of earning a living is selling food in a market.  She buys it and does everything necessary because she likes to always have everything hygienic and of quality.

She’s gradually been doing home improvements and wants to build a wall to replace the mud wall but does not have sufficient funds to do so which is why she’s asked FUSAI for a loan to buy materials like cement, gravel, sand and iron rods.  She hopes her situation will improve and little by little to feel more secure of reaching her dream as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es: Rosa Elvira de 30 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto a sus dos hijas de 12 años y 16 años de edad. Es una mujer muy visionaria que le gusta desempeñarse y ganarse la vida honradamente. Se dedica a la labor de vender pan francés y pan de dulce, Desde que se levanta trata de dejar todo listo y necesario para ya en la tarde tener lista su venta. Siempre con deseos de mejorar su vivienda se acercó a FUSAI para la compra de lámina galvanizada, pines, polines y otros materiales de construcción con el fin de reparar el techo de su humilde vivienda pues la que tienen está muy deteriorada, y tiene hoyos además las lluvias ya han comenzado a afectarles filtrándose el agua y está arruinando sus pocas pertenencias
texts.en:
Rosa Elvira, 30, lives with her two daughters who are 12 and 16 years of age in a house she owns.  She’s a very forward-looking woman who likes to develop and earn a living honorably.  She works selling French and sweet bread.  From the moment she rises she tries to leave everything necessary ready for her sales in the afternoon.  

Always aiming at improving her home, she approached FUSAI to buy galvanized metal sheet, roofing purlines and other building supplies needed to repair the roof on her humble dwelling because the one she has is very damaged and full of holes.  The rains have started and they have been affected by the water leaking in ruining their few belongings.

loans.use: to repair her roof.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Jose German De Jesus

texts.es: José de 30 años de edad vive junto a su familia conformada por su esposa y sus hijos de 10 años, 8 años y 7 años. Reside en casa humilde pero propia desde hace ya 10 años, se siente muy contento pues es lo que tiene para dejarles a sus hijos y en el presente entregarles una vida tranquila y decente. Trabaja como responsable de mantenimiento en un colegio de la capital y su esposa vende artesanías realizada por ella misma. José desea con tanto esmero construir una pila y también pavimentar el piso de su vivienda actualmente el piso es de tierra y para la salud y comodidad de su familia hará todo el esfuerzo para hacerlo, es por eso que solicita a FUSAI un préstamo para la compra de cemento, arena, grava entre otros, y así está mas que seguro que su familia estará muy contenta con la realización de este sueño.
texts.en: José is 30 years old and lives with his family, made up of his wife and three children, who are aged ten, eight, and seven years old respectively.  José lives in a humble house but he has owned it for the last ten years.  José is very happy with this as he has something that he will be able to leave to his children, and, for now, he is able to give them a peaceful and decent life.  José works as the head of maintenance in one of the capital's schools, while his wife sells artisan products that she herself produces.  José wants to put in a sink and to pave the floor of his house.  Currently the floor is simply made of earth but, for the health and comfort of his family, José will make every effort to make these improvements to this house.  So, for this reason, José in applying for a loan in order to buy cement, sand, gravel and other items.  With this work, he is more than sure that his family will be happier as this dream becomes a reality.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, and other items.

loans.name: Oijamal

texts.ru: Ойжамал 43 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Ойжамал - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Ойжамал занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 7,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Ойжамал, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова с теленком, а также имеет 1,32 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает хлопок и арахис для продажи. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Ойжамал обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку кормов (сено, жом, ячмень, отруби) для скота на зимне-осенний период. Доходы от кредита Ойжамал планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на проведение свадебного торжества старшей дочери.
texts.en:
Oijamal is 43 years old, married, and together with her husband is raising three children. Oijamal has a high school education. As a main source of income for her family, Oijamal is engaged in raising livestock, having started 20 years ago with the purchase of cattle for 7,000 som KGS. 

Thanks to her hard work, Oijamal today has on her homestead: 1 dairy cow with calf and also has a 1.32-hectare land share, on which she grows each year cotton and peanuts for sale. Monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). 

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Oijamal turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock feed (hay, beet pulp, barley, bran) for the autumn-winter period. 

Oijamal plans to invest income from the loan to further increase the count of domestic animals and plans to save money to put on a wedding celebration for her eldest daughter.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed

loans.name: Venancia Aguilar

texts.es: Venancia de 64 años de edad vive junto a su hijo. Toda su vida trabajo para darle una mejor vida a su hijo siempre fue visionaria y responsable, habita en casa humilde pero propia y eso la hace acreedora de sentirse orgullosa que de tanto esfuerzo y trabajo concluyó con todo lo que se propuso. Ella actualmente es pensionada solo su hijo trabaja como jornalero. Venancia desea reconstruir su casa y comprar lámina para reconstruir paredes ya que actualmente es de bahareque y se está cayendo por tal razón solicitó a FUSAI un préstamo para la compra de lamina y reforzar la pared. Espera realizar lo antes posible esta reparación así estará más tranquila en su hogar.
texts.en:
Venancia, 64, lives with her son.  She’s worked her entire life to provide him with a better life.  She’s always been forward-looking and responsible.  She lives in a house that though humble, is hers.  This makes her very proud because she attained everything she proposed to by means of much effort and work.

She’s currently retired and only her son works as a day laborer.  Venancia wants to rebuild her house and to buy metal sheeting to rebuild the walls that are currently wattle and daub and eroding away.  This is why she’s asked FUSAI for a loan to buy metal sheets to reinforce the wall.  She hopes to do this repair as soon as possible in order to be more at peace in her home.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Mary Jean requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Mary Jean has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Mary Jean would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Sanavar

texts.ru: Санавар жизнерадостная и очень трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и имеет детей. Санавар родилась и выросла в сельской местности. Уже с детства она обучалась сельской работе, помогала своим родителям работать на поле, чтобы иметь доход в семье. Санавар рано вышла замуж, как все девушки её местности. Сейчас она живёт и радуется, так как у неё прекрасный и трудолюбивый муж и замечательные дети. Чтобы хорошо жить в сельской местности нужно постоянно работать. Поэтому Санавар и её муж постоянно заняты каким-либо делом, которое приносит хороший доход в  семью. Сама Санавар работает в дехканском хозяйстве, занимается посевом разного рода сельскохозяйственной культуры. Её муж работает механизатором и имеет собственный трактор. Также, чтобы иметь больше дохода, Санавар с мужем занимаются откормом и продажей скота. На сегодня она имеет примерно 10 голов скота. Также ежедневно Санавар от этого скота получает и продаёт 15 литров молока. В данный момент Санавар желает увеличить поголовье своего скота, чтобы получить от этого больше прибыли и запастись необходимыми продуктами и вещами на зимний период. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Санавар надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за предоставляемую финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Sanavar is a cheerful and very hardworking woman. She is married with children. Sanavar was born and grew up in a rural area. Even as a child she learned the rural work, helping her parents to work in the field in order to have an income for the family. Sanavar married early, as do all the young women in her area. Now she is living and is happy because she has a good and hardworking husband and wonderful children. 

To live well in the rural areas requires constant work. Therefore, Sanavar and her husband are constantly busy with some sort of work which brings a good income to the family. Sanavar herself works on a group farm and is involved in sewing all kinds of crops. Her husband works as a mechanic and has his own tractor. Similarly, in order to have more income, Sanavar and her husband are engaged in the fattening and resale of cattle. Today she has about ten heads of cattle. Daily, Sanavar milks the cows and sells 15 liters. 

Currently, Sanavar wishes to increase the number of her livestock in order to get more profit and to stock up on essential products and items for the winter. She therefore turned to Arvand and wants to receive a loan to buy cattle. Sanavar is hoping for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for providing financial support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Maria Paula

texts.es: María de 49 años de edad vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Es una mujer muy trabajadora que siempre cumple sus metas y sueños, vive desde hace ya 27 años en su hogar que es humilde pero propia y esto la hace sentirse satisfecha de lo que hasta ahorita ha construido con el esfuerzo de sus manos y el sudor de su frente. María poco a poco ha ido mejorando su hogar y en esta ocasión le queda por mejorar las paredes, repellándolas (mezcla de cemento y arena fina) es por eso que solicita a FUSAI un préstamo pues no tiene el dinero suficiente y desea comprar cemento,arena y otros materiales necesarios. Confía en que su vivienda tendrá ese cambio y que seguirá entregándole un buen futuro a sus hijos
texts.en: María, 49, lives with her husband and two children.  She’s a very hardworking woman who always reaches her goals and dreams.  For the last 27 years she’s lived in her home which though humble, is hers.  This gives her much satisfaction for what she’s built do date has been with her own sweat and toil.  María has gradually been making home improvements but still needs to improve the walls sealing them with a mixture of cement and fine sand.  This is why she’s asking FUSAI for a loan because she does not have enough money and wants to buy cement, sand and other needed supplies.  She trusts that her home will undergo this improvement and she will continue giving her children a good future.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand to seal the walls.

loans.name: Ana Carolina

texts.es: Ana Carolina de 21 años de edad habita junto a sus padres y su pequeño hijo de dos años de edad. Es una joven trabajadora que a su corta edad ha querido entregarle una buena vida a su hijo. Habitan en casa humilde pero propia, la forma de ganarse la vida es elaborando zapatos para mujer de forma artesanal que comercializa en la ciudad de Guatemala ella viaja cada semana y es así como sobre vive junto a su grupo familiar. Siempre ha tenido el sueño de tener su cuarto propio es por esa razón que se acerco a FUSAI y solicito un préstamo para la construcción de tres paredes que divida un cuarto grande y ella poder tener un cuarto solo con su hijo, y para ello necesita comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, grava, arena, y ladrillos. Espera pueda cumplir su sueño lo mas antes posible.
texts.en:
Ana Carolina, 21, lives with her parents and with her little two-year-old son.  She’s a young worker who at her young age wants to provide a good life for her son.  They live in a house that though humble is theirs.  She earns her living manufacturing hand-made women’s shoes that she sells in Guatemala City.  She travels there weekly and this is how she and her family survive.

She’s always dreamed with having her own bedroom and this is why she approached FUSAI and requested a loan to build three walls to divide a large room so that she and her son can have a room of their own.  To do so, she needs to buy building supplies like cement, gravel, sand and bricks.  She hopes her dream will be a reality as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Munkhtsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Munkhtsetseg, 36 years old, lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a packer at an agricultural company since 2010. Her husband has been selling casual clothes to local people by renting a stall in the trade center for five years. Their daughter goes to high school. Last year their house's roof became damaged and recently they began repairing the roof but couldn't afford it due to lack of finances. So she is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase shingles. The house roof repair is necessary as harsh winter is coming closer to Mongolia. Also, heat loss through the roof will be decreased, thus requiring less coal for heating. The burning of coal is considered to be the main cause of air pollution in Mongolia according to state research.

loans.use: to purchase shingles

loans.name: Neoma

texts.en:
Neoma is married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Neoma is 44 years old and has two children who are in school.

Neoma has a buy-and-sell rice grain business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grain to sell.

Neoma has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grain to sell

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.ru: Сабохат жизнерадостная и позитивная женщина. Она живёт одна без мужа, и на своём обеспечении она имеет двоих детей. Сабохат живёт в сельском маленьком посёлке. Она работает учительницей в местной школе. Но жить на одну заработную плату учительницы очень трудно, этих денег ей хватает всего лишь на среднее пропитание. А её детям нужно хорошее питание, чтобы вырасти здоровыми и развитыми. Поэтому Сабохат делает всё возможное, чтобы как-то найти больше дохода для достойного проживания. Совсем недавно она решила заняться своим делом, которое будет приносить ей стабильный хороший доход. И как трудолюбивая женщина свой выбор она остановила на животноводстве и садоводстве, так как с детства знает все тонкости этой деятельности. Но для того, чтобы начать этот бизнес ей нужная некоторая сумма денежных средств, чего на сегодня она не имеет. Поэтому она решилась получить кредит, чтобы начать своё дело. Она будет закупать маленьких телят, потом выращивать их и продавать мясо и молоко, полученное от выращенного скота. Таким образом она будет иметь постоянный доход, что поможет ей улучшить качество её жизни. Для получения кредита на покупку скота Сабохат обратилась в Арванд. Она ждёт и надеется на положительный результат, а также заранее благодарит Арванд за помощь.
texts.en:
Sabohat is a cheerful and positive woman. She lives on her own without her husband and has two children in her care. Sabohat lives in a small rural village. She works as a teacher in a local school. But living on a teacher's salary is very difficult and she lacks the money for even basic food. Her children need good nutrition to grow healthy and developed. Sabohat therefore is doing everything possible to somehow find more income for a decent living. 

Most recently, she decided to start her own business which will bring her a good steady income. And as a hardworking woman, her choice stopped on raising livestock and horticulture, because from childhood she knows the ins and outs of these activities. But in order to start this business, she needs some amount of money that she does not currently have. She decided therefore to take a loan to start a business. She will purchase small calves, then grow them and sell the meat and milk from the grown cattle. 

In this way, she will have a steady income that will help her to improve her quality of life. To obtain a loan to buy cattle, Sabohat turned to Arvand. She is waiting and hoping for a positive result, and thank Arvand in advance for the help.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Hikmatullo

texts.ru: Хикматулло старается быть во всем похожим на своего деда. Именно он научил его скотоводству. Его дед был пастухом и всегда брал собой Хикматулло, когда он еще был маленьким. Хикматулло всего 26 лет и ему еще далеко до опыта и знания своего деда, но он не теряет время зря и старается во всем подражать своему деду. У него есть одна дойная корова. И причина, по которой он берет кредит, является приобретения быков. Он хочет увеличить поголовья скотов и купить им корм. Хикматулло надеется, что от их выгоды он сможет собрать деньги и сыграть свою свадьбу. Хикматулло мечтает заработает на большую стаду, за которым будет, следит со своим внуком.
texts.en:
Hikmatullo is trying to be in all ways like his grandfather. It was he who taught him animal husbandry. His grandfather was a shepherd and always took Hikmatullo with him when he was still young. Hikmatullo is all of 26 years old and he is still far from the experience and knowledge of his grandfather, but he is not losing time and is trying in everything to imitate his grandfather. He has one dairy cow. The reason he is taking a loan is to acquire bulls. 

He wants to increase the number of his livestock and to buy feed for them. Hikmatullo hopes that from their gains he can raise money and plan his wedding. 

Hikmatullo dreams of making a living on a big stage, on which he will be watching his own grandson.

loans.use: to purchase bulls

loans.name: 14 De Junio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “14 DE JUNIO” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Beatriz es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de fruta, venta de comida, taller de costura, venta de ropa, venta de sombreros, costura de mochilas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Beatriz es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de frutas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió  de su madre, a quien colaboraba en el mismo negocio, cuando empezó a convivir con su pareja decide tener su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de fruta) que adquirirá de las ferias tradicionales, por mayor, y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y el ahorro.
texts.en:
The “14 de Junio” (June 14th) communal bank will start the fifth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Alto Lima Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board whose treasurer is Beatriz.  The communal bank members have a variety of businesses such as: fruit sales, food sales, sewing workshop, clothing sales, hat sales and backpack manufacturing.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Beatriz.  She states that she’s been part of Pro Mujer for two years having joined thanks to an invitation from one of the institution’s advisors that visited her at home.  She currently has a business selling fruit and she makes it known that she learned the business from her mother who she helped with the same kind of business.  When she started to live with her spouse she decided to go into business for herself.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy fruit in traditional street markets at wholesale and then sell it in her stand.  This way of working makes it possible for her to generate income to support her family since she’s in a common law relationship and has a son.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers the credit and the savings.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Wendi Tatiana

texts.es: Wendi de 19 años de edad habita junto a sus padres y su pequeña hija de 1 año de edad; Residen en casa humilde pero propia. Es una joven muy trabajadora que actualmente trabaja en un comedor cerca de su casa, ella junto a sus padres sobresalen con los gastos del hogar, gracias a Dios nunca le ha quedado mal a nadie ya que tiene buenas referencias de pago. Wendi desea construir su casa hacer una división para ella tener un cuarto con su hija, es por eso que solicita a FUSAI un préstamo para la compra de materiales como cemento, ladrillos, varillas de hierro, grava y arena. Espera lo más antes posible realizar la construcción y entregarle una mejor vida a su hija.
texts.en:
Wendi, 19, lives with her parents and her one-year-old little daughter.  They live in a house that though humble is theirs.  She’s a hardworking young woman who currently works in an eatery near home.  She and her parents are able to cover household expenses.  Thanks be to God, she’s never defaulted anyone and she has good payment references.

Wendi would like to build at home dividing it so that she and her daughter can have their own bedroom.  This is why she’s asked FUSAI for a loan to buy supplies like cement, bricks, iron rods, gravel and sand.  She hopes to do the building as soon as possible to provide a better life for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is married with three children and resides in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. Her husband works as a company driver while Arlyn manages their own  farm, planting and harvesting rice to earn a living. 

She has successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC which she used to purchase farm supplies. She is now requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to cover the costs of weeding maintenance and fertilizing her farm. In the future, Arlyn wants to make improvements to her house and the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to cover the cost of weeding maintenance and fertilizing her farm.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
This is Nida, 45, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Arnold, a driver, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Nida operates a vegetable-growing farm. She grows vegetables and other fruits in their farm located in Cavite; it is in the high lands where it is suited to grow vegetables and other fruits. She sells her product to markets and fruit stores that she regularly supplies as well as to the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for her business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of her farm. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Nida dreams that her business will continue to expand and hopes to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and farm inputs for her business.

loans.name: Ganbat

texts.en: Mr. Ganbat, 35 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been providing a taxi service to the local people using his own automobile for eight years. His wife is employed and now works as a tailor at a company. Using his previous loan, he insulated and repaired his house. Now he is requesting a loan of 1,400,000 MNT to purchase vacuum-insulated windows.
