Installing vacuum-insulated windows will make his house more comfortable and warm and enable his family to burn less coal for heating. This will result in fewer pollutants being released into the atmosphere. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better life.

loans.use: to purchase vacuum-insulated windows.

loans.name: Fahtullo

texts.ru: В районе Файзабад в течение трех лет работает продуктовый магазин Фатхулло. Фатхулло поставляет и продает продукты сам. В его магазине можно найти все продукты в том числе: печение, булочки, конфеты, масло, сгущенка, напитки, сок, газированная вода, мясные консерванты и многое другое. Фатхулло старается, чтоб прилавки никогда не были пустыми, чтобы покупатели могли приобрести все необходимые продукты. Поддержать такой порядок ему помогает его семья. Фатхулло открыл магазин 3 года назад и ни разу не пожалел об этом. Ему нравится общаться с новыми людьми и помогать покупателям с выбором. Фатхулло строит планы об расширение своей деятельности, он хочет заполнить прилавки, и закупить продукты первой необходимости, чтобы жители его района, района Файзабад не ходили далеко за продуктами - это и является целью получения кредита. Надеемся, что у него все получится и его задуманное принесет удобства его землякам.
texts.en:
In the Faizabad district, Fatkhullo has been working in a grocery store for three years. Fatkhullo markets and sells products himself. In his store, one can find all the products, including cookies, muffins, candy, butter, condensed milk, drinks, juice, soda, preserved meats, and much more. Fatkhullo is trying to keep the shelves from ever being empty so that customers can buy all the necessities. To support this arrangement, he is helped by his family. 

Fatkhullo opened his store three years ago and has never regretted it. He likes to meet new people and to help customers with their choices. 

Fatkhullo is making plans for the expansion of his activities. He wants to fill the shelves and to buy essential goods so that the residents of his district do not need to go far for food. This is the aim of the loan. 

We hope that he will succeed and he will bring convenience to his countrymen.

loans.use: to stock the shelves with products

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva operates her own rice farm in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. Her husband works as a welder in a private company to make a living. She has two children, both in school. She has successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC that helped improve her farm. Recently, she took a new loan of 25,000 PHP to cover the costs of weeding maintenance and fertilization. The profit from her farm will be used to improve their living situation and farm expansion.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Dina Elizabeth

texts.es: Dina de 45 años de edad vive junto a su familia, conformada por su esposo y sus hijos y un nieto. Es una mujer muy trabajadora que jamás se ha dejado vencer por las adversidades de la vida. Actualmente vive en casa humilde pero propia desde hace ya varios años, ella trabaja como empleada domestica, es así como honradamente se gana la vida. Con deseos de mejorar su vivienda se acercó a FUSAI para solicitar un préstamo y comprar materiales como cemento, hierro, grava, etc. Que le permitan cambiar las columnas de madera existentes de su vivienda, y hacerlos de concreto; cemento, arena, grava y hierro como base para que su casa se mantenga firme. Desea ir mejorando poco a poco su casa y posteriormente construir paredes de bloques de concreto.
texts.en:
Dina, who is 45 years old, lives with her family, which comprises her husband, their children, and a grandson. She is a very hardworking woman who has never let life's adversities overcome her. The house she currently lives in is humble, but her own. She has been working as a housekeeper for several years, and that is how she makes an honest living. 

Wanting to improve her home, she approached FUSAI to request a loan to buy materials like cement, iron, gravel, etc. in order to replace the existing wood pillars in her home. She will build new ones out of concrete made with cement, sand, gravel, and iron as a base for her house to have a solid structure. She wants to improve her home little by little and eventually build walls out of concrete blocks.

loans.use: to buy materials like cement, iron, gravel, etc.

loans.name: Roxana Jackeline

texts.es: Roxana Jackeline de treinta y dos años de edad vive junto a sus dos hijos, una niña de trece años y un niño de doce años en casa propia. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo, venta de ropa, es una mujer muy trabajadora, responsable, y muy audaz, sabe aprovechar cada oportunidad que se le presenta, para Roxana es muy importante su familia y el hogar, desde hace algún tiempo surgió la necesidad de realizar unos arreglos a la vivienda para mayor comodidad, desea colocar ladrillo al piso de la habitación y también quiere encementar el patio, para evitar el polvo y así mantener más limpia la casa, quiere empezar con el trabajo lo más rápido posible pero debido a sus escasos recursos económicos, no puede costear los gastos por eso decidió solicitarle a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar ladrillo de piso, cemento, arena, entre otros. Roxana Jackeline se siente muy contenta con la ayuda y se compromete a cancelar la deuda.
texts.en:
Roxana Jackeline, 32, lives in her own house with her two children, a 13-year-old girl and a 12-year-old boy.   She works selling clothes via catalog.  She’s a very hardworking, responsible, bold woman who knows how to take advantage of every opportunity that presents itself.  For Roxana, her home and family are very important.

Some time ago the need arose to make some home improvements for more comfort.  She wants to install a brick floor in the bedroom and she also wants to cement the patio to avoid dust and be able to keep the house cleaner.  She’d like to start the project as quickly as possible but due to the lack of economic resources she can’t cover the cost.  This is why she decided to ask FUSAI for a loan that will make it possible for her to buy floor bricks, cement and sand, among others.  Roxana Jackeline feels very happy with the support and commits to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Patricia Carolina

texts.es: Patricia de 20 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en casa humilde pero propia. Es una joven muy trabajadora y visionaria que se ha caracteriza a su corta edad por siempre ser responsable, siempre le ayuda a sus padres ya que tienen un pequeño negocio de hacer y confeccionar hamacas desde pequeña le gustó aprender y hoy en día es la que lleva mejor el negocio. Patricia desea con mucha ilusión la construcción de su propio cuarto de habitación, es por eso que solicitó a FUSAI un préstamo para el pago de la mano de obra y los materiales de construcción como ladrillo de barro, cemento, grava, hierro etc. Espera que sea lo más pronto posible así se sentirá feliz y satisfecha de su sueño.
texts.en:
Patricia, 20, lives with her parents in a house that though humble is theirs.  She’s a very hardworking, forward-looking young woman who at her young age is noted for being responsible.  She always helps her parents since they have a small hammock-making business and she enjoyed learning when still young and at present she’s the one who best manages the business.

Paticia is very hopeful of being able to build her own bedroom and this is why she requested a loan from FUSAI to pay labor costs and to buy building supplies like clay bricks, cement, gravel, iron, etc.  She hopes this will happen as soon as possible so she’ll feel happy and satisfied with her dream.

loans.use: to buy building supplies and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Ma. Janeta

texts.en:
This is Ma. Janeta, 45, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. Her partner is Remegio, a businessman. Ma. Janeta is a mother to her three children. She, together with her partner, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ma. Janeta sells peanuts. She buys raw peanuts, fries them and then sells them in front of their variety store. At her store she sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. She earns a minimum of 2,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php35,000 loan. She will use it to buy peanuts. She will also use the loan to buy grocery items and toiletries.  

Ma. Janeta hopes to give her family a comfortable life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and also draw strength and inspiration by studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more peanuts needed in her business.

loans.name: Maria Olinda

texts.es: María Olinda de cuarenta y tres años de edad es una mujer soltera que vive en casa propia desde hace 43 años, ella trabaja en una panadería y por las tardes vende antojitos típicos, además los fines de semana vende panes rellenos, María es muy trabajadora y responsable, siempre está buscando alternativas que le den la oportunidad de salir adelante, desde hace algún tiempo necesita construir un cuarto de ladrillo y laminas, en el patio de su vivienda, desea poder realizar este trabajo lo más rápido que se pueda, pues para ella es algo indispensable, pero no cuenta con la solvencia económica suficiente para costear los gastos, por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar los materiales cemento, grava, arena, ladrillo, lamina galvanizada entre otros. María Olinda se compromete a pagar toda la deuda ya que está muy agradecida con la ayuda.
texts.en:
María Olinda, 43, is a single woman living in her own house for 43 years.  She works in a bakery and in the evening sells traditional fast-food.   Also, on the weekend she sells filled bread rolls.  María is very hardworking and responsible.  She’s always seeking alternatives that will give her ways of moving forward.  

For some time now she’s needed to build a brick and metal sheeting room in her patio.  She’d like to do this project as quickly as possible because it’s indispensable for her but she does not have enough economic solvency to cover the costs which is why she’s asking FUSAI for a loan to buy cement, gravel, sand, bricks and galvanized metal sheets, among others.  María Olinda commits to repay the loan since she’s very grateful for the help.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Рано трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина. Она родилась в 1978 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Рано целеустремленная женщина, которая старается для благо получения своей семьи. Она более 5 лет занимается собственным бизнесом, так как доход ее мужа не хватает для содержания семьи. Она торгует на местном рынке женской одеждой. Рано коммуникабельная женщина и поэтому ей легко общаться с клиентами и привлечь больше клиентов. Она должна обновить товар на новый осенний сезон и с такой целью она обратилась за займом в сумму 3000 долларов США для покупки женской одежды. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Rano is a hardworking and ambitious woman. She was born in 1978. She is married and is raising three children. Rano is a determined woman who is trying to obtain benefits for her family. For more than five years, she has been involved in her own business, since her husband's income is not enough to support the family. She trades women's clothing at the local market. Rano is a sociable woman and therefore it is easy for her to communicate with her customers and to attract more customers. 

She must update her goods for the new fall season and with this aim she applied for a loan of US$3,000 to buy women's clothing.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes for the new season

loans.name: Munkhbayasgalan

texts.en: Mrs. Munkhbayasgalan, 38 years old, lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a house on a plot of land. She has been working as a bookkeeper in a building company for one year. Her husband provides taxi service to the local people. The house they live in was built last year. Due to a lack of capital, they haven't finished the roof. So she is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase shingles and planks. After completing the roof repair, the family will live in a comfortable and warm place without worrying about the coming winter. Also they will burn less coal by minimizing heat loss through the roof. Reducing coal usage has a positive impact on the environment as fewer pollutants are released into the atmosphere.

loans.use: to purchase shingles and planks.

loans.name: Khin

texts.en:
Khin is 53 years old. She was born on a family farm and only finished her education at a primary class level due to the financial limits of her family. She is married to a local farmer and has eight children. She is a farmer who cultivates rice and raises hog in the Kampong Thom province. The whole community helps each other to finish the farm work at the right time during a rainy season. She has been in agriculture for years--it has been a main source of her family’s income.

She has applied for a loan, which she will use to buy a motorcycle to support her two children in commuting to their workplaces. She mentioned that, being a good mother, she has to help all her children as much as she can, so as to give them a better quality of life. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to support her two children in commuting to their workplaces.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is married with five children and resides in the village of Aurora in Zamboanga del Sur. Her husband is a farmer, and provides their main source of income. Gloria runs a retail store to earn a living. She took a loan from Gata Daku MPC micro credit to buy more items like slippers and plasticware. She plans to use her profits to improve her working capital to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like slippers and plasticware.

loans.name: Roxana Marisol

texts.es: Roxana Marisol de treinta y ocho años de edad vive junto a sus dos hijos uno de 17 años y una de 19 años en casa propia. Ella se gana el sustento diario con un pequeño chalet en el que trabaja desde muy temprano; es una mujer entregada a su labor y muy humilde, lo más importante en su vida es la familia y como toda buena madre quiere lo mejor para sus hijos, tienen una pequeña vivienda en una zona rural, necesita algunas reparaciones en el baño y también en su cocina de leña pero para ello necesita algunos materiales que no puede costear por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar cemento, ladrillos, arena, hierro, para levantar paredes en el baño y para elaborar una cocina más resistente. Roxana está muy agradecida con la ayuda y asegura que cancelara la deuda.
texts.en:
Roxana Marisol, 38, lives with her two children, a 17-year-old boy and a 19-year-old girl, in her own house.  She earns her daily sustenance with a small food stand she starts working in very early.  She’s a very humble woman who is dedicated to her work.  Her family is the most important thing in her life and like all good mothers she wants the best for her children.

She owns a small house in a rural zone.  It needs some repairs in the bathroom.  In addition, her stove is wood-burning so she needs some materials but she can’t afford them which is why she’s asking FUSAI for a loan to buy cement, bricks, sand and iron rods to erect walls in the bathroom and to build a more resistant stove.  Roxana’s very grateful for the help and guarantees that she’ll repay it.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married mother of eleven children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Teresita is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Melve

texts.en:
Melve is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines, and earns additional income from tailoring and fishing. Melve is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional groceries to sell to her customers.

Melve has been sustaining her business activities through the past 16 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jorge Ardiles

texts.es: Jorge Ardiles de veintiocho años de edad vive junto a su pequeño hijo y su abuela en casa propia desde hace tres años. El se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado en diferentes lugares de la zona, es un hombre emprendedor, dedicado a su trabajo y a su familia, Jorge siempre ha buscado en la medida de sus posibilidades darles lo que necesitan comodidad y seguridad en su vivienda el techo necesita ser reparado ya que se filtra el agua cada vez que llueve, desea empezar el trabajo lo más pronto posible porque las goteras son muchas; pero debido a su condición económica no posee de capital que lo respalde por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar lamina galvanizada, cemento, polines. Jorge Ardiles está muy contento con la ayuda y se siente comprometido a cancelar la deuda.
texts.en:
Jorge Ardiles, 28, has lived in his own house for the last three years with his grandmother and his little boy.  He works buying and selling cattle in various places in the zone.  He’s an enterprising man who is dedicated to his work and to his family.  Within the limits of his possibilities, Jorge is always looking for ways of giving them what they need: comfort and security at home.

The roof needs to be repaired because water leaks in every time it rains.  He wants to start this project as soon as possible because the leaks are numerous but because of his economic condition he lacks the capital to back him up which is why he’s asked FUSAI for a loan to buy galvanized metal sheets, cement and roofing purlins.  Jorge Ardiles is very happy with the help and feels committed to repay the loan.

loans.use: to repair the roof.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: María Elena de cuarenta y dos años  de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida, sus dos hijos y su nieto en casa propia desde hace algún tiempo. El esposo es albañil, además María Elena y su esposo siembran maíz y frijol, entre los dos logran el sustento diario del hogar. María una mujer emprendedora, responsable y muy humilde, necesita construir en su vivienda un cuarto para la cocina ya que la casa es muy pequeña y hay poco espacio, se ahorrará la mano de obra ya que ellos trabajaran en el cuarto, espera poder realizarlo lo más pronto posible pero no posee de capital suficiente que pueda costear los gastos de los materiales por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar  ladrillo, cemento, arena, lamina, etc. María Elena está muy contenta con la ayuda y asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda.
texts.en: María Elena, who is 42 years old, has been living with her life partner, her two children, and her grandson in her own home for some time. María Elena and her husband grow corn and beans, and between the two of them they support their household. María is a hardworking, responsible, and very humble woman. She needs to build a room for the kitchen in her home, since the house is very small and there is little space. They will save on labor by working on the room themselves. She hopes to be able to complete the project as soon as possible but she doesn't have enough capital to cover the cost of materials. That is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI, so that she can buy bricks, cement, sand, galvanized sheet metal, etc. María Elena is very happy with the help and assures us that she will be able to pay off the debt.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, and galvanized sheet metal to build a kitchen area.

loans.name: Lyubov

texts.ru: Любовь родилась в 1958 года. Она женщина с доброй душой. Любовь пережила много трудностей в жизни. Она вышла замуж и родила 2 детей, но вскоре ее муж умер, и она осталась вдовой. Ее дети совершеннолетние. Любовь старается, чтобы ее дети жили в достатке и счастлива. Она работает в государственной организации. Любовь получает маленькую зарплату, и ее зарплата не хватает, чтобы сделать сбережения и женить сына. Ее сыну 24 года и он хочет жениться на любимой девушки. Любовь запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони для проведения свадебного мероприятия сына. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Lyubov was born in 1958. She is a woman with a good heart. Lyubov has survived many difficulties in her life. She got married and had two children, but soon her husband died and she was left a widow. Her children are grown. Lyubov is trying for her children to live in prosperity and happiness. She works in a government organization. 

Lyubov receives a small salary and it is not enough to save up and put on a wedding for her son. Her son is 24 years old and wants to get married to a lovely young woman. 

Lyubov is requesting a loan of 2,500 somoni to put on a wedding celebration for her son.

loans.use: to put on a wedding celebration for her son

loans.name: Abduaziz

texts.ru: Абдуазиз порядочный человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Абдуазиз работает в частном колбасном цехе. Он всегда мечтал, чтобы его дети получили высшее образование. Его сын учится в университете. Его дочь Фарангис в этом году успешно окончила среднюю школу и поступила в Таджикский Государственный Университет Политики и Бизнеса по специальности Бухгалтер и Аудит. Она учится отлично. Абдуазиз должен оплатить за учебный договор свой дочери и с такой целью он запрашивает займ. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Abduaziz is a decent man. He is married with three children. Abduaziz works in a private sausage factory. He always dreamed that his children would receive a higher education. His son is studying in the university. 

This year, his daughter Farangis successfully graduated from high school and enrolled in the Tajik State University of Politics and Business with a specialty in accounting and audit. She is an excellent student. 

Abduaziz must pay tuition for his daughter and with this aim is requesting a loan.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a 52-year-old, married mother of five children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Lucia has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy weighing scales, plasticware, boxes and other paraphernalia.

Lucia has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy weighing scales, plasticware, boxes, and other paraphernalia.

loans.name: Hugo Bladimir

texts.es: Hugo Bladimir de treinta y dos años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos en casa propia. El es negociante de ganado, compra y vende reces, además cultiva maíz, su esposa le ayuda con el trabajo, entre los dos luchan para salir adelante; Hugo es un hombre responsable y de familia, siempre está luchando por darles una vida mejor, su vivienda necesita algunas reparaciones, primero encementar el piso porque aun está de tierra y genera mucho polvo, también quiere construir un pequeño cuarto para la cocina porque no hay suficiente espacio; espera realizar los arreglos lo más rápido posible, pues eso les dará más comodidad. Está decidido en solicitarle a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar los materiales cemento, lamina galvanizada,  ladrillos,  entre otros. Hugo Bladimir agradece la ayuda y se compromete a pagar la deuda.
texts.en:
Hugo Bladimir, who is 32 years old, lives with his life partner and their three children in the home they own. He is a livestock dealer, he buys and sells cattle. He also grows corn. His wife helps him with the work. Between the two of them, they do their best to get ahead. Hugo is a responsible family man, he is always fighting for his family and trying to give them a better life. 

His house needs some repairs. First he wants to pour cement on the floors, since they are still dirt floors and generate lots of dust. He also wants to build a small room for the kitchen because there isn't enough space. He hopes to complete the renovations as soon as possible, because he will have more comfort. He decided to request a loan from FUSAI in order to buy the materials: cement, galvanized sheet metal, bricks, and other items. 

Hugo Bladimir appreciates the help and promises to pay his debt.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, galvanized sheet metal, and bricks.

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru: Нигина трудолюбивая и умная женщина. Она родилась в 1975 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Дети еще е имеют источника дохода. Ее муж занимается перевозкой пассажиров. Нигина более 1 года работает в ИМОН ИНТЕРНЕШНЛ кассиром. Она выполняет свою работу качественно и имеет хорошую репутацию среди сотрудников. Нигина выделяет большое внимание на образование детей. Ее дочь поступила в Таджикский Государственный Университет Коммерции. Нигина должна оплатить за учебный договор своей дочери и с такой целью она обратилась за займом. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Nigina is a hardworking and clever woman. She was born in 1975. She is married with two children. The children do not yet have a source of income. Her husband is involved in passenger transport. For more than a year, Nigina has been working at IMON International as a cashier. She gets the job done efficiently and has a good reputation among her colleagues. 

Nigina puts a lot of attention into the education of her children. Her daughter enrolled in the Tajik State University of Commerce. Nigina needs to pay tuition for her daughter and with this aim applied for a loan.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition

loans.name: Mehrangez

texts.ru: Мехрангез трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина. Ей 27 лет. Она разведена и не имеет детей. Мехрангез после развода с мужем начала новый бизнес и новую жизнь. Она занимается купле продажей аксессуары мобильных телефонов. Мехрангез данное время введет свой бизнес успешно и имеет хорошую репутацию среди других бизнесменов. Она успешно введет своё дело и стремится развевать бизнес дальше. Она хочет пополнить оборотный капитал и с такой целью она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки аксессуары мобильных телефонов. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mehrangez is a hardworking and ambitious woman. She is 27 years old. She is divorced and has no children. 

After her divorce from her husband, Mehrangez began a new business and a new life. She is involved in the buying and selling of mobile phone accessories. Mehrangez in this time is successfully running her business and has a good reputation among other business people. She successfully conducts her work and strives to develop the business further. 

She wants to replenish her working capital and with that aim is requesting a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy mobile phone accessories.

loans.use: to buy mobile supplies to increase working capital

loans.name: Liliana Esther

texts.es: Liliana de 46 años de edad, habita en un municipio ubicado a orillas del mar caribe. Allí tiene una tienda donde vende ranchos, víveres, carnes, granos, verduras, lácteos, bebidas y artículos de la c canasta familiar. Liliana tiene 13 años de experiencia en este negocio, el cual inició en el año 2000, cuando viendo las necesidades sentidas en su sector, decidió vender al detalle artículos de la de consumo en los hogares, que la población compra a diario, en las medidas y proporciones que las requiere. Su idea fue tan acertada, que muy pronto empezó a generar ingresos vendiendo arroz, panela, verduras, carnes, frutas y bebidas frías. Hoy sigue en su negocio vendiendo de contado y a crédito todos los días, desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Liliana para ofrecer buenos precios, hace sus compras de contado en graneros y distribuidores mayoristas, que le ofrecen buenos descuentos, y así mismo transmite estos precios a su clientela. Su meta es continuar ampliando las ventas, para lograr que sus hijos sean profesionales;  fidelizar a su clientela, otorgándole  precios competitivos y un servicio excelente. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará abarrotes, verduras, bebidas y artículos de aseo, porque su propósito de vida, es lograr que sus 2 hijos, en las edades de 21 y 14 años,  se eduquen y alcancen un nivel universitario, para que tengan un potencial de éxito desde ahora
texts.en:
Liliana is 46 years old and lives in a municipality on the edge of the Caribbean sea. She has a store where she sells food, groceries, grains, vegetables, dairy products, drinks and basic household goods. Liliana has 13 years of experience in this business, which she started in 2000 after seeing the need for it in her community. She started selling everyday items that people buy on a regular basis, in the sizes and quantities that her customers wanted.  

Liliana’s intuition was very good, and she quickly began to make a profit. She started by selling rice, panela [unrefined whole cane sugar], vegetables, meat and cold drinks. Now she continues with her business, selling in both cash and on credit from 6 in the morning until 9 at night. To offer her customers good prices, Liliana says that she buys in cash from wholesalers and granaries that give her good discounts. She then passes the savings on to her customers. 

Liliana hopes to increase her sales so that she can help her children to become professionals. She wants to win her customer’s loyalty by offering them competitive prices and excellent service. 

Liliana is requesting her first loan from Kiva and the field partner to buy groceries, vegetables, drinks and toiletries for her store. She says that her goal in life is to see her two children, ages 21 and 14, receive a university education, so that they will realize their full potential to be successful.

loans.use: to buy groceries, vegetables, drinks and toiletries for her store.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has an ice cream vending business in the Philippines, and also earns income from fish vending. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en: Manuel is married and is running a buy-and-sell business selling used shoes and sandals for a living. He borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC to buy more imported shoes and sandals for resale. He hopes to earn more profit to build his own house for the better living of his family in the future.

loans.use: to buy more imported used shoes and sandals.

loans.name: Wendy Selena

texts.es: Wendy Selena de dieciocho años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y una hija de 11 meses. Ella es ama de casa, el esposo es quien trabaja en un carwash para poder sostener el hogar; Wendy es una mujer muy humilde y esta entregada a su familia, es lo más importante que tiene por lo que quiere darles  el calor de un hogar y una mayor seguridad, necesita construir su vivienda con paredes de lámina galvanizada y compra de madera para reforzarla por el momento no lo ha logrado debido a su baja condición económica, en el terreno solo posee columnas o pilares de madera y completar la instalación de lámina en el techo. Quiere empezar el trabajo lo más pronto posible pero no posee de capital que costee los gastos por eso se decidió solicitarle a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar de los materiales como lámina galvanizada, clavos, madera de pino y para la mano de obra tiene un conocido que les hará el trabajo. Wendy Selena está muy contenta con la ayuda.
texts.en:
Wendy Selena, eighteen years of age, lives with her life partner and an 11-month-old daughter. She is housewife and her husband works at a carwash to support his family.

Wendy is a very humble woman, whom is devoted to her family, which for her, it is the most important thing so she wants to give them lots of affection and security. 

She needs to finish her home with walls of galvanized sheet and to purchase wood to strengthen it. At the moment, she has not been able to due so because of her low economic conditions. Her house has four pillars of wood. She also needs to complete and finish the roof.

She wants to start the work as soon as possible but she doesn't have the capital. So, she decided to request to FUSAI, a Kiva's partner, a loan, which allows her to buy the materials like galvanized plate, nails, and pine wood. For the labor, she knows an acquaintance who will do the work. Wendy Selena is very satisfied with the help.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like galvanized plate, nails, and pine wood.

loans.name: Ider

texts.en: Mr. Ider, 40 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi services to the local people since 2012. His wife is a nurse and works at a hospital. Their eldest son studies at high school and younger son is in Kindergarten. He is requesting a loan of 3,800,000 MNT to purchase wooden doors, tiles and a bathtub. Recently, he made renovations to his apartment, but due to lack of finances, he didn't manage to repair the house fully. After repairing his bathroom, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place without worrying about the incoming winter.

loans.use: to purchase tiles, wooden doors and a bathtub.

loans.name: Kobenkoun Group

texts.fr:
Kobenkoun est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans, sont mariées et au ont moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les tissus, la restauration, de patte d’arachide, etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de groupe. 
Kadiatou est un membre du groupe Kobenkoun assise  la tasse  contenant les sachets de pâte d’arachide sur ses jambes.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des sacs d’arachide pour les transformer en pâte. Elle se procure de ces arachides à Koutiala et effectue ses ventes  en détail et au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Kobenkoun comptent réaliser un bénéfice  moyen de 102.000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Kadiatou  compte réaliser  110 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Kobenkoun is a group of women from Koutiala who live in large, traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. On average, they are 40 years old and have at least four children.

This group of women has a business selling various articles such as fabric, restaurant items, peanut butter, etc. In order to grow their business, the members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. This is their 10th group loan. 

Kadiatou is the group member who is seated with a tub of peanuts on her lap. She would like to use her loan to buy sacks of peanuts so that she can make peanut butter. She buys her peanuts in Koutiala and sells her products out of her home and in the market to a diverse customer base that pays retail prices in cash. 

While the other group members each plan on earning an average monthly profit of 102,000 FCFA during this cycle, Mme Kadiatou plans on earning 110,000 FCFA.

Beyond the repayment of the loans, they use a part of their income to pay their personal expenses and to grow their business.

loans.use: buy peanuts.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en: As a married mother of two children, Loida works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Loida is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more items like sugar, shampoo and other groceries. Loida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF and more recently through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her child to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like sugar, shampoo and other groceries.

loans.name: Huyen

texts.en: Huyen would like to take a further loan to buy coffee and beverages to sell from  her stall. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy coffee and many other kinds of beverages to sell at her food stall.

loans.name: Thon

texts.en: Thon would like to take another loan to buy a laundry machine to serve more customers. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine for her laundry business.

loans.name: Mary Joan

texts.en: As a married mother of three children, Mary Joan works hard to support her family. She has a plasticware sales business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Mary Joan is borrowing 10,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase more stocks of plasticware to resell to her customers. Mary Joan has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of plasticware to resell.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is 49 years old and married with three children.

Melba works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned goods, snack foods, and other groceries.

Melba has borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Melba aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, snack foods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: La  señora Elizabeth se dedico  a la venta de jugo de noni ya que  paso a lo largo del tiempo por muchas circunstancias y trabas que se le interpusieron, su familia es muy  humilde por lo que  desde niña no tenía una buena situación económica, por lo que ella tuvo que trabajar desde niña dejando los estudios para así poder ayudar a su familia, además de vender estos jugos de noni,  por las noches se dedica a preparar y vender platitos de tripitas fritas. La señora Elizabeth con los ingreso que genera de estas dos actividades tiene que sustentar a sus tres hijos y a su negocio para seguir adelante, es por esta razón que ella está solicitando un préstamo para ampliar su negocio y así poder mejorar sus ingresos, así podrá ofrecerles a sus hijos una buena educación para que tengan un mejor futuro y no pasen por las necesidades que paso ella.
texts.en:
Elizabeth sells noni juices after having dealt with many circumstances and obstacles for a while that stood in her way. Her family is very humble because she grew up without economic stability. She had to work from a young age and left school in order to help her family in addition to selling noni juices. At night, she prepares and sells fried tripes.

With her income from these two jobs, Elizabeth has to take care of three children and her business to move forward. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to expand her business and improve her income. This will help her offer her children a good education so they can have a better future and so they don't go without the necessities that she did.

loans.use: to expand her business selling noni juices

loans.name: Tsogoo

texts.en: Mr. Tsogoo, 59 years old, lives with his wife and son in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. The family resides in an apartment, and he never made any renovations since living there. He has been working as a driver in the branch office of the democratic party of Mongolia for twenty six years. His wife has retired from work and gets a state pension. He is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to purchase insulation and building materials such as vacuum insulated windows, fiberglass, foam, plates and hardwood floor. After renovating his apartment, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where heat will be preserved and energy saved.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is age 37, living with her two daughters and three sons in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a small vegetable shop for many years in a nearby town and earning a reasonable income. 

To grow his business, he is thinking of selling fruits in the evening so that he can increase his net income. With the passage of time, the inflation has been increasing day by day, but the sources of income remain constant. To increase his income, he wants to turn his enterprise towards progress, but for the purchase of fruits, he does not have a sufficient amount. He tried to borrow some money from his friends and relatives, but nobody helped him. Therefore, Shahnaz requested a loan for her husband so that her husband would be able to buy additional fruits to resell during the evening. Shahnaz says thank to Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fruits for her husband to resell.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en: Ma. Elena is 51 years old and married with five children. Ma. Elena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to resell. Ma. Elena has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from pig fattening. Ma. Elena aspires to save money to expand her business and to continue to send her child to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell.

loans.name: In

texts.en:
In is 54 years old and a widowed mother of four adult children of various ages. She is a housewife and farmer who has been farming rice and beans on her own land in the Kampong Thom province of Cambodia. She learned how to do this from her parents at an early age. Her short-term plans are to make her land fertile and productive and thereby increase her harvest because the entire family relies on this trade.

To maintain a good harvest, she is now asking for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR to buy pesticide spray to apply to her crops. Through the loan support, she hopes to earn a good profit after she has sold her product in the markets. She awaits your kindness, relies on your generosity and thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy pesticide spray to apply to her crops.

loans.name: Ma. Remy

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Ma. Remy works hard to support her family.

Ma. Remy operates a charcoal retail business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Ma. Remy is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more charcoal to sell to customers.

Ma. Remy has used her past three NWTF loans to sustain her business activities. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es: Adelaida, a sus 36 años de edad es madre de 2 hijos y vive en unión libre con su compañero sentimental. Durante un tiempo su familia pasó por una situación económica complicada, pues ella se encontraba desempleada y el salario de su esposo no alcanzaba para cubrir todos los gastos del hogar, por lo que ella decidió iniciar su propio negocio con el ánimo de generar recursos para aportar a la economía del hogar. Fue por ello que montó un almacén de variedades hace aproximadamente un año aún sin tener conocimiento sobre el manejo del mismo, sólo impulsada por su espíritu emprendedor y utilizando el método de prueba/error. En el establecimiento ofrece productos de papelería, de aseo personal, cosméticos y adicionalmente presta el servicio de café internet con 3 computadores que posee, de esta manera ha logrado generar los recursos suficientes para continuar solventando los gastos familiares. El crédito que solicita es para invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor (cuadernos, lápices, bolsas de regalo, cosméticos, productos de aseo, entre otros) y realizar mantenimiento y ampliar la memoria de los equipos de cómputo, así podrá prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, pues los equipos funcionarán más rápido y además tendrá variedad de productos disponibles para satisfacer las diferentes necesidades; esto se reflejará en el aumento de los ingresos que recibe diariamente, así irá organizando y acreditando su negocio, pues espera que en un futuro cercano pueda estabilizar su economía y brindar a sus hijos un mejor bienestar, educación y condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Adelaida is 36 years old and is the mother of two children.  She lives in a common-law marriage with her partner. At one time her family suffered through a financially difficult period when she was unemployed and her partner’s salary was not enough to cover household expenses.  So Adelaida decided to start her own business in order to generate income for her household and set up a general store about a year ago. Even though she had no experience, she was driven by her entrepreneurial spirit and used the trial and error method of running her store. In her store she offers paper goods, personal hygiene items, and cosmetics, and she also has three computers which she uses to provide an Internet café service. She has thus been able to generate sufficient revenue to continue to meet her household expenses.

The loan she is requesting is to invest in a variety of items at wholesale prices (notebooks, pencils, gift bags, cosmetics, and hygiene products, amongst others), and also to maintain her computers and expand the memory on them. This will allow her to provide better service to her customers because the computers will run faster and she will have more products available to meet their needs. This will result in an increase in her daily income allowing her to further organize and firmly establish her business.  She hopes that in the near future she can stabilize her finances and provide her children with better living conditions, a better education, and a better sense of well-being.

loans.use: to buy a variety of items at wholesale prices (notebooks, pencils, gift bags, cosmetics, and hygiene products, amongst others), and also to maintain her computers and expand the memory on them.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her capital and purchase many pagnes (traditional cloth) to resell, in order to increase her earnings

loans.name: Tubeheza Group

texts.fr:
Divine  fait partie du groupe  Tubeheza et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle  est mariée  à Willy, un  commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants âgés de 1 à  14 ans, dont 5 étudient. 
 
Elle fait le commerce de  chaussures    depuis 15 ans. 

Elle est  cliente de Turame depuis 5 ans. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de  chaussures  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle  voudrait acheter une parcelle  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Divine is a member of the Tubeheza group and lives in Bujumbura. She is married to Willy, a shopkeeper. Together they have 7 children between the ages of 1 and 14, 5 of whom attend school.

Divine has been in the shoe business for 15 years. She has been a Turame borrower for 5 years. With the Kiva loan she receives, she will increase her capital and purchase many shoes to resell in order to increase her earnings.

In the coming years, she would like to purchase a plot of land and to see her children continue their studies.

loans.use: to increase her capital and purchase many shoes to resell and increase earnings

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela lives in Lahore, Pakistan.

She used her old loans to purchase and maintain an auto rickshaw. Her husband has driven the rickshaw for many years. Due to constant use, the auto rickshaw is broken and needs proper maintenance. Therefore, Shakeela contacted Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, and requested a loan to fix the auto rickshaw.

She is grateful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to maintain her auto rickshaw

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Madame  Aminata est âgée de 47 ans,  mariée  et mère de 10 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille nucléaire au quartier Bagadadji de Ségou  (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant abandonné l’école pour se marier par son propre volonté, elle commence à faire le commerce sur propre initiative. Elle mena beaucoup d’activités génératrices de revenus (vente d’habits, chaussures, couvertures, savons et condiments) en plus de toutes ces activités elle vend du bois de chauffage et du charbon de bois. Cette dernière activité elle la mène depuis 25 ans.  
Dans  le but d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de faire face à la demande clientèle, elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 60 mois,  après 2 prêts solidaires et 4 prêts individuels    bien remboursés. Elle  est à son 5ème   prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 2 chargements de charrettes de bois de chauffe, 1 chargement de charbons de bois. Elle s’approvisionne sur place. 
Madame Aminata vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composé majoritairement de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA, qui lui sert à rembourser son prêt et à aider son mari  dans la prise en charge des dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Aminata is 47 years old, married, and the mother of 10 children. She lives with her immediate family in the Bagadadji neighborhood of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of Mali.) 

Having left school voluntarily in order to get married, Aminata began her business by her own initiative. She has run several small businesses (sale of clothes, shoes, blankets, soaps, and spices) and in addition to these businesses she currently resells firewood and charcoal. She has been in this business for 25 years.

In order to increase her business funds to meet the demands of her customers, Aminata turned to Soro Yiriwaso. She has partnered with them for the last 60 months, with 2 group loans and 4 individual loans all having been fully repaid. She is on her 5th individual loan which she plans to use to purchase 2 loads of firewood and 1 load of charcoal. She stocks up in the same location. Aminata sells on a cash and credit basis to a customer base made up mostly of women. 

She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA, which she will use to repay the loan and to help her husband with the family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase firewood and charcoal

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame  Fatoumata  est âgée de 64 ans,  mariée  et mère de 2 enfants, elle vit dans une famille nucléaire  avec son mari et  ses enfants au quartier Bagadadji de Ségou  (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons sociales, car issue d’une famille traditionaliste Dogon, elle commença très tôt à  mener le petit commerce seule. Les activités génératrices elle l’effectue  depuis 25 ans et jouit d’une grande clientèle et expérience. Sa force de vente est due à la qualité de son riz Gamiaka très prisé des consommateurs. En plus elle reçoit fréquemment  de la commande de son voisinage mais également de Bamako où elle dispose d’un vaste réseau de  clientèle. 
Dans  le but d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de faire face à la demande clientèle, elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 48  mois,  après 2 prêts solidaires et 2 prêts individuels bien remboursés. Elle  est à son 3ème   prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter 1 tonne de riz. Elle s’approvisionne à Niono. 
Madame   Fatoumata  vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée  de femmes majoritairement. Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70.000 FCFA, qui lui sert à rembourser son prêt et à aider son mari  dans la prise en charge des dépenses familiales. Son ambition est de diversifier son activité.
texts.en:
Fatoumata is 64 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children. She lives in a nuclear family with her husband and children in the Bagadadji neighborhood of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of Mali.) Not having attended school for social reasons, due to being in a traditional Dogon family, she began conducting her small business independently at an early age. She has been in business for 25 years and enjoys a large customer base and has the benefit of extensive experience.

Fatoumata's strength in her business is due to the quality of her Gamiaka rice, highly popular with consumers. In addition, she often receives orders from her neighbors and also from Bamako where she has a large customer base. In the hope of increasing her business funds in order to meet her customers' needs, she turned to Soro Yiriwaso. Fatoumata has been in a partnership with them for 48 months, during which time her 2 group loans and 2 individual loans have been fully repaid.

Fatoumata is on her 3rd individual loan which she plans to use to purchase 1 ton of rice. She stocks up in Niono, and sells for cash and credit to a customer base made up mostly of women. Fatoumata hopes to earn a monthly profit of 70,000 francs CFA, which she will use to pay back her loan and to help her husband care for the family's expenses. Her dream is to expand and diversify her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice

loans.name: Cevero

texts.es: Cevero de 40 año es un hombre soltero sin hijos y con una vivienda propia construida  a base de material noble comparte sus vivencias familiares junto a sus hermanos y padres. Cevero se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y productos comestibles en una tienda en el primer piso de su hogar. Desempeña su negocio con ayuda de familiares que lo apoyan ya que se caracteriza por tener una familia muy unida. Su actual negocio le permite ofrecer a los clientes diversa variedad de bebidas heladas tales como gaseosas, cremoladas; entre otros, así como golosinas y otros que tiene una buena demanda en los que acuden a su negocio. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Para esta ocasión requiere contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de gaseosas al por mayor y golosinas tales como galletas y caramelos que tienen alta demanda en su negocio.
texts.en:
Cevero at 40 years old is single and has no children. He lives in his own solidly constructed house which he shares with his parents and siblings. Cevero sells soft drinks and food products in a store located on the ground floor of the family house. He carries out his business with the help from family members who support him as it is a very close family. His business offers a good variety of cold drinks such as pop and "cremoladas" (almost a slushie but with real fruit pulp) etc. as well as candy and other things that are in demand by his clients who come to his store. 

This is Cevero's third loan with Kiva and he will use the 2000 PEN to buy soft drinks wholesale and candy such as cookies and caramels which are in high demand in his store. He is grateful for the financial assistance that allows him to get ahead and promises to pay his installments on time.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, cookies and candy.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fruit so she can replenish her stocks for the winter.

loans.name: Unificada Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UNIFICADA II” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Felicidad es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, producción de mantillas, venta de objetos de plásticos, carnicería, venta de pipocas, atención de parqueo, tienda de abarrotes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Felicidad es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo instalaron ella y su esposo al observar la necesidad de sus vecinos, implementaron este negocio ya que ellos querían generar nuevos ingresos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de aceite, azúcar, fideo, arroz) que adquirirá de las ferias tradicionales, por mayor, y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y el área de salud.
texts.en:
The A.C. “UNIFICADA II” will start their first phase with Pro Mujer at the Senkata Focal Center. It is made up of eight members and is governed by a board of directors and Felicidad is the President. 

There are several different businesses among the community association members. Some of the businesses are: neighborhood store, blanket maker, selling plastic objects, butcher, popcorn vendor, valet and grocery store. 

The loan will help the small business owner members such as Felicidad. She joined Pro Mujer a year ago. She joined through the invite of a friend who was a member of the institution. 

Currently she owns a neighborhood store. She tells that her and her husband started the business when they noticed the needs of their neighbors. 

They started the business to generate new income. 

The loan will be used to increase capital (buy oil, sugar, beans and rice) that they will buy at traditional fairs, wholesale and then sell it in their store. 

This type of work allows her to create an income to help support her family since she is married and has seven children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the loan and the health area.

loans.use: buy oil, beans, rice

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame  Fatoumata est âgée de 31 ans,  mariée  et mère de 3 enfants, elle vit dans une famille traditionnelle  avec son mari et   ses enfants au quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou  (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant abandonné l’école âpres la classe de 9ème année fondamentale (système éducatif malien) pour se marier, elle commence à faire le commerce d’habits de seconde auprès d’une parente, après quelques moment d’apprentissage elle évolue seule depuis 2 ans, sa force de vente est due à la qualité de sa marchandise mais également à son prix préférentiel que celui de ses conquérants. Elle dispose d’un vaste de clientèle composée de revendeur. 
Dans  le but d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de faire face à la demande clientèle, elle  fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est  à son 1er    prêt individuel qu’elle utilisera pour acheter 2 balles d’habits de friperies. Elle s’approvisionne sur place. Madame  Fatoumata vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes majoritairement. Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA, qui lui sert à rembourser son prêt et à aider son mari  dans la prise en charge des dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Fatoumata is 31 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children. She lives in a traditional family with her husband and children in the Hamdallaye neighborhood of Ségou, the fourth administrative region of Mali. Having left school after her 9th year (in the Malian system) in order to get married, Fatoumata began a second-hand clothes business, first as an apprentice to her parent's business and then on her own for the last two years. 

Fatoumata's business success is due to the quality of her merchandise but also to her competitive prices compared to the competition. She has a wide customer base made up of resellers. With the goal of increasing her business funds to meet the demands of her customers, Fatoumata turned to Soro Yiriwaso. She sells for both cash and credit to a customer base made up of mostly women.

With this loan, Fatoumata hopes to earn a monthly profit of 75,000 francs CFA, which she will use to pay back the loan and to help her husband provide for their family's expenses.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her education costs

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia tiene 29 años es una mujer que vive junto a su esposo y su hija de 8 años en su casa propia. Posee una parcela donde  produce cacao orgánico ya que es uno de los productos con mayor demanda en su zona. Por su lado se caracteriza por ser una persona muy trabajadora ya que según comenta su familia tiene ese don.
Lleva 3 años a cargo de de esta labor y siempre lo ha hecho con mucha energía. Desempeña su trabajo con apoyo de su pareja quien desde siempre realizar esta labor con la mayor dedicación posible. Para el normal desempeño de sus actividades requiere contar con capital para la compra de abono orgánico el cual es necesario para que sus plantaciones obtengan una producción de calidad al finalizar cosecha. Al finalizar la campaña productiva vende sus productos a los compradores del lugar y esto le permite obtener buenos ingresos en recompensa al esfuerzo aplicado. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
En esta oportunidad contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Delia is a 29 year old woman who lives with her husband and eight year old daughter in their own home. She has a plot of land where she grows organic cocoa which is one of the products in high demand in her area. She claims she is hard-working and her family says she certainly is. She has done this for three years and has put a lot of effort into it. 

Delia carries out this labor along with her husband who has always worked with great dedication. To properly carry out this activity you have to have the capital to buy organic fertilizer, which is necessary to achieve a quality product come harvest time. At the end of the growing season she sells the product to local buyers. This allows her to obtain good income as recompense for all the labor involved. 

This is Delia's second loan with Kiva and this time she will use the 2000 PEN to buy organic fertilizer. She is grateful for the financial support which allows her to get ahead. She promises to pay her installments punctually.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Hamida

texts.ru: Хамида 40 лет. Она вдова и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Она является единственной кормилицей семьи. Хамида уже несколько лет работает в больнице в должности бухгалтера. Она работает упорно и качественно. Хамида всегда мечтала, чтобы ее дети получили высшее образование. Двое из ее детей учатся в университете. Хамида должна оплатить за учебный договор своих детей и с такой целью она обратилась за займом. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Hamida is 40 years old.  She is a widow who is raising three children.  She is the breadwinner in her family.  For a number of years, Hamida has been working as an accountant at a hospital.  She works hard and efficiently.  Hamida has always dreamed that her children would receive university education.  Currently, two of her children are studying at the university.  

Hamida is asking for a loan to pay for her children's education.  She needs 7500 somoni to pay for the university tuition costs.  She is waiting for your kindness and is hoping for your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for her children's university tuition.

loans.name: Fazeelat

texts.en:
Fazeelat is 52 years old and married, the mother of five children.  She and her family live in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  

She is very talented and excellent at sewing.  She sews for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

For this reason, Fazeelat has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. She intends to use this loan to buy packs of lace, zippers, and buttons, and more spools of thread in different colors. In this way she will be able to sew more dresses on time to generate a healthier source of income. 

She is in her sixth loan cycle, and she has a good repayment history. She hopes to expand her business in the near future to meet her household expenses more efficiently. 

Fazeelat says thank you to Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy lace, spools, needles, zippers, and buttons for tailoring.

loans.name: Lasmi

texts.en:
This is the story of Hartini, daughter of Lasmi:

I chose accounting because I am sure this will bring me toward my dream. Making a new adaptation with new conditions at school is maybe a little bit hard for me, but it’s ok. I can overcome. Some fun things for me are having many friends and studying with friendly teachers. 

I would like to thank the Kiva program. My family was helped, so I can continue my study in spite of my family being poor. 

My hometown is Brebeg village, Jeruklegi subdistrict, Cilacap Regency, Mid Java Province, Indonesia. The roads around my village are bad, with many holes, muddy and rocky. It’s difficult to pass by. My parents are farmers. Their salary is low and not enough to fulfill the needs of us. Their salary is around Rp. (Rupiah) 200,000 per month. 

The number of children in my family are six. They are Lasimin (35 years old), Lasinah (33 years old), Haryati (29 years old), Turiman (26 years old), Endang Susiati (19 years old), and me (16 years old). I am the only child who is studying at school. With this loan, I can go to school again, and I hope I can reach my dream. My family is very grateful to Kiva.

In this school, I will study about accounting lessons. I want to get a job as an accountant and can help my parents.

loans.use: to pay for education fees at the vocational school.

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en:
Mr. Bayarsaikhan, who is 55 years old, lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. They have two adult children; both of them moved out and live with their own families. 

Bayarsaikhan has been working as a driver for 32 years and enjoys his job. His wife works at a hospital. 

He is requesting a loan of MNT 700,000 to purchase planks to fence his land. He is extending his land by purchasing a neighbor's land.  He is planning to grow vegetables on his extended land next year.

loans.use: to purchase planks to fence his land for a vegtable garden

loans.name: Hun's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Hun is 32 years old and married. She is a breadwinner in a family consisting of five children who are in school. Her business counts on a well-known cash-crop of the local area, cassava and cashew farming. This is a business she had for 14 years.

With this new loan, she and her co-borrower are fourth-cycled clients with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and are seeking 1,400,000 KHR each. 

As the leader, Dambae will spend her loan portion to plow her farmland and buy insecticide for it. Additionally, she will spend some portion of it to pay for labor cost for her farmland. 

She hopes to gain a good yield from her crop so that she can triple her income and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to plow her farmland, buy insecticide for it, and pay for labor cost.

loans.name: Señor De Lagunas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SEÑOR DE LAGUNAS” iniciará el décimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Máxima es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chinelas, venta de comida, venta de chuño, venta de celulares, venta de joyas, venta de pollo, tejido de mantas, venta de ferretería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Máxima es integrante, ella indica que hace quince años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su padre que es socio de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de papa; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su hermana , quien comercializaba el mismo producto, cuenta que al iniciar la venta inicio con un capital de 100:- mismo que fue ampliando con los créditos que realizó en Pro Mujer
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa) que adquirirá de las ferias tradicionales, por mayor, del departamento de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y el ahorro.
texts.en:
The “SEÑOR DE LAGUNAS” communal bank is in their eleventh cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes regional office. It is made up of eight members, lead by a Board of Directors, with Máxima as President. The members have a variety of business amongst which are: the sale of slippers, the sale of "chuño (dried potatoes), cell-phone sales, selling jewellery,  the sale of chickens, sewing blankets, and selling hardware. The loan will help all these micro-entrepreneurs.

Máxima says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for fifteen years, joining on the invitation of her father who was also a member of the institution. Currently she has a business selling potatoes. She says she learned the business from her sister who sells the same product. She started selling with a capital of 100 BOB. This was amplified by the loans that she's received through pro Mujer.  

The loan that Máxima is currently requesting is to increase her capital (buying potatoes) which she buys at the traditional markets, wholesale, in the department of La Paz. She then sells them in her commercial space. This allows her to generate the resources needed to support her family. She is married and has five children. When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer her reply was that she liked the loans and the saving.

loans.use: to buy potatoes.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
This is Marie. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Marie dreams that her business will flourish more and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her life and business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to stock her variety store.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 48 years old.  She is married and blessed with four children.  Her eldest is now working as a chemical engineer and is able to help her with school fees of his three siblings.  The family lives in South Western Poblacion, Calamba Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines.

Hannah engages in her small tailoring business. She has been in this business for more than 10 years now, earning a monthly income of PHP 3,200. 

She has requested a new loan to purchase materials to be used in dressmaking and also for maintenance expense. 

She became a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC just last year. She is striving hard to earn more.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies and materials used for her tailoring.

loans.name: Phen

texts.en:
Phen, aged 51, lives in his own house with his spouse and seven children in Kampong Thom province. He is a very responsible and hard-working father.

He has made a living in agriculture and in sourcing and purchasing hair for beauty uses.  From his effort and perseverance, he can make a net profit of KHR 16,000 per day. His wife also helps in him in the same businesses.

Phen has applied for a loan to increase his capital for the purchase of hair, which he will sell to local hairdressers for their needs.    

With the loan, he will be able to continue with his work, improve his income, and give his family more financial stability. Phen thanks lenders for their constant support. He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to increase his capital for the purchase of hair, which he sells to local hairdressers.

loans.name: Noeme

texts.en:
Noeme is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Noeme is borrowing 18000 PHP (Philippine pesos) through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Noeme has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
This is Myra, 39, resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Eduardo, a driver, and they have children. She, together with her husband, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Myra operates a piggery. She earns by selling live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes they have the pigs slaughtered and sold in the market. Aside from this, she also cooks breakfast meals for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,200 in sales every week.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy feeds and additional hogs. 

Myra's dream is to expand her business, and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy feeds and additional hogs.

loans.name: Hina

texts.en:
Hina is 35 and is living with her husband.
Her husband is a service provider; he provides the light decoration services on marriage, birthday and engagement ceremonies. His business does not work well because this is a seasonal business. In the off season he works over at an electrician shop and provides the services of troubleshooting electrical components for the customers. In the off season the decoration lights remain unused and become out of order.
Now the marriage ceremony season is going on and he does not have decoration lights to provide services. 
Therefore, Hina requested a loan for her husband so that he could buy new decoration lights to provide the decoration services. 
Hina says thank you to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy decorative light strings.

loans.name: Borbandi

texts.en:
Mr. Borbandi, 38 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been selling firewood to local people since 2008. His wife stays at home looking after their youngest child. Their eldest son goes to high school and the second one is being educated in kindergarten.
