Borbandi is requesting a loan of 4300000 MNT (Mongolian tugrik) to purchase firewood in large quantities from a lumberjack so that he can continue to sell firewood without worrying about inventory shortage. Borbandi is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better life.

loans.use: to purchase lumber

loans.name: Miriam De La Paz

texts.es: Doña Miriam, es habitante de un barrio muy pobre de Managua, actualmente tiene bajo su cargo a dos de sus hijos quienes estudian en colegios públicos, su mayor deseo es que ellos terminen una carrera profesional. Miriam es una persona emprendedora, hacia comida y vendía pero le  fue mal por lo que ahora se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de manera ambulante. Solicita el crédito para invertir en mejorar su hogar ya que este presenta deterioro en el techo en la parte principal de la sala y también pondrá cerámica en el piso, con el financiamiento comprara materiales como láminas de zinc, perlines, cemento, cerámica y el pago de mano de obra.
texts.en: Doña Miriam lives in a very poor neighborhood of Managua. She now has two of her sons, who are in public elementary schools, in her care. Her greatest wish is that they finish studying for careers. Miriam is an entrepreneurial person. She was making food and selling it, but it went badly for her, so now she sells cosmetics as a street vendor. She is applying for the loan to invest in improving her home, since the roof is now deteriorated in the main part of the house, and she will also put tile on the floor. With the loan, she will buy materials such as sheets of zinc, purlins, cement, and tile, and also pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy materials such as zinc sheets, purlins, cement, and tile, and pay for labor

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
This is Evelyn, 37, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Antonio, her business partner, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Evelyn operates a repacking business. What she basically does is buy different products from wholesalers, repacks them and sells them for profit. Her regular customers are neighbor and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of garlic, pepper, laurel and other seasoning to expand her product inventory. 

Evelyn hopes to expand her business and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more quantities of garlic, pepper, laurel, and other seasonings to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Alfredo Luis

texts.es:
Alfredo de 30 años, desde hace un año emprendió su propio negocio: él muy observador de la realidad comunitaria, se dio cuenta que las personas no contaban con máquinas de lavar y que este servicio, que mejora los tiempos de trabajo de las amas de casa, no existía en su barrio. Así fue como a falta de competencia, se dedicó a alquilar lavadoras en su propio barrio, ubicado en el municipio de Soledad, a 15 minutos de la ciudad principal, donde habita con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 3 y 5 años de edad. 
A Alfredo sus clientes lo llaman por teléfono, para solicitarle el servicio de alquiler de lavadoras y él,  lleva las máquinas a la residencia de cada familia, que lo contrata por horas. Su trabajo es intenso y lo realiza de lunes a domingos, desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde y sus principales clientes son sus propios vecinos, quienes le remiten nuevos compradores de servicios de lavandería. Su meta mas adelante, es extender su ruta hacia otros sectores que aun no cuentan con ese servicio, pero su capacidad de respuesta no es suficiente para lograrlo. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  nuevas lavadoras, para responder poco a poco a la demanda potencial del mercado, porque su mayor desafío es la competencia y el gasto en la reparación de sus antiguas máquinas.
texts.en:
One year ago, Alfredo, 30, launched his own business. Being very observant of life in his community, he realized that residents didn't have washing machines and that this service, which lessens the workload of housewives, did not exist in his neighborhood. So it happened that, in the absence of competition, he started to rent out washing machines in his own neighborhood. His neighborhood is located in the municipality of Soledad, 15 minutes away from the main city where he lives with his spouse and two children, aged 3 and 5. 

Alfredo's clients call him by telephone to request his rental washing machine service, and he brings the washing machines to each family's residence where he is paid by the hour. His job is intense and he works from Monday to Sunday from 7AM until 6PM. His main clients are his own neighbors, who send new clients to his rental washing machine service. His future goal is to extend his route towards other sectors that still don't have this service, but his response capacity is not sufficient enough to achieve this. This is the reason why he is turning to a Kiva loan: the first loan that he is taking out from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this loan, he will buy new washing machines in order to gradually respond to the potential market demand because his greatest challenge is competition and the expense of repairing his older machines.

loans.use: to buy new washing machines.

loans.name: Odmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Odmaa, 37 years old, lives with her husband and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in an old house on a plot of land. She has been running a grocery store since 2003. Her husband renders taxi service to local people. 

They moved to their house 10 years ago and since that time, never made any renovations to their house. So, she is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase vacuum-insulated windows, hardwood floors, fiberglass and cement. Using those materials, her husband will make renovations to the old house, thus creating a comfortable and warm place. In this energy-preserving house, heat loss will be minimal, and the family will burn less coal for heating, thus releasing less pollutants into the atmosphere.

loans.use: to purchase building materials for renovating the old house.

loans.name: Momela (One) Group

texts.en:
Merina, who is in her mid 30s, is married with two children who are still going to school. She has been a food vendor for 10 years now. She works from 6 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This is her 12th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more food inventories and has paid back all her previous loans successfully. With the business profit earned,she has been able to cover school fees and household expenses. She also used the money to buy a mattress, TV, radio, saucepans for her business and a plot of land.  

Merina will use this loan to increase the food stock for her food stall. She dreams of one day owning a big hotel servicing more people. 
She will share this loan with her loan group "MOMELA (one)" which totals seven members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase their food stock.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica offers bananas and operates a general store within her locality. She is 35 years old and married to a manufacturer of charcoal. Veronica has almost five years in the business, and she has been able to improve it since the very beginning. Veronica’s children currently go to school.

Veronica plans to invest her income from the business to be able to support her children's education. Last time, Veronica borrowed 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) for the improvement of her general store. The generated income was used to renovate her house. Now, she is asking for another loan amounting to 12,000 PHP to buy stock of merchandise such as spices, snack foods, breads and drinks. 

She and her husband will continue to work hard in order to obtain their plans and earn higher income than her usual profit. In this way, they could let their children finish their studies and have a better way of living.

loans.use: to buy stock of merchandise such as spices, snack foods, breads and drinks for her general store.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 35-year-old married woman living with her five children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband has four rickshaws which he has given to the drivers on daily wages. They committed over mutual understanding on specific daily wages, and it is decided that the drivers will only drive the rickshaw, and the owner will be responsible for all depreciation. Nowadays, two rickshaws are badly depreciated and need a healthy amount for repairing. A little bit of maintenance he can fix through his daily income, but this time he is facing extraordinary depreciation, and he does not have a healthy amount to fix the problem.

Therefore, Saima requested a loan for her husband so that her husband could fix the problem of both rickshaws. Saima is very thankful to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of two auto rickshaws.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul lives in Punjab, Pakistan with his family. He is the only working person in the family. He owns a sewing machine shop in the market where he offers both types of sewing machines, electric and non-electric. He finds he has an insufficient variety to offer, and therefore he cannot attract many customers. He wants to add more variety in the shop. However, due to a lack of money he finds it difficult.

Therefore, he has requested a Kiva loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase more machines for the shop. This will not only help him to attract more customers, but to increase his net income and savings as well.

Adbul wants to thank all Kiva lenders for their kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of sewing machines to sell.

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es: Aydee tiene  30 años y vive junto a su esposo y su hija en su casa propia construida a base de adobe. Aydee se dedica a la agricultura al lado de su pareja en un terreno de 1 hectárea, el cual le heredaron sus suegros por estar a la espera de su menor hija. Tiene conocimientos sólidos sobre agricultura porque creció en el campo junto a sus padres aprendiendo así este humilde oficio que también sostiene económicamente a muchas familias de su región. Para mejorar la calidad de su producción fertiliza sus terrenos de cultivo con abono orgánico. Le agrada mucho participar en la cosecha ya que tras el secado correspondiente de sus productos los lleva hasta los centros de venta ubicados en su localidad donde recibe a cambio una buena ganancia que le permite justificar el dinero que invirtió en la campaña productiva. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico al por mayor.
texts.en:
Aydee is 30 years old and lives together with her husband and daughter in their own adobe house. Aydee works in agriculture along with her husband on a 1-hectare plot of land, which she inherited from her parents-in-law and which is being held in wait for her young daughter. She has solid knowledge about agriculture, as she grew up in the fields next to her parents learning this humble job that also economically sustains many families in her region. 

In order to improve her production quality, she fertilizes her cropland with organic fertilizer. It is very pleasing to her to participate in the harvest. After the corresponding drying of her products, she takes them to the sales center located in her community, where she receives excellent earnings in exchange, which allows her to justify the money that she invested in the productive season. 

This is her third loan with Kiva, and she feels grateful for the financial support that she receives in order to get ahead. In addition, she is committed to paying off her quotas in a timely manner. This time, she is hoping for 1,000 nuevos soles to purchase wholesale organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer in bulk.

loans.name: Leonides

texts.en:
Leonides is married to a welder and she has four children. She operates a tailoring services in their own home, which is located in the village of Aurora in Zamboanga del Sur to make a living. She has been in this business for thirty years, earning at least twenty thousand a month aside from other activities that she earns money from. 

She wants to borrow a loan from Gata Daku MPC to repair sewing machines used in the business and buy additional textiles. An amount of 40,000 PHP will make her business improve and run smoothly. Her hope is to expand the services to gain more profit for the future needs of her family.

loans.use: to repair sewing machines used in the business and buy additional textiles

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
This is Belen. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of bags to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to pay for more quantities and varieties of bags to expand her product inventory. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Belen hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she grows and finds strength from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more quantities and varieties of bags to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 44 years old and married with two children.

Sarah works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy items like egg, sugar, shampoo, spices, and other groceries.

Sarah has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 22 years and also earns an income from clothing sales.

Sarah aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like egg, sugar, shampoo, spices, and other groceries.

loans.name: Asernal Group

texts.en:
Ritha, who is a married woman with two daughters, is in her early 30s. Her children are still in school. Ritha is a businesswoman running two projects:  selling fried pork and managing a fruit and vegetable business. She has been in these activities for seven years now. She starts working at 06:30 am until 9 pm daily and is able to make good monthly returns. 

This is Ritha's third loan from Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more pork which she sold to more people. She has paid back all her previous loans successfully. Ritha's business profit is used to cover school fees for her daughters. She also used it to buy more bricks for her house construction. She will use this loan to buy more pork to resell. Ritha is doing great in her businesses. She dreams that one day she will be able to finish building her house. 

Ritha will share this loan with her loan group "Asernal" which consist of 14 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more pork to resell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 58 years old, married and engages in selling native cakes as well as hog raising.  Her husband is a farm laborer in their village. The couple has been blessed with four children; three are married and the eldest is still single. Teresita sells her native cakes using her bicycle with a cart. She sells them around her village and nearby villages. Usually, she is able to sell her native cakes before lunch time, after which, she had nothing to do, so she decided to engage herself in hog raising. 

At her age, Teresita is getting older and she aims to make her businesses stable. For her dreams to be realized, she requests additional capital of PHP15,000 which allows her to buy hog feed to ensure proper nutrition for her pigs. Teresita is optimistic about the future.

loans.use: to buy hog feed

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 58 years old and married with 3 children. Teresa works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requests a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Teresa has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as rice, soap, sugar, spices and other groceries.  In the future Teresa would like to save money to expand her business and renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
This is Gregorio. His previous loan was a big help in his business. He was able to buy more fish nets and scouring pads for his business. His loan also helped in sending his children to school. The income from his business assisted in their everyday expenses at home. He has been in this business for ten years now. He and his wife are helping each other to provide for their everyday expenditures.

He would like to apply for a 16,000 PHP loan for him to buy more fishnets and scouring pads needed in his business. The profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his family's daily needs and educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this expected profit with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Gregorio hopes that his business will grow bigger and dreams to have their own house and lot. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more nets and scouring pads needed in his business

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Mr. Muhammad is a 55-year-old married man and active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Punjab, Pakistan. His wife is a very hardworking and responsible housewife.

Since 2000, Mr. Muhammad has been selling curtains. Which is the only source of income for his family. He purchases a variety of curtains from different areas and sells them in the local market. 

Currently, he is in need of replacing old varieties with new ones. However, due to financial constrains he finds this difficult. For that reason, he has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him to attract more customers but will increase his net income and savings as well. He desires to provide quality education to his children. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: To purchase a variety of curtains to sell

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat is 40 and the mother of 7 children. Her husband owns a shop in which he has 4 compression molding machines. He takes orders for manufacturing plastic bottles, toys, small bicycle wheels, and plastic accessories. He appoints laborers to operate the  molding machines and pays them daily. For the manufacturing of different plastic accessories he needs different categories and quality of raw material. This time he has taken a larger contract than before but does not have enough capital to buy good quality crushing plastic to continue his manufacturing. 
Therefore, Nusrat requests a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy crushing plastic raw material for his business. 
Nusrat has to look after a huge family, she has to take care of her each child, their school fees, their diet and their health. For these purposes she needs income and his husband is the only person who is responsible to bear household expenses. 
Nusrat is very happy after taking this loan and thanks Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. She belongs to this group of 2 borrowers.

Note: Nusrat is in the red dress in the given picture.

loans.use: To buy crushing plastic for his business

loans.name: Marfina

texts.en:
Marfina is happy for the life that she has. She is married and owns a sari-sari store. According to her, the only business she had before this was a farm which was not enough to meet the basic necessities of her family and send her three children to school. With her situation, Marfina did not stop believing that someday she would be able to overcome these trials.

Marfina is grateful because her three children finished their college education and have degrees. All of them are now working abroad in accordance with their own profession. Marfina admits that she receives remittances from her children but she doesn’t want to rely on them. Instead, she wants to have her own source of income for which she can gain profit. Marfina requests a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy shampoo, toothpaste, conditioner and seasonings. She hopes that the amount she requests will be granted for her to earn profit to deal with emergencies that may arise in the family.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, toothpaste, conditioner and seasonings for her variety store

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 58 years old and married with four children.

Estrella works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requests a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase snack food, bread, coffee, laundry soap, soft-drinks, etc. to sell in her general store.

Estrella has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns additional income from selling gasoline. Estrella aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase snack food, bread, coffee, laundry soap, soft-drinks, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 61 years old and widowed with eight children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Evelyn has been farming rice for 40 years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Warlito

texts.en: Warlito runs a cafeteria in his village in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He has three children and is still studying. For ten years, he has managed this business and wants to improve it in order to gain more profit. He requests a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients and pots for his cafeteria. His ultimate dream is to build a house to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients and pots for his cafeteria

loans.name: Ran's Group

texts.en: Ran is a rural villager in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is 43 years old and has one child. To support her family, she raises pigs as the main source of her family’s income and works as a paid worker who taps rubber trees to collect latex at a rubber plantation as supplementary income. Having been in this business for 25 years, she can earn about 41,700 KHR per day. Ran has never been with VisionFund before. Now she and her co-member are applying for 500,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will use her loan to buy pig feed to nourish her pigs. She hopes to fatten them in a healthy condition so as to sell them for a good price to better her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

loans.name: Candelaria Obe

texts.es: Doña Candelaria, oriunda del departamento de Beni, tiene tres hijos, cuatro nietos y un bisnieto, viuda hace seis años atrás, ella ya cumplira sus 60 años, pero a pesar de la edad se mantiene sana, fuerte, trabajadora y sobre todo una señora muy amable y responsable. Doña Cande, como se hace llamar ya viene radicando en la poblacion de Chimore unos treinta años aproximadamente, cuenta ella, junto con su esposo compraron una casita que tiene un atractivo turistico (La Laguna), trabajaron juntos en beneficio de su familia, pero lamentablemente perdio a su esposo. Desde entonces ella siguio trabajando, con el cuidado de niños y la venta de comida. Sin embargo ella ya quiere llevar una vida mas tranquila, por eso es que solicita el credito para la refaccion de los cuartos que tiene y ponerlos en alquiler para tener unos ingresos fijos, ya que ella no cuenta con un jubilación y sus hijos radican en la ciudad de Cochabamba.
texts.en: Candelaria is originally from the department of Beni. She has three children, four grandchildren, and a great-grandchild. She became a widow six years ago and has already turned sixty, but in spite of her age she is still healthy, strong, hardworking, and above all a very kind and responsible woman. Cande, as she is called, says she has been living in Chimore for approximately thirty years. She and her husband bought a little house which has a tourist attraction (La Laguna) and worked together to help her family, but sadly she lost her husband. Since then she has continued to work, looking after children and selling food. However, she now wants to have a more peaceful life; for this reason, she is requesting a loan to refurbish the rooms she has and rent them out to obtain fixed income, as she does not have a pension and her children live in the city of Cochabamba.

loans.use: to refurbish the rooms of her house

loans.name: Liliam Inés

texts.es: Liliam, a sus 58 años de edad es madre soltera de 2 hijos. Desde hace aproximadamente 35 años conoció el campo de la confección y poco tiempo después realizó un curso de alta costura, con el que perfeccionó sus conocimientos y su técnica. Gracias a ello, vio en este campo una oportunidad de negocio rentable, por lo que decidió iniciar su propio taller de confección el cual se encuentra ubicado en la casa donde reside; desde allí presta el servicio a terceros, hace trabajos y arreglos de modistería y además confecciona sobre medida algunas prendas que solicitan sus vecinos. En la actualidad tiene contrato con una gran empresa a quien le produce las bolsas de empaque para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de 3 personas que le colaboran con la terminación de este producto. Liliam es una mujer activa, emprendedora, pujante y perseverante, se motiva a solicitar el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de una máquina industrial plana, con la que podrá agilizar su proceso de producción y tendrá la posibilidad de tener más contratos, aumentando así los ingresos que percibe para continuar velando por el bienestar de su familia ya que toda la carga económica recae directamente sobre ella. Liliam sueña con darle continuidad a su negocio, acreditarlo y hacerlo más rentable, para que el margen de utilidades le permita comprar su casa propia y poder disfrutar los frutos de su ardua labor y una mejor calidad de vida al lado de sus hijos.
texts.en: 58-year-old Liliam is a single mother to two children. Approximately 35 years ago she learnt dressmaking and shortly afterwards she did a course in haute couture, in which she perfected her knowledge and technique. Thanks to the course, she saw an opportunity for a profitable business in this field, so she decided to start her own dressmaking workshop. It is located in her home, from which she offers service to third parties, does design work and mending and makes clothes to measure for her neighbours. She currently has a contract with a big business; she collaborates with three other people to produce packing bags for said business. Liliam is an active, enterprising, thriving, and persevering woman. She is requesting the loan in order to invest it in purchasing an industrial flat-bed sewing machine, with which she will be able to accelerate her production process. Then she will have the opportunity to have more contracts, thereby increasing her income and enabling her to continue looking after her family’s welfare. The financial responsibility rests directly on her. Liliam dreams of giving continuity to her business, getting it accredited, and making it more profitable so that the profit margin will allow her to buy her own house and enjoy the fruits of her hard labour and a better quality of life with her children.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial flat-bed sewing machine

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Насиба трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 41 года. Она вдова и имеет 2 детей. Насиба является единственной кормилицей своих детей. Она работает в больнице. Она заботливая мать своих детей, которая старается для благополучия своих детей. Ее сын Абдулатиф учится в Медицинском Университете в Российской Федерации. Он является успешным студентом 1 курса. Насиба запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора своего сына. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nasiba is a hardworking, 41-year-old woman.  She works in a hospital, and, as a widow with 2 children, is the only breadwinner in the family.  She is a caring mother to her children, and tries her best to provide for them.  Her son Abdulatif is in his freshman year at medical university in the Russian Federation, and is getting along well with his studies.  She is requesting a loan to pay for her son's tuition, and is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university tuition

loans.name: Muazzam

texts.ru: Муаззам трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина. Она родилась в 1969 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Муаззам более 5 лет работает в больнице в должности медицинской сестры. Она любит свою работу и выполняет успешно свою функцию. Муаззам является основной кормилицей семьи, так как ее муж не имеет постоянное место работы. Ее муж собирается уехать в Российскую Федерацию, для того, чтобы найти место работы и подрабатывать. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони для покупки авиабилета. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Muazzam is a hardworking, goal-oriented woman.  She was born in 1969, is married, and is taking care of 3 children.  For more than 5 years, Muazzam has been working in a hospital as a nurse.  She loves her job, and does it well.  Muazzam is the main breadwinner of the family  as her husband does not have a consistent place of work.  Her husband is preparing to go to the Russian Federation to find work and earn extra money for the family.  Muazzam is requesting a loan in the amount of 2500 somoni to buy a plane ticket for her husband, and is counting on your kindness and charity.

loans.use: to buy a plane ticket for her husband

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es: Sebastian tiene 24 años, es padre soltero de una niña de 9 años con quien vive en una casa construida a base de adobe. Desarrolla actividades agrícolas en el campo con la producción de cacao y café orgánico, desde hace 5 años, comenta que fue gracias a unas parcelas  que compró a un buen precio junto a otros agricultores en una zona que posee terrenos muy fértiles en las afueras de la ciudad. Desempeña su labor con el apoyo de trabajadores del lugar quienes le brindan todo el apoyo del caso en cuanto a actividades colectivas se refiere logrando de esta manera culminar las labores cotidianas referentes al mantenimiento y cuidados a sus distintas plantaciones en menor tiempo. No obstante la temporada de lluvias es una época en donde las tareas de mantenimiento se ven afectadas por el lodo y caminos resbalosos. Al hallarse en medio de de una campaña productiva desea fertilizar sus terrenos de cultivo con abono orgánico, asimismo contratar trabajadores para llevar a cabo el segundo retiro de maleza de entre sus plantaciones. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está ocasión desea contar con 3,000 nuevos soles para comprar abono orgánico y así nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Sebastian is 24 years old, single, and father to a nine-year-old daughter, with whom he lives in a house built from adobe. He has done farming work in the country, producing organic cacao and coffee, for five years. He says this is thanks to some parcels of land he bought together with some other farmers at a good price in an area on the outskirts of the city which has very fertile land. He does his work with the help of workers from the area, who give him all their support as far as group work is concerned, managing in this way to finish the daily work of maintenance and caring for the different fields in less time. However, the rainy season is a period in which maintenance work is affected by the mud and slippery paths. Finding himself in the middle of a productive season, he wishes to fertilize his cropland with organic compost and contract workers to carry out the second weeding of his fields. This is his third loan with Kiva and he feels grateful for the financial support he receives so he can get ahead. He is also committed to making his repayments on time. On this occasion he wishes to borrow 3,000 PEN in order to purchase organic compost to nourish his seedlings.

loans.use: to purchase organic compost

loans.name: Ulukoy

texts.ru: Улукой родилась в 1958 года. Она замужем и имеет 4 детей. Ее сын Хуршед учится в Новосибирском Медицинском Университете по специальности терапевт. Улукой и ее муж стараются, чтобы их дети получили высшее образование и стали высококвалифицированными специалистами. Улукой запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора своего сына. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Ulukoy was born in 1958.  She is married and has 4 kids.  Her son Khurshed is studying to become a doctor at Novosibirsk State Medical University.  Ulukoy and her husband work very hard to ensure that their children are able to get a university education and become highly-qualified specialists.  She is requesting a loan to pay for her son's university tuition, and is counting on your kindness and charity.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university education

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru:
Матлюба родилась в 1962 года. Она вдова и имеет 2 детей. Она более 20 лет занимается шитьем женской одежды. Матлюба шьёт как национальные одежды, так и европейские одежды. Она имеет большой опыт. Матлюба является основной кормилицей семьи. Матлюбе помогает ее невестка по введению бизнеса. Матлюба должна провести свадебное торжество своей дочери, но не имеет достаточно денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества дочери. Она ждет вашу доброту.
Этот займ поможет Матлюбе осчастливить ее дочь.
texts.en: Matluba was born in 1962. She is a widow and has two children. She has been sewing women's clothing for over twenty years. Matluba sews traditional Tajik as well as European style clothing. She has a good experience. Matluba is a main provider for the family. Her daughter-in-law helps her in the business. Matluba has to hold a wedding ceremony for her daughter, but does not have enough money. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 1,000 somoni to hold a wedding party for her daughter. She is waiting for your kindness. This loan will help Matluba to make her daughter happy.

loans.use: to hold a wedding party of her daughter.

loans.name: Kamal

texts.ru: Камалу 51 год, женат, вместе с супругой воспитывают 8 детей. У Камала- высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Камал занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 18 лет назад, с покупки скота на 50,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Камала, в его хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 16,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Камал обратился в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Камал планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Kamal is 51 years old and married. Together with his wife, he is raising 8 children. Kamal has a university education. As the main source of income for his family, Kamal practices animal breeding and crop farming, starting this business 18 years ago with a 50,000 som (KGS) purchase of cattle. Thanks to Kamal's hard work, he currently has two dairy cows on his farm. His monthly earnings are 16,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop his business, Kamal turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners." He is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy cows in order to increase the size of his herd. Kamal plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the future accrual of more livestock.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Albina

texts.es: Albina tiene 66 años, es viuda y tiene dos hijos con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de adobe. Albina se dedica a la agricultura, posee unos terrenos en las afueras de su localidad el cual logró adquirir con la ayuda de sus padres. Aprendió el oficio de la agricultura gracias a sus padres quienes le enseñaron esta labor desde muy niña junto a sus hermanos por ser una tradición familiar. Tiene mas de 40 años de experiencia en el rubro iniciándose  junto a su esposo, pero tras su muerte, ella se convirtió en el único sustento de su familia. Su labor principal consiste en brindarle un cuidado adecuado a las plantaciones de cacao, café y achiote que tiene en sus terrenos de cultivo ya que puede obtener buenas ganancias por la venta de estos productos. Cuando finaliza la campaña productiva de cada producto  contrata trabajadores del lugar y algunos familiares que acostumbran apoyarla en la cosecha para culminar la recolección de los productos maduros en menor tiempo. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante. En está ocasión desea contar con  4,000 nuevos soles para comprar abono orgánico y pagar a trabajadores del lugar.
texts.en:
Albina, 66, is widowed and lives together with her two children in a house made of adobe. Albina works in agriculture and owns a piece of land located on the outskirts of her village. Her parents helped her acquire this land. They also taught her about agriculture when she was a small girl, together with her siblings; it is the family’s tradition.

She has more than 40 years of experience in this activity. She started working with her husband, but when he died she became the family’s main support. Her job is to give maintenance to her cocoa, coffee and achiote plantations, which leave her good profits.

When each crop’s harvesting season is over, she hires local laborers and some relatives to help her collect the ripe produce more quickly. This is her third loan with Kiva and she appreciates the financial support she is receiving to get ahead. This time, she is requesting 4,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy organic fertilizer and to pay for the labor.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Ertay

texts.ru: Эртаю 34 года, холост, проживает с родителями. У Эртая- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Эртай занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с покупки скота на 60,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Эртая, в его хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок, 40 овец, 1 лошадь. Ежемесячный доход составляет 16,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Эртай обратился в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошади для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Эртай планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на проведение своего свадебного торжества.
texts.en: Ertay is 34 years old, he is not married and lives with parents. Ertay has secondary education and is doing animal husbandry and field crop cultivation as a main source of income for his family which he started fourteen years ago with the purchase of cattle for 60,000 som (KGS). Thanks to his hard work Ertay now has one milk cow, one calf, forty sheep and one horse. His monthly income is 16,000 som. With the goal to further grow his business Ertay has come to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 70,000 KGS to buy a horse to increase the headcount of livestock. He plans to invest the income from the loan into further increase of the livestock and plans to save some money to hold a wedding for himself.

loans.use: to buy a horse.

loans.name: Nuriza

texts.ru: Нуризе 37 лет. Совместно с супругом растят троих детей. В 2007 году, супруги начали бизнес в торговле продуктами питания, используя в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 30,000 сом (KGS). Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных клиентов, Нуриза имеет среднемесячный доход в сумме 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду в бизнесе, супруги смогли купить скот. В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Нуриза обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) для оптовой покупки продуктов питания, для дальнейшей розничной продажи населению. Доходы от кредита Нуриза планирует вложить в увеличение товарооборота и накопить деньги на обучение в университете для своих детей.
texts.en: Nuriza is 37 years old. Together with her husband, they are raising three children. In 2007, the married couple started a business selling food products, using 30,000 som (KGS) of start-up capital. Having developed her business and gained loyal customers, Nuriza has an average monthly income of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to the hard work put into the business, the married couple have been able to purchase cattle. To increase and expand their business in the future, Nuriza turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS) for the wholesale purchase of food products for retail sales to the community.  Nuriza plans to invest the earnings from the loan to increase sales and save money for her children's college education.

loans.use: to buy food production for resale

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: El Sr. Humberto vive en la comunidad de Colomi, tiene 32 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, económicamente es independiente, se dedica a la agricultura siembra en terreno de 2 Has herencia de sus padres produce papa, papaliza y haba, con rotación de cultivos con experiencia en el rubro, además cuenta con cabezas de ganado 3 de engorde y 2 lecheras. El Sr Humberto requiere el crédito para la compra de abono orgánico y compra de semilla de papa, ya que se requiere estos insumos por la época de siembra en estos meses de agosto a octubre, ya que el ahorro que tenia lo invirtio en compra de terreno agricola. Por último Humberto se sintió contento al tener la oportunidad de acceder al crédito, además de poder contar con la ayuda de la institución porque con la compra de abono orgánico y la semilla de papa ya tiene asegurado la siembra de papa y otros productos para la seguridad alimentaria y generar mejores ingresos a futuro.
texts.en:
Humberto lives in the community of Colomi.  He is 32, single and economically independent.  He earns a living farming two hectares of land which is his inheritance from his parents.  He produces potatoes, olluco (a type of tuber) and broad beans, with crop rotation.  He has a lot of experience in this field.  He also has three heads of cattle for fattening and two dairy cows.

Humberto needs a loan to buy organic fertilizer and potato seed for the planting season, which lasts from August through October.  He used his savings to buy farm land.

Humberto is glad to be able to receive the loan and to count on help from the institution.  Buying the fertilizer and potato seed will give him the assurance of being able to plant potatos and other crops and of earning more income.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer and potato seeds.

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es:
Aydee tiene  30 años, vive junto su esposo Reynaldo y sus 2  hijos en su casa propia construida a base de adobe. Aydee se dedica a la agricultura, desde hace 14 años cultiva cacao orgánico junto a su pareja  en unos terrenos que le cedieron sus padres para poder mantener económicamente a su familia.
Se desempeña en esta labor hace más de  14 años y se siente a gusto con el trabajo que realiza ya que es una actividad que aprendió desde muy niña. Cuando fue joven se comprometió con Reynaldo siendo desde entonces su mano derecha en la constante labor que realiza manteniendo en buen estado las plantaciones de cacao que existen a lo largo de sus áreas cultivables. Al iniciar su primera campaña productiva no le fue bien ya que las mazorcas de cacao que brotaron no tenían un peso adecuado logrando recuperar con algo de suerte el capital que invirtió en aquel entonces, es por ello que tras recibir la asesoría técnica por parte de otros agriculturos de su zona realizó distintos cambios tales como la renovación de varios árboles cacaoteros desfasados y usar abono orgánico. Con el tiempo desea poner en su vivienda un pequeño negocio para la venta de productos comestibles para así obtener ganancias adicionales en su trabajo. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con  1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Aydee, 30, lives with her husband, Reynaldo, and their two children in the adobe home that belongs to them.  Aydee is a farmer and has been growing organic cocoa for 14 years, together with her husband.  The land they use is what her parents gave them to maintan the family.  Aydee likes the work she has because it is something she learned when she was a little girl.  When she got engaged to Reynaldo they worked hand in hand on the constant job of maintenance and caring for the entire cocoa plantation.  At the beginning of their first crop season things did not go so well because the cocoa cobs did not have the adequate weight; so they were luck to get back any of the capital they had invested.  After receiving technical assistance from other farmers in the area, they made changes and removed some of the obsolete cocoa trees and began using organic fertilizer.

In the future, Aydee would like to open a small grocery store in her house to earn extra income.  This is her fourth loan through Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support that helps her prosper.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time.  She will use the 1,000 PEN loan to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia es una mujer de 41 años, está casada con Alejandro y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de adobe. Claudia se dedica a la agricultura en unos terrenos que logró adquirir junto a su esposo desde muy joven ya que tenía la responsabilidad de mantener a sus pequeños hijos. Actualmente cuenta con 3 hectáreas de cultivo repletas con árboles de cacao que es su principal oficio junto a su esposo y que también logra mantenerlos en buen estado con ayuda de trabajadores del lugar.
Realiza esta actividad hace mas de 20 años logrando así ganar experiencia ya que a lo largo de estos años ha lidiado con muchos inconvenientes tales como el ataque de plagas que peligraron sus producción y condiciones climáticas desfavorables. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 3,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico al por mayor.
texts.en:
Claudia is a 41 year old woman. She is married to Alejandro and they have 2 children with whom they live in a house built from adobe. Claudia farms on some land she was able to acquire with her husband when she was very young, since she already had the responsibility of caring for her children. Right now she has 3 hectares full of cacao trees, which is her main work with her husband. They are able to keep them in good order with the help of some workers from the area. 

She has been doing this activity for more than 20 years. She has gained experience, since through the years she has dealt with a lot of problems, such as pests attacking their crops and unfavorable weather conditions. This is her fourth Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support that she is receiving to get ahead. She is also committed to making her payments on time. At this time, she wishes to have 3,000 nuevos soles to buy organic fertilizer wholesale.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: La Sra. Sabina vive en la comunidad de Colomi, tiene 51 años de edad, de estado civil casada, económicamente junto a su pareja perciben ingresos de la actividad agrícola, siembran en terreno de 3 Has, producen papa, papaliza y haba, con rotación de cultivos con experiencia en el rubro. La sra. Sabina solicita el crédito para la compra de abono orgánico, compra de semilla de papa y productos agroquímicos, ya que se requiere estos insumos por la epoca se siembra en estos meses de agosto a octubre. Comentar que con el crédito la Sra. Sabina podrá realizar la siembra correspondiente y asegurar sus ingresos para el siguiente año, además de contribuir con la seguridad alimentaria a nivel regional.
texts.en:
Sabina lives in the communiyt of Colomi.  She is 51, married and earns a living farming, together with her husband.  They have three hectares of land where they grow rotational crops such as potatoes, olluco (type of tuber) and broad beans.  They have a lot of agricultural experience.

Sabina is requesting a loan to buy organic fertilizer, potato seed and agrichemical products since she needs the supplies for the planting season between August and October.  Sabina says the loan will allow her to do the planting and insure an income for next year.  She will also be contributing to the regional food level.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer, potato seed and agrichemical products.

loans.name: Dúo Las Torrelianas Group

texts.es:
Duo las Torrelianas

Orfa de 40 años de edad es casada tiene tres hijos ( 4,8,12) se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva por mayor y menor, ella inicio su negocio hace dos años cuando perdió su empleo y se vio en la necesidad de tener un ingreso para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella inicio vendiendo una docena de camisetas y una docena de pantalonetas actualmente distribuye su mercadería por mayor a sus acreedores, actualmente lleva cuatro meses en los que esta vendiendo cosméticos por catalogo, ella solicita el crédito para poder comprar los cosméticos al contado y que sus ganancias aumenten, el sueño mas grande que ella tiene es tener su propio local para no tener que seguir vendiendo ambulante.
texts.en:
The Las Torrelianas Duo

Orfa is 40 years old. She is married and has three children (4,8 and 12). She sells new clothes wholesale and retail. She started her business two years ago when she lost her job and had to have income to help her husband with the household expenses. She started selling a dozen t-shirts and a dozen pair of pants. Now she distributes her merchandise wholesale to her customers. She has been selling cosmetics via catalog for four months. She is asking for the loan to buy the cosmetics upfront for her profits to increase. Her biggest dream is to have her own locale so she doesn't have to sell as a street vendor.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 53 years old and married with 1 child.
She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Evelyn is asking for a loan of PHP 5000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm tools.
Evelyn has been farming rice for two years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.
She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm tools.

loans.name: Nestor Alcides

texts.es: Néstor un hombre de 58 años de edad, quien creció en una finca acompañado de su padre, aprendió a conocer la calidad del queso y a comercializarlo. Por eso cuando se trasladó a Barranquilla, esa fue la actividad que eligió para generar ingresos y poco a poco fue agregando carne porcina. Esto fue hace 14 años y aun su negocio persiste. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y a crédito todos los días, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Él viaja semanalmente a su natal San Jacinto, pueblo ubicado en el departamento de Bolívar y de allí trae los productos que ofrece. Su meta es cubrir los pedidos en su totalidad, pero la competencia de precios es su mayor desafío. En la actualidad está aplicando a un primer credikiva, mediante el cual comprará en mayor volumen cerdo y queso. Con ello responderá a su clientela  y sus ventas se impactarán pues el volumen le permitirá obtener mejores precios y así mismo trasladarlo a los clientes.
texts.en:
Néstor, 58, grew up on a farm alongside his father and learned all about quality cheese and how to sell it.  When he moved to Barranquilla he chose this business to go into, and little by little he added sales of pork.  That was 14 years ago and he is still in business.  Every day he works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. and sells on both a cash and credit basis.  He travels weekly to his birthplace, San Jacinto in the department of Bolívar, and brings back products he is offered there.

His goal is to fill all the orders he has, but his greatest challenge is the competitive prices.  He is requesting a CrediKiva loan to buy more volume of pork and cheese in order to fill customer demand.  The increase in volume will help lower his prices so he can pass them along to his customers.

loans.use: To buy more pork and cheese.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa de 31 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de madera. Elsa se dedica a la agricultura en unos terrenos que logró adquirir con ayuda de quien fuera el padre de sus hijos cuando fue joven. Inicialmente contaba con la ayuda de su entonces pareja y tras su separación se vio en la obligación de mantener sola a sus hijas. Posee una cantidad considerable de árboles que producen mazorcas de cacao ya que sus parcelas son muy fértiles contando también con el apoyo de trabajadores del lugar.
Comenta que siempre es necesario contar con dinero para solventar los gastos típicos de su labor como es la compra de abonos y el pago a su personal de apoyo, logrando recuperarlo cuando finaliza la campaña productiva vendiendo sus productos a los acopiadores del lugar. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante. En esta oportunidad desea contar con  2,000  para comprar abono orgánico y pagar a los trabajadores del lugar que contrata para la cosecha de sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Elsa is 31 years old. She is the single mother of 2 children with whom she lives in a house built from wood. She works in agriculture on some land she acquired when she was young with the help of the man who was the father of her children. At first she had the help of her then spouse and after her separation she had to support her children alone. She has a considerable amount of trees that produce cacao pods, since her land is very fertile. She also has the help of some area workers.

She says that she needs to have the money to pay for normal expenses such as buying fertilizer and paying for the personnel. She can recover the costs when she finishes the growing season, selling to area warehouses. This is her fourth loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support that she is receiving to get ahead. At this time, she wants to have 2,000 to buy organic fertilizer and to pay for area workers she hires to harvest her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and to pay for area workers.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 58-year-old man who is married to Grace and they have four children.

He has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for three years and has applied for a third loan from Kadet Ltd to enable him buy fertilizer, seeds and a sheep. He plans to start a cloth selling business with anticipated profit.

In the near future, he hopes to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and a sheep.

loans.name: Dúo Manos Trabajadoras Group

texts.es: Dúo Manos trabajadoras, este grupo esta conformado por la señora Glenda de 39 años de edad,ella se dedica a la venta gas propano negocio que gracias a Dios le ha ayudado mucho a salir adelante y tener nuevas oportunidades en lo personal, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de cilindros de gas propano ya que desea inverti un poco mas y agrandar su negocio esperando que por medio de ustedes ella pueda optar a un credito y seguir luchando para superarse cada dia mas.
texts.en:
One of the members of the communal bank "Dúo Manos Trabajadoras" is Glenda, 39, who sells propane gas for a living.  Thanks to this, she has been able to get ahead and have new opportunities in her personal life.  

On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to buy propane gas cylinders because she wants to invest a little more and expand her business.  She hopes that you can help her with the loan so she can continue improving her situation day by day.

loans.use: To buy propane gas to sell.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
Clotilde tiene  30 años, esta casada con Teodoro y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de adobe. Clotilde se dedica a la agricultura junto a su esposo en unos terrenos de 2 hectáreas.
Se inicio en esta labor hace mas de 10 años luego de tener al primero de sus hijos quien la hizo sentir mas motivada para iniciar con está actividad. Comenta que su primera campaña productiva fue decepcionante ya que no contaba con dinero suficiente para contratar trabajadores del lugar retrasando las tareas pendientes que la obligaron a obtener algunas ganancias básicas. Actualmente posee plantaciones de cacao orgánico que mantiene en buen estado con la ayuda de abono orgánico. Su principal objetivo es comprar otro terreno de una hectárea para iniciarse en producción de barbasco ya que los terrenos de su localidad también favorecen   al buen creamiento de este producto. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta oportunidad desea contar con 2,500 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
30-year old Clotilde is married to Teodoro and has three children. They live in their own adobe house. Clotilde and her husband are farmers and have 2 hectares of land. She started this work more than ten years ago after having her first child. That event motivated her to begin farming. 

She says that her first harvest was disappointing as she didn't have enough money to pay laborers. Various tasks got delayed resulting in minimal profits. Nowadays Clotilde has fields of organic cocoa which she keeps in good condition with the help of organic manure. Her main goal is to by another hectare of land and start growing barbasco [a product used to stun fish] as it grows well in the area.

This is Clotilde's fourth loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial assistance which helps her make progress. She promises to pay back the money punctually. She plans to use this loan of 2,500 soles to buy organic manure.

loans.use: buy organic manure

loans.name: Ma. Cecilia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecilia is a 46-year-old married woman with eight children. Five of her children are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Cecilia has a buy and sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. Ma. Cecilia requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear.

Ma. Cecilia has been in this business for 5 years. Ma. Cecilia would like to save enough money to continue to afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear.

loans.name: Arsen

texts.en:
Arsen and his family live in Vanadzor which is in the Lori region. He lives with his wife and two children. The only source of family income is the fruit-vegetable trade that he has been engaged in the last four years. In his own car he drives around the city and sells a great variety of vegetables (tomatoes, cucumbers, greens, cabbage and potato) and fruits (apples, peaches, plums, pears, strawberries, etc.). The products that he sells he buys from local wholesale markets. His wife helps him greatly in his business. Profits from the fruit and vegetable trading allow Arsen to meet his family’s needs.
Arsen is asking for a loan of 320,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a large supply of vegetables and fruits, which will allow him to distribute vegetables and fruits to different food markets.

loans.use: to buy a large supply of vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Maria Blanca

texts.es: La señora María Blanca es una señora de 33 años de edad, está casada, ambos tienen un grado de instrucción de nivel primario, tienen tres hijos. La señora María Blanca es costurera con una experiencia de 19 años, trabaja con su maquina de costura, confeccionando y arreglando todo tipo de prendas de vestir. También se dedica a la venta de pan todas las madrugada por el centro de la cuidad. Su  esposo es Obrero en el departamento de Mantenimiento en una empresa, ambas personas tienen muchas ganas de superarse, por esa razón es que necesitan realizar una refacción y construcción, ya que su vivienda se encuentra dañada por las lluvias y por el paso del tiempo,  actualmente tienen un cuarto en proceso de construcción que no pudieron concluir porque el señor tubo un accidente el año 2012, ahora que esta estable el señor piensa concluirlo, por esa razón es que solicita el crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. María Blanca is 33 years old and married with three children. She has primary level education. She has been a seamstress for nineteen years and uses her sewing machine to make all kinds of clothing. 

María Blanca also sells bread every morning in the town centre. Her husband works in the maintenance department for a company. Both are very keen to make progress in life, and for this reason they want to do some work on their house which was damaged in the rains; it is also old. They currently have a room under construction which they could not complete because the señor had an accident in 2012. Now that he is stable again, María Blanca would like the repairs and construction finished. For this reason she is seeking a loan.

loans.use: complete repairs and construction on her house

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Angela is a 37-year-old married woman. She has five children, ranging from 5 to 15 years old. She describes herself as aggressive. She operates a beauty salon where she offers hair-braiding services. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a market center and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as high electricity costs. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy hairpieces. Her business goal is to have a larger salon within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a successful businesswoman. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy hairpieces.

loans.name: Satenik

texts.en: Satenik is 32 years old and she lives with her family in the village of Gosh, which is in the Tavush region. Satenik is married and has three daughters. Her husband at this moment is working abroad in the Russian Federation. Satenik has graduated from the state university of Ijevan from the department of history. Now she works as a teacher at the local school. Despite being alone, she manages farming and agricultural activities. She cultivates beans and corn. She breeds two cows and 20 chickens. Satenik is a hardworking woman. She asks for a loan of 600,000 AMD and hopes to receive Kiva lenders' support in order to buy several piglets and some animal fodder. She already has a good credit history in Nor Horizon; she has never been late on her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy several piglets and some animal fodder.

loans.name: Plutarca

texts.en:
Plutarca is 56 years old and married with five children. With one child still in school, Plutarca works very hard to provide for them.

Plutarca runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Plutarca has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, shampoo, sugar, soft drinks, canned goods and other groceries. 

Plutarca would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 59 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Lucia is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lucia has been farming rice for 40 years and also earns additional income from selling dried fish.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en: Phally is married and a mother of six children, all of whom are still in school. She is a resident of the Dambae district in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. Phally and her husband manage two hectares of farmland where they grow paddy rice and cassava as their primary source of income. She and one of her co-borrowers are first-time borrowers whereas the remaining two borrowers are second-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). In a group of four, Phally is the leader. The total amount of her entire group loan is 3,600,000 KHR. As the leader, Phally will use her loan portion to buy fertilizers and insecticides, and to pay for plowing as well as the labor fees. She hopes to gain a good yield from her crop so that she can keep her children in school until the tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and insecticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila's guiding principle in life is “What you sow is what you will reap”. She does everything to give her children a better future and obtain greater profits some day.

Laila operates a retail business which involves selling grocery items in their local community. She is married and has four children who go to school. Her husband is a farmer and sometimes does construction work. 

Laila wants to expand her business to get additional income as well. Hence, she is seeking a loan of PHP12,000. This amount will be used to buy soft drinks, eggs and canned goods. The income made from her variety store will be invested for the education of her children. She hopes that her variety store will further grow continuously so she will be able to earn a greater income and let her four children finish their studies and become professionals some day.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, eggs and canned goods used in her retail business.

loans.name: Maria Adelaida

texts.es:
Doña María Adelaida tiene 40 años de edad es madre de 3 hijos los cuales viven bajo su mismo techo y están estudiando. Ella es agricultora y ama de casa la cual se dedica desde hace muchos años al rubro del cultivo de papa el cual aprendió por medio de su pareja siendo el agricultor por generaciones. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria no completado cursado hasta el cuarto grado ya que sus padres de escasos recursos no pudieron ayudarla a continuar con sus estudios. El terreno que ellos como familia trabajan no es propio por lo que ellos actualmente alquilan pero el terreno donde está ubicada su casa da gracias a DIOS por él ya que es propio pero no tiene mucho espacio para cultivar sus hortalizas. Sus clientes son los diferentes intermediarios que llegan a la zona en busca de un producto de calidad y a un precio cómodo para su reventa. 

Sus sueños a futuro son los de poder comprar un terreno para poder cultivar sus hortalizas y no andar alquilando esto traerá mejores ganancias para su familia y podrá apoyar y aportar más a la economía de su hogar como también apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios. por lo que ella actualmente está solicitando un financiamiento con el cual comprara insumos agrícolas como abono, fertilizantes, foliares y semilla certificada de papa la cual utilizara para cultivar.
texts.en:
40-year old Sra. María Adelaida has three children who live with her. They are students. María Adelaida has been a farmer and housewife for many years. She grows potatoes, a job she learned from her husband whose family have been farmers for generations. María Adelaida only completed grade four education as her parents were poor and could not pay for any more schooling. 

The land that the family works is not their own. They rent it but thankfully it is located close to their home which they are pleased to own. However, there isn't anywhere for growing the vegetables which they sell to various customers who come to the area looking for quality produce and fair prices so they can resell it.

María Adelaida's dream for the future is to be able to buy land where they can grow vegetables and not have to rent. This would lead to greater earnings for the family and financial support for the household. She would also be able to support her children through school.

For these reasons she is seeking a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as manure, fertilizer, sprays, and special certified seed potatoes for her fields.

loans.use: buy agricultural supplies and certified seed potatoes for her fields

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 47 years old. He is married to Dorothy and they have five children who are in school.

He is in a shoe-selling business in Naivasha which he has operated for two years and has applied for first loan from Kadet Ltd. to enable him buy shoes and school bags. With the anticipated profit, he plans to pay school fees.

In the near future, he hopes to expand his business and see his children well-educated.

loans.use: To buy shoes and school bags.

loans.name: Turqueza Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TUQUEZA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elena es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de perfumes, venta de herramientas, venta de chompas, venta de papa y venta de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elena es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de perfumes; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace un año de una amiga quien le enseñó a realizar los contactos necesarios para la compra de perfumes
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de perfumes) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras, por mayor, del departamento de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
Communal bank “Turqueza” will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer, in the focal center of Los Andes. This group is composed of eight members and run by a board, of which Elena is the president. The group’s members have different activities, such as a grocery store, perfume sales, tools sales, sweaters sales, potatoes sales and clothes sales.

The loan they are requesting will be beneficial for micro entrepreneurs like Elena. She says this is the first time she works with Pro Mujer, and joined invited by a friend who is a member. Elena sells perfumes and says that she started a year ago when a friend taught her how to find the right contacts to run the business.

The loan she is requesting is to buy perfumes. She will buy them from wholesale distributors in the department of La Paz, and then sell them upon request. This activity helps her to receive an income to support her family. She is married and has a son. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health department.

loans.use: to buy perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es: Salvador tiene 77 años de edad y vive en la hermosa ciudad de Patria junto con su pareja y tiene ochos hijos, él es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora que sale adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación pues su actividad económica principal es la venta de comida pues tiene un pequeño restaurante en su domicilio. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, él pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca de Patria” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, fideos, carne, verduras y así aumentar su capital de trabajo en este rubro. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (El poblado de Patria se destaca por el comercio de productos de la selva, así como servicios de alojamiento y restaurantes. Patria es una ciudad de ingreso al Parque Nacional del Manu.)
texts.en:
Salvador, 77, lives in the beautiful city of Patria with his spouse; he has 8 children.  He’s an enterprising, hardworking person who gets ahead with much effort and dedication.  His main economic activity is selling food for he has a small restaurant at home.  He’s been in this business for several years now and does very well thanks to the effort he puts into it.

He belongs to the “Señor Huanca de Patria” communal bank and on this occasion needs the loan to buy supplies like sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, noodles, meat and vegetables to increase working capital in this line of work.  He’s grateful for and values the loan and commits to make his monthly payments very responsibly.

(The town of Patria is noted as a commercial center for jungle products as well as for lodging services and restaurants.  Patria is a gateway city to Manu National Park.)

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.ru: Азизе 36 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Азизы- высшее образование, работает в местной школе-преподавателем,  в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Азиза занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 30,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Азизы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 2 лошади, а также имеет земельный надел размером 1,16 ГА, на которой она ежегодно выращивает: кукурузу, клевер, картофель. Ежемесячный доход составляет 13,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Азиза обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Азиза планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового сарая с навесом для содержания скота.
texts.en: Aziza is 36 years old, married and, together with her husband, is raising four children. Aziza has a university education and she works in a local school as a teacher. As the main source of income for her family, Aziza practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business 10 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Aziza's hard work, she currently has on her farm: 4 dairy cows and 2 horses, as well as a 1.16 hectare plot of land, on which she annually grows corn, clover and potatoes. Her monthly earnings are 13,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her farm, Aziza turned to Microcredit Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy cows to fatten them up for resale on the market for a good price. Aziza plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also plans to save money for the construction of a new barn with an awning for housing her cattle.

loans.use: to buy cows for resale

loans.name: Santusa

texts.es: Santusa vive en la ciudad de Paucartambo, ella es una persona  trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica principal es la venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche y otras cosas mas  entonces ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Camino al Progreso” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar y otras cosas más, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Santusa lives in the city of Paucartambo.  She is a hardworking and enterprising individual who helps her family get ahead through her work efforts.
