Her main business activity is selling basic necessities such as rice, sugar, noodles, milk, and other products.  She has a small grocery store in her home.  She is a responsible person, which is why she was invited to participate in the Communal Bank “Camino al Progreso” (Road to Progress).

She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy merchandise such as sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, and other products.  She is grateful for and values this loan, so she promises to complete her monthly payments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and other products.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married to Nathan with three children. Mary is a permanent resident of rural Mukono district in Nabuuti Lower zone.

Mary operates a salon that she started in 1999 with an initial working capital of 400,000 UGX. It has gradually grown and is currently using an operating capital of approximately UGX 2,000,000.

Mary applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 purposely to boost her business by buying two new hairdryers and adding more cosmetics to the business which will enhance her service. However she faces challenges of high rent cost, competition from neighbouring salons and reduction in sales, especially during holidays. She is however optimistic that the boost from the loan will help her  to attract more customers.

loans.use: To buy new hairdryers and more cosmetics

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 26 years old and not yet married.  He has a bakery business in Naivasha that he has operated for three years. 

 Wilson has applied for his third loan from Kadet Ltd to enable him to buy flour. With the anticipated profit, he plans to expand his business.

In the near future, he hopes to have the biggest bakery in Naivasha.

loans.use: To buy flour and expand his bakery

loans.name: Jelisa

texts.en:
This is Jelisa, 51, a resident of Silang, Cavite, in the Philippines. She is single, and she manages her house while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Jelisa operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets, and other home trappings.  Demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread, and other items needed in her business. 

Jelisa dreams of having another branch and becoming rich someday. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their lives and business every week.  There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use:
To pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles,
 and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a single mother of three children, who are in school.

She has a business selling fruit in Naivasha, which she has operated for 18 years.  

She has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd to enable her buy more fruit.  With the anticipated profit, she plans to pay school fees.

In the near future, she hopes to open a grocery.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to resell.

loans.name: Azemine

texts.en:
Azemine is 42 years old and married, living with her husband and their 9-year-old son in the western part of Kosovo. She is a housewife, and her husband works as a guard in a municipality, working very hard and putting in a lot of effort to generate money for the family’s needs. 

Currently, they live in an old and small apartment, which they have been planning to improve for a long time, but they could not manage to save the money to renovate and paint or paper the rooms.

Azemine is now requesting a loan in order to renovate her rooms. The loan will help her to improve the living conditions for her family. She is hoping in the future to find a job to be able to contribute to her family’s needs and reach her goal. Her goal is to save money for the family’s future. 

She is aware of the Kiva lenders, and she wants to thank all of them!

loans.use: To renovate rooms in her house

loans.name: Hermenia

texts.en:
Herminia is a 63-year-old woman from Talibon, Bohol, in the Philippines. 

She has been farming rice for 30 years now. She works hard in spite of her age so she can support herself. It is quite a challenge because she needs to wait for months before she can collect her profit, but she perseveres. Her income provides food and pays for household expenses, too.

She is asking a loan to  buy fertilizer and pesticides and pay for labor of hired help in land preparation.

Herminia hopes that she can have enough savings and better business profits in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and pay for labor

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en:
Tigran lives in Kadjaran city, which is in the Syunik region. He is married and has a large family. He lives with his wife and four daughters. 

Tigran used to be engaged in farming and agriculture when he lived in the village of Svaranc, but after moving to Kajaran he began working at the rescue squad as a redeemer. Tigran is the only bread-winner in his family, since his wife does not work and she takes care of their school-aged children and the house.

Tigran asks a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams to buy the needed school clothes and some stationery for his daughters for the coming school year.

loans.use: to buy the needed school clothes and some stationery for his daughters for the coming school year.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina believes that “health is wealth.”  She does not dream to be rich in treasure; instead, she aspires to have a healthy family and be free from any kind of diseases. Rizalina believes that being physically fit is very important in achieving goals in life.

Rizalina has nine children; five are married while the others currently attend school.  Her main goal is to have a stable source of income so she can support her children's education until they finish their studies.

At the age of 49, Rizalina is engaged in planting and harvesting vegetable crops for sale.  Sometimes, though, she imports vegetables from the market and sells them within her village.  Rizalina wishes a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase more vegetables, such as beans, eggplant, and squash, from the market.

She hopes to obtain her requested loan for further growth of her fruits and vegetable business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables in the market, like beans, eggplant and squash, for her fruits and vegetables business

loans.name: Chum

texts.en:
Chum is 27 years old, married, and has no children. She has been involved in agriculture since she was very young, since her family has limited financial resources. She had to help her parents to support the family by cultivating seasonal crops such as rice and beans. 

After being married, she settled down in a new home with her spouse and, aside from farming, they have also been involved in fishing activities to support their living.

Chum’s main income relies on farming rice and fishing, so they must have enough materials to keep these businesses running. For this reason, she wanted to acquire a loan of 700 US dollars to buy a fishing boat and other materials such as net, hook and line in order to maintain her business. Her objective is to continue working and improve her standard of living. She thanks lenders for a constant support. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat and other materials such as net, hook and line in order to maintain her business.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza works hard to support her family. Analiza is married and has a general-store business in the Philippines.

Analiza requested a 17,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Analiza has been in this business for three years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Analiza would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
This is Maricel. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more ready-to-wear products for her business. She has been in this business for 15 years now. Her income from her business is helping in her everyday expenses at home. She also has a direct selling business for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan for her to buy additional merchandise like children's, men's and women's clothing. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Maricel hopes that her business will grow bigger and larger. She dreams to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional merchandise like children's, men's and women's clothing.

loans.name: Magomeni Group

texts.en:
From Tujijenge Tanzania, Fatma, who is in her early 30s, is married and has two children, a boy and a girl who are in school. For six years now, Fatma has been running a business selling clothes and cosmetics. She is also an international business woman selling clothes from Dar es Salaam to Nairobi. Working from 8am to 6pm daily, she is able to make a good return each month. 


Fatma is requesting her first loan to buy more business clothes and to repair her business premises. She dreams of one day becoming a big businesswoman. 


FATMA will share this loan with her loan group" Magomeni" which has four members. The group members will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more business clothes and to repair her business premises.

loans.name: Aracili

texts.en:
Aracili is a 34-year-old married mother of five children, three of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. 


Aracili has been running a general store in the Philippines for three years, selling a variety of items such as snack foods, bread, soft-drinks, noodles, eggs, etc. She has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more goods to sell. 


In the future, Aracili would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Cicilia requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase ingredients for her food-vending business, like meat, rice, vegetables, and spices.

Cicilia has been in this business for 12 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food-vending business, like meat, rice, vegetables, and spices.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr:
Madame Mariama  est âgée de 46 ans,  mariée  et mère de 5 enfants, elle vit dans une famille traditionnelle  au quartier Médine de Ségou  (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle commença très tôt comme bon nombre des filles de son époque à mener le petit commerce auprès de sa mère lors des jours de foire de son village et environ. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage jusqu’à son mariage. Elle continua à faire le commerce en optant pour celui de la vente d’œufs. Elle mène cette activité depuis 10 ans et jouit d’une grande clientèle et d’expérience. Sa force de vente est due à la qualité de ses  œufs qui sont grands sans cassure. 
Dans  le but d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de faire face à la demande clientèle, elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 24  mois,  après 2  prêts individuels bien remboursés. Elle  est à son 3ème   prêt individuel qu’elle utilisera pour acheter 270 alvéoles. Elle s’approvisionne sur place et des fois à Bamako. 
Madame  Mariama  vend toujours  au comptant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de boutiquiers et restaurateurs. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA, qui lui sert à rembourser son prêt et à prendre certaines charges familiales. Son ambition est de pérenniser son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariama, age 46, is married and the mother of five children. She lives in a traditional family in Médine, a neighborhood in Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Having never attended school for social reasons, she was still young when she started working as a saleswoman with her mother during fair days in her village and its surroundings, as did many young women at that time.

She was trained for several years, until her wedding. She then stayed in sales, electing to sell eggs. She's been running this business for ten years, and has a large clientele and a lot of experience. Her strength comes from the quality of her eggs, which are big and without cracks.

In order to bolster her working capital and meet customer demand, she's seeking support from Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso. She's been working with the MFI for 24 months, and obtained and repaid two loans.

She's seeking her third personal loan, to be used to buy 270 egg trays. She gets her supplies locally and sometimes in Bamako.

Mrs. Mariama always sells for cash, to a clientele comprising mostly shop and restaurant handlers. She intends to turn and average monthly profit of XOF 100'000 (ca US$ 200), to be used to repay the loan and take care of some family expenses. Her ambition is to ensure the future of her business.

loans.use: to buy 270 egg trays

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: La señora Carmen de 30 años de edad, vive con su conyugue, tienen 2 hijos, su conyugue se encuentra fuera del país buscando siempre el bienestar de su familia, la señora Carmen se dedica a la producción de leche cruda, para lo cual cuenta con 3 cabezas de ganado, 2 se encuentran en producción, 1 se encuentra preñada, para la alimentación y recolección de leche cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos, además se dedica a trabajar medio tiempo como operadora de limpieza, trabaja de lunes a viernes, ambos muestran muchas ganas de superarse y responsabilidad en las actividades que desempeñan, el motivo del presente crédito es para poder  comprar una cabeza de ganado, de esta manera la señora Carmen podrá aumentar su producción, siempre buscando el crecimiento de sus ingresos, de esta manera podrá establecerse económicamente y podrá satisfacer todas sus necesidades y la de sus hijos que ahora están en etapa escolar y son alumnos destacados en su colegio.
texts.en:
Carmen is 30 years old, and she lives with her husband.  They have two children.   Her husband is outside of the country, always looking out for the well-being of his family.  Carmen produces raw milk.   In order to do so, she has three heads of cattle.  Two are producing, and one is pregnant.  Her children help her feed the livestock and collect the milk.   She also works part-time in sanitation.  She works Mondays through Fridays.   Both of them show a great desire to succeed and are responsible in their business activities.

The reason for this current loan is to be able to buy one head of cattle.  This way, Carmen will be able to increase her production.  She is always looking for her income to grow.  This way she will be able to establish herself financially, and she will be able to meet all of her needs and those of her children.  Her children are now school-age, and they are outstanding students in their school.

loans.use: to buy one head of cattle

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: El señor Antonio, es una persona de 51 años de edad, de estado civil casado, alcanzo estudiar hasta la primaria, vive en su propia casa de la comunidad de Tiraque, tiene cuatro dependientes económicos a cargo, los cuales son sus hijos, La actividad económica del señor Antonio es la producción agrícola, que en promedio anualmente manifiesta que realiza la venta de los siguientes productos y en las cantidades siguientes: Papa 120 cargas, Haba (verde) 40 cargas, Trigo (Grano) 10 cargas Cebada (Grano) 7 cargas. La siembra de estos cultivos lo realiza en sus propios terrenos heredados por sus padres en una superficie de 3 hectáreas los terrenos se hallan situados en la misma comunidad, los cuales cuentan con riego. Vive en una casa rustica de adobe, con este préstamo que realiza es para  la compra abono de gallinaza y compra de ganado bovino y así con la producción  en el futuro mejorara sus condiciones económicos y por tanto también la calidad de vida de sus dependientes.
texts.en:
Antonio is 51 years old and is married. He was able to study as far as primary education. He lives in his own rustic adobe house in the community of Tiraque. He is responsible for 4 economic dependents, who are his children. 

Antonio makes a living from agricultural production, which he says gives him average annual sales of the following quantities of products: potatoes (120 loads), green beans (40 loads), wheat (grain, 10 loads) and barley (grain, 7 loads). He sows these crops on his own land, an area of 3 hectares which he inherited from his parents. The land is situated in the same community and has irrigation.

With this loan he is applying for, Antonio will buy chicken manure and cattle and so with his future production he will improve his economic situation and consequently also improve the quality of life of his dependents.

loans.use: to buy chicken manure and cattle.

loans.name: Lesly Sofia

texts.es: Lesly,  tiene 35 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos y reside en el municipio de Puerto Cortes. Tiene 3 años de tener una pulpería donde vender refrescos, churros, granos básicos, carnes etc., y la venta de mercadería como ser la venta de ropa para dama y caballero ya sea pantalones, blusas, short, camisas, etc. El préstamo que solicita es por 21,000 Lempiras y es el cuarto ciclo con la institución. Este préstamo lo invertirá en la remodelación de la pulpería, va construir de madera su propio local para surtir y atender mejor a los clientes para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Lesly is 35 years old.  She is married and has two children. She lives in the Puerto Cortes municipality.  For three years Lesly has had a grocery store where she sells soft drinks, basic grains, meats, and more.  She also sells merchandise such as clothes for men and women, including trousers, blouses, shorts, shirts, and the like.  Lesly is applying for a loan of 21,000 Lempira, her fourth with the communal bank.  She will invest this loan in renovating her grocery store.  She will build her own premises out of wood so as to stock it up and better serve her customers needs.  This will give Lesly a higher income.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails and other materials in order to build premises for her grocery store.

loans.name: Seke Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SEKE”  iniciará el vigésimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Silveria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, trenzado, producción de calzados, venta de api, venta de camas y transporte.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Silveria es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años al observar en el mercado que este negocio es muy comercial.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, aceite y fideo) que adquirirá de las tiendas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
The "SEKE" communal bank is starting its twentieth cycle with Pro Mujer, through the Collpani office.  This group has eight members and is run by a board of directors, the president of which is Silveria.  The members have different businesses, including businesses where they sell food, do braiding, making shoes, selling "api" (a non-alcoholic maize drink), selling beds, and providing transport services.

This loan will benefit the businesses in the group of which Silveria is a member.  Silveria tells us that she started with Pro Mujer eight years ago after one of the organisation's assessors went to visit her at her home.  Silveria currently has a business selling meals.  She started this business a few years ago after seeing that this was profitable work.

Silveria will use this loan to increase her working capital by buying rice, oil and pasta.  She will buy these products in shops in the city of El Alto and use them to prepare the meals to sell at her stall.  This type of work has allowed Silveria to earn an income to support her household.  Silveria is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer,Silveria tells us that she likes the health advice and training that is given.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and pasta.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: Rolando, tiene 46 años de edad, está soltero y vive con su madre y una hermana en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Tiene 4 años de dedicarse a la venta de mercadería. el anteriormente trabajaba en una maquila pero a la falta de empleo decidió dedicarse al comercio, vende ropa como blusas, camisetas, pantalones, bóxer, ropa intima para damas etc. El préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de más mercadería como ser ropa para damas, caballeros y niños ya sea pantalones, blusas, vestidos, camisetas, etc. Este préstamo le ayudara a surtir mas el negocio y los clientes estarán satisfechos. Su plan es que el negocio crezca para darle una mejor vida a su madre y su familia.
texts.en: Rolando is 46 years old.  He is single and lives with his mother and sister in the Choloma municipality of Cortes.  For four years Rolando has been making a living selling merchandise.  Previously he worked in a factory but, due to a lack of work, he decided to start his own business.  Rolando sells clothes such as blouses, shirts, trousers, boxer shorts, women's underwear, and more.  He is applying for a loan of 10,000 Lempira which he will invest in buying more men's, women's, and children's clothes, such as trousers, blouses, dresses, and shirts.  This loan will help Rolando to stock up his business and his customers will be satisfied.  His plan is to expand the business so as to give his mother and family and better life.

loans.use: to buy men's, women's and children's clothes to sell.

loans.name: Battsend

texts.en:
Mr. Battsend, 72 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Darkhan, second largest city of Mongolia. He and his wife have retired from work and get a monthly state pension. 

The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and it needs some repair. So he is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase building materials such as cement, fiberglass, and foam.

After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place without worrying about incoming winter. Also he will begin burning less coal for heating, thus releasing less pollutants into atmosphere.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en:
Vanessa is 28 years old and married. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. 

Vanessa is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been farming rice for four years and also earns additional income from gasoline retailing. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 42 and married, they are blessed with 5 children aged between 18 and 5 years old. His main source of income comes from the quarry that he owns. He has been in this business for a period of over 7 years earning an income of 44,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).

He has borrowed a fourth loan of 125,000 KES from KADET Ltd. and intends to use this amount to pay for labour costs and raw materials. The profits he earns will be used to increase his working capital to expand the current business.

His dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To pay labour costs and raw materials

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 51 years old and single.  

Corazon is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Corazon has been in the pig-fattening business for eight years now and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Corazon would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock up on secondhand shoes inventory

loans.name: Shirlet Joy

texts.en:
Shirlet Joy is 36 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Shirlet Joy is borrowing 8500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Shirlet Joy has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jeroseline

texts.en:
Jeroseline is 59 years old and widowed with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jeroseline is borrowing  5000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jeroseline has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Dovie

texts.en:
Dovie is 43 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Dovie is borrowing 12,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy fertilizers, pesticides and other farm supplies.

Dovie has been farming rice for 15 years and also earns additional income from selling dried fish.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is 28 years old, married to Mr. Samwel, and blessed with three children aged between 10 and 7 years. She runs a grocery and cereals stall in the market. This has been her income generating business for the last five years, she gets an average monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).

She plans to use the amount borrowed of 26,000 KES to pay her children's school fees. Her dream is to provide her family with better living standards.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her kids.

loans.name: Joel

texts.es: Joel tiene de 31 años de edad, está casado con Jenny de 28 años quien es su esposa y madre de sus 02 hijos con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de adobe. Joel se dedica a la agricultura en un terreno de 3 hectáreas donde posee plantaciones de cacao, café, barbasco y  frutos de piña. Sus padres le enseñaron  este tradicional oficio porque  creció en este ambientey luego gracias a sus ahorros logro comprarse sus terrenos agrícolas. Tiene 9 años de experiencia y en cada campaña productiva comenta que es necesario contar con capital suficiente que le permita adquirir diversos requerimientos para sus terrenos tales como abono orgánico y herramientas para cultivo. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 1,500 nuevos soles para la compra de semillas para ampliar sus sembríos de café, piña y barbasco debido al buen precio que tienen estos productos en su mercado local.
texts.en:
Joel is 31 years old and is married to 28-year-old Jenny, who is the mother of his two children. They live together in a house constructed from adobe. Joel makes a living from agriculture on a three-hectare plot where he plants cacao, coffee, barbasco and pineapple. His parents taught him this traditional work because he grew up in this environment. Thanks to his savings, he was then able to buy his own farmland.

He has nine years of experience and each productive season he notes that it is necessary to have sufficient capital to allow him to acquire a variety of things he needs for his land, such as organic fertilizer and tools for cultivation. This is his fourth loan with Kiva and he feels grateful for the financial support that he is receiving to get ahead. He also commits to making his payments in a punctual manner.

At this time he would like to have 1,500 Peruvian nuevos soles to buy seeds to expand his planting of coffee, pineapple and barbasco due to the good price that these products have in the local market.

loans.use: to buy seeds for coffee, pineapple and barbasco.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela es una joven artesana que vive con sus padres. Ella aún no tiene hijos pero espera tenerlos en el futuro. Su padre terminó el colegio y es técnico electricista pero su mamá solo pudo terminar el colegio, ellos son el principal motor para lograr sus metas.

Viven en Valle Hermoso en Cochabamba, una zona alejada del centro, muy humilde y con varias carencias en servicios básicos.

Desde muy joven efectuaba trabajos de artesanía, y es gracias a sus trabajos que se mantiene y ayuda en los gastos de su hogar. Su otro trabajo es como ayudante de una oficina legal donde gana un salario mínimo por no contar con el título de abogada.

Gabriela egresó de la carrera de Derecho, pero no pudo concluir sus estudios por falta de tiempo, ya que  tenía que trabajar en la tienda (como se ve en la foto) que con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro instaló en el centro de la ciudad para apoyar económicamente a su familia. Ahora busca un préstamo estudiantil para poder concluir su titulación en Licenciatura en Ciencias Jurídicas y Políticas, así alcanzar su sueño de ayudar a  mujeres y niños maltratados o que sufren violencia, para esto desea trabajar en el juzgado de familia.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a young artisan who lives with her parents. She does not have children but she hopes to have them in the future. Her father finished high school and studied to be an electrician but her mother was only able to finish high school and does not work. They are her main drive in achieving her goals.

They live in Valle Hermoso a neighborhood that is quite far from the center of Cochabamba. It is very humble and lacks many basic services. 

She has had artisan jobs since she was very young and thanks to the work she is able to take care of herself and help with the household expenses. Her other job is that of an aide in a legal office where she makes a small salary since she does not have a law degree. 

Gabriela left law school, but she was unable to complete her studies due to lack of time because she had to work at the store (as shown in the photo). She opened the store in the center of the city, after much effort and saving up, in order to help her family financially. Now, she is requesting a student loan to be able to finish her degree in Political Science and Law which will allow her to achieve her dream of helping women and children who are mistreated or are victims of violence. To do this she wants to work in family law.

loans.use: to pay for graduation expenses for her degree in Political Science and Law.

loans.name: Nyerere Group

texts.en:
Samson, who is in his early 20s, is a married man blessed with a baby boy. For seven years now, Samson has been managing his living by running two businesses: charcoal selling and a boda boda business. He works from 7am to 7pm daily and is able to make a very good return per month. 

This is Samson's 6th loan request from Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania, which will use to restock more sacks of charcoal. He used the previous loans to increase his charcoal capital by purchasing more sacks.  

Samson is a very hard working guy.  He has paid back all his previous loans successfully. With the profit received, he will cover home expenses and reinvest back into his business.  Samson has managed also to start building his house. He plans to finish building his house and then expand more his businesses. 

Samson will share this loan with his loan group" NYERERE GROUP" which consist 5 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: buy charcoal to resell

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José Luis, tiene 27 años y es soltero, vive con sus padres y apoya en la economía familiar. Actualmente trabaja como técnico programador de CAD y soporte técnico en una empresa de asesoramiento en construcción. 
Hasta el momento Jose Luis, no pudo culminar la carrera de Ingeniería Civil por falta de recursos económicos y ahora ésta solicitando éste préstamo para lograr su titulación.

José Luis, quiere tener una empresa propia de construcción y ser su propio jefe.

Está muy agradecido a todas las personas que formar parte de KIVA por el apoyo que podrían brindarle para culminar sus estudios y se compromete a cumplir con su plan de pagos.
texts.en:
José Luis is 27 years old, single, lives with his parents, and helps with the family finances.  He currently works as a CAD programmer and technical support representative for a construction consulting company.  

As of this moment, José Luis is not able to finish his degree in Civil Engineering because he lacks financial resources.  Now he is requesting this loan so that he can obtain his degree.  José Luis wants to have his own construction company and be his own boss.  

He is very grateful to everyone who is affiliated with Kiva for their support since he will be able to finish his studies.  José Luis also promises to complete his payment plan.

loans.use: to obtain his degree in Civil Engineering.

loans.name: Jhonny Orlando

texts.es:
Jhonny, es soltero, tiene 31 años y vive con sus papás, trabaja hace muchos años en el área de la construcción, en la empresa de un amigo; por este motivo decidió estudiar Ingeniería Civil.  Inicio sus estudios el año 2010 y ahora le falta un año para obtener su título de Licenciatura en esta carrera, para lo cual ha solicitado éste préstamo. 

Proviene de una familia cuyos padres han logrado ser bachilleres, buscando de esta manera mejorar el nivel académico de su núcleo familiar.

Su sueño es tener su propia empresa constructora y ser un profesional destacado, sobresaliente y reconocido en el campo de la construcción, esto le permitirá diseñar y crear sus proyectos, así como contar con mejores ingresos. 

Está muy agradecido a todas las personas que forman parte de KIVA por la oportunidad que le brindan para culminar sus estudios y cuando él ya cuente con una solvencia económica quiere retribuir este apoyo en otras personas de bajos ingresos, por ello señala que: “Todos somos uno” y  “quién no arriesga no gana”.
texts.en:
Jhonny is 31 years old, single, and lives with his parents.  He has been working for many years in the field of construction at a company owned by a friend.  For this reason, he decided to study Civil Engineering.  Jhonny started his studies in 2010 and now he is one year away from obtaining his degree.  This is the reason why he is requesting a loan.  

Jhonny comes from a family in which his parents are high school graduates.  Therefore, he is looking for a way to raise the academic achievement level within his immediate family.  His dream is to have his own construction business and to become an outstanding, successful, and recognized professional in his field.  This would enable him to design and create his own projects, which would lead to a better income.  

Jhonny is extremely grateful to everyone affiliated with Kiva for the opportunity to finish his studies.  He is already financially solvent, so he wants to return the favor by helping other people who are of low income.  For this reason, his two mottos are “we are all one” and “no risk, no reward”.

loans.use: to obtain his degree in Civil Engineering.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 52 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Delia has a buy and sell vegetables and fruits business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for one year.  Delia requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables and fruits to sell to her customers.

In the future, Delia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ian Mae

texts.en:
Ian Mae is 33 years old and married with two children.

Ian Mae works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.    She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from rice and gasoline retailing.

Ian Mae requested a PHP 4500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like snack foods, canned goods and other groceries to sell.   She has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan.  

Ian Mae aspires to save enough money to build a grocery store at public market.

loans.use: buy store inventory

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah, 34, is a salon owner. She is married to Michael, and together they are blessed with two children. 

Hannah has been running her salon for the past two years, with a monthly income of ksh 8,000, which she uses for her family upkeep and  to pay school fees for her children. 

Hannah is applying for her second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. She will use the loan to buy beauty products, braids, weaves, etc. 

She will expand her business with the expected profit. 

Her hope and dream is to have a profitable business.

loans.use: To buy beauty products, braids, weaves, etc.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a abaca weaving business in the Philippines; she has been in this business for three years. Janet earns more income from buying and selling firewood.

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional raw materials for her abaca weaving business.

Janet has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Inocensia

texts.en:
Inocensia works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a sewing business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 18 years now.

Inocensia requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials like threads, needles, fabric, etc. for her sewing business.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy sewing supplies

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 45 years old, married and supports a family of ten members. They work together with his wife in their farming business. David learned about KADET from other farmers in the area who are registered members and have already been funded by KADET Ltd. 

David has been a potatoes farmer in the Mau Narok area for the last nine years, getting a monthly income of KES 17000.  With this 3rd loan of KES 40000 from KADET, David intends to acquire farm inputs like fertilizers and pesticides so as to enhance production for better yields. He will also pay for  the labour charges.

David plans to use the anticipated profits to increase his farm acreage.  His future dreams is to have a sustainable business.

loans.use: buy farm inputs and pay for labour

loans.name: Elena Nelly

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar vive la señora Elena, tiene 62 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 7 hijos mayores de edad, tres de ellos viven con ella los mismos que junto a su esposo trabajan en el campo.

Doña Elena tiene una pequeña granja de pollos en su casa, compra por cajas los pollos cuando están pequeños los cría por tres meses y luego los vende en pie o por libras a los vecinos o entrega a las tiendas de la localidad, sus pollos se venden mucho ya que los cría con maíz por lo cual su carne es  parecida al pollo criollo. Trabaja todos los días dos a tres horas por día, es así como ellos salen adelante ya que su marido no gana mucho en sus faenas en el campo.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas  para que estos tengan un buen crecimiento y le dejen mejores ganancias. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. 

Su sueño es seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora Communal Bank meets in Sequita parish, which belongs to Montecristi, a properous canton in the province of Manabí. It is full of hardworking people who are proud of their roots. Sequita is a parish whose residents are honest people who only know how to work and look after their families.

Elena lives here. She is 62 and is in a common-law marriage with 7 children, all adults. Three of them live with her and work with her husband in the fields.

Elena has a small chicken farm at her home. She buys the young chicks by the box, raises them for three months and then sells them live or by the pound to neighbours or delivers them to local shops. She sells a lot of chickens because she raises them on corn and so their meat is similar to creole chickens. She works for 2 or 3 hours every day and this is how they get by in life, as her husband does not earn much in his job in the fields.

Elena will use this loan to buy chickens, food and medicines so that they will grow well and give her better profits. She is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it for the support it gives her with the loans. Her dream is to keep making progress in life.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed and medicines for them.

loans.name: Katya Rosita

texts.es:
Katya es una joven de 19 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus padres y hermanos, ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta,que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo se encuentra estudiando la carrera técnica de Administración de Empresas.
Por iniciativa propia, trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza y adicionalmente brinda atención en un grifo de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Katya se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindad comprara mayor cantidad y variedad de productos de belleza para abastecer su negocio, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Katya is a 19 year old woman who lives in the city of Pisco with her parents and siblings. She is very hard-working, enthusiastic and possesses a great desire to get ahead. Thanks to her own effort she is studying for a career in Business Administration. Through her initiative, she has a small business selling beauty product. In addition to this she works in a gas station in her city. She works ten hours daily and she feels that it is going well, due to her dedication and effort.

Katya is very grateful to the lenders at Kiva. Thanks to their help she can buy a larger quantity and variety of beauty products to stock her business. She can then continue working and struggling to achieve her dream, that of becoming a competent professional.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: 6 De Marzo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “6 DE MARZO”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Marcelina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de awayos, venta de tucumanas, sastrería, venta de papitas, venta de juguetes, tienda de barrio, costura de pantalones.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Marcelina es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su cuñada que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de costura; este negocio lo emprendió cuando se cazó, ya que su esposo  sabía técnicas de costura, deciden juntos establecer un taller de costura en su domicilio y contar con un negocio familiar.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las tiendas de la ciudad de El Alto, por mayor, y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los créditos y los ahorros.
texts.en:
The “6 de Marzo” communal association will begin its fourth cycle at Pro Mujer, part of the Centro Focal de Collpani. The group has eight members and is directed by a board, of which Marcelina is the President. The members of the communal association have various kinds of business, including knitting traditional textiles, selling empanadas, tailoring, selling french fries, selling toys, a neighborhood store, and sewing pants.

The loan they are taking out will benefit small business owners such as Marcelina. She has been a member of Pro Mujer for eight months, having joined by invitation of her sister-in-law, who is a member of the institution. Marcelina currently has a sewing workshop business. She started this business when she got married, as her husband knew various sewing techniques and they decided to start a sewing workshop in their home in order to have a family business.
 
The loan she is taking out is to increase capital (buying fabric), which she will acquire wholesale in shops in the city of El Alto, and subsequently to make things to sell as requested by her customers. This kind of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her home as much as possible, as she is married and has five children.

When you ask her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the loans and the savings.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Diana Leonela

texts.es:
Diana es madre soltera, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con su pequeña hija y sus padres, ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Derecho.
Por iniciativa propia, Diana trabaja como representantes de ventas en una empresa comercial de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien su buen desempeño y dedicación.
Diana se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada cubrirá sus gastos de estudios, como pago de matricula y pensiones, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser una profesional.
texts.en:
Diana is a single mother living in the city of Nazca with her young daughter and her parents. She is very hard-working and enthusiastic. Diana puts all her efforts into advancing her family. Thanks to her efforts, she is now studying for a career in Law.

On her own initiative, Diana works as a sales representative in a commercial enterprise in her city. She works every day for approximately 8 hours and believes things are going well due to her performance and dedication.

Diana is very grateful to Kiva lenders since thanks to the help they have offered, she can cover the costs of her studies, including paying all tuition and fees. Thus, she can continue working and advancing towards her grand dream of becoming a professional.

loans.use: to cover the educational costs of attending law school.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta es una mujer de 46 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, en el distrito de Aguaytia, ella es madre madre soltera, muy trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a sus 4 hijos, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar desde muy joven, no pudo culminar sus estudios secundarios.
Por iniciativa propia, Marta trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, adicionalmente cría y vende aves de corral, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Marta se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará mesas y utensilios para su negocio, adicionalmente comprara alimento balanceado para sus aves, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Marta is a 46 year old woman who lives in  Pucallpa, in Aguaytia District. She is a hard-working single mother who puts all her effort into getting her four children ahead. Unfortunately due to a lack of resources since she was young, she could not complete her Secondary School studies. Through her own initiative Marta works in her small business selling food. She also raises and sells poultry. She works about ten hours a day and feels that it is going well for her, thanks to her effort and dedication. 

Marta is very grateful to The Kiva lenders. Thanks to them she can buy tables and utensils for her business. Also she will buy balanced feed for her poultry. She can continue working and striving to achieve her dream, which is to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy tables and cooking utensils.

loans.name: Hamed

texts.en:
Hamed is an 18-year-old married Syrian citizen, working and living in Lebanon. Hamed started working seven years ago, and he started his own business in 2009 to help his family. Hamed is responsible for the daily expenses of two of his family members. 

His business is going on just fine, but needs additional financial support to develop it in order to suit the market's needs. Thus, Hamed acquired a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary updated tools for his business. He will also invest part of this loan in making necessary home repairs.

He hopes that in the future he will be able to have a larger work location and increase his employees from one at the present time to three or more.

loans.use: To buy necessary updated tools for his business

loans.name: Lenebeth

texts.en:
Lenebeth is 47 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Lenebeth is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and other farm supplies.

Lenebeth has been farming rice for five years, and also earns additional income from selling frozen foods.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Dayanara Maita

texts.en: Dayanara Maita is 19 years old, married, and has one child. She works hard to provide for her family. Dayanara Maita runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from selling rice. Dayanara Maita aspires to save enough money to build a grocery store at the public market.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rubina's Group

texts.en:
Rubina is 47, and she is married, living with her husband and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her financial condition is neither good nor bad; her husband and sons earn enough to contribute to the household expenses. 

Her husband is a furniture maker and makes very fine furniture such as wooden beds, chairs, tables, cots etc. He has been doing this work for 30 years and has lots of experience. Both her sons are doing separate jobs, but their income is less than their father’s. 

Her husband became sick, and most of their savings was spent on medical treatment. Now he is hale and hearty, but does not have the resources to buy raw materials for making furniture. Therefore, Rubina requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband would be able to buy raw material such as wooden planks, nails, glue, chipboard, etc.. to continue his business. 

Rubina says thanks to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, and is feeling happy after this loan. 

Note: Rubina raises her hand in the given picture to represent herself.

loans.use: To buy raw material such as wooden planks, nails, chipboard, etc...  for making furniture.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
This is Mercy, 48, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Edgardo and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Mercy operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy a small amount of shampoo or cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to help her continue operating her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Mercy dreams to expand her business and hopes to have a good life. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is a permanent resident of rural Sanga in the Kiruhura district; he is married, with seven children and two dependants from his late sister. He grew up with only his mother, as his father died when he was young. 

Because of the need to survive and to support his mother, he started banana farming on a small scale on the land he got from his grandfather. This banana plantation was used as a source of food for the family, and income for their survival. This business has grown, giving him an opportunity to start a small nursery school in a nearby trading centre to support his family and to fill the need for education in his community. 

He has managed to construct a three room classroom, which he has failed to complete and that is why he is requesting a loan of UGX 5,000,000 to complete the classrooms.

In the photo is Yusuf with his wife.

loans.use: To buy building materials to complete a small nursery school.

loans.name: Anicia

texts.en:
Anicia is 53 years old, widowed, and has nine children. Anicia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

Anicia has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from selling purified drinking water and gasoline. Anicia aspires to save enough money to build a grocery store at the public market.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SOL NACIENTE”  iniciará el décimo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Zulma es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de pollos a la broster, venta de perfumes, producción de lácteos, licorería, venta de cubrecamas, consultorio dental.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Zulma es integrante, ella indica que hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de licorería; este negocio lo emprendió de un inquilino anterior que tuvo en su casa, que realizaba el mismo negocio, cuando este se fue decide seguir con el mismo negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de licores) que adquirirá de las agencias mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en créditos y salud.
texts.en:
The “Sol Naciente” (Rising Sun) communal bank will start the 12th cyle in Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board presided over by Zulma.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which are: neighborhood store, Broaster-style chicken sales, perfume sales, dairy products production, liquor store, bedspread sales and dental office.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Zulma. She states that she’s been part of Pro Mujer for six years having joined thanks to an invitation from a friend who is a member of the institution.  At present, she has a liquor store.  She learned the business from a former tenant she had at home who was in the same business. When he left, she decided to continue with the same business.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She’ll buy liquor from wholesalers in the city of El Alto and then sell it in her sales space.  This way of working makes it possible for her to generate income to support her home as possible for she’s single and has two children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers the credit training and the health.

loans.use: to buy liquor.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia es una mujer de 29 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su pequeño hijo, ella es madres soltera, trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, Virginia trabaja en el área de almacén de una empresa comercial de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Virginia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada mejorara su vivienda, ella desea comprar materiales de construcción para reforzar su vivienda, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a su hijo convertido en un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Virginia is a 29-year-old woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa with her young son. She is a hard-working single mother who dedicates all of her efforts to getting her family ahead. Of her own initiative, Virginia works in the warehouse area of a store in her city. She works every day for approximately ten hours, and believes that her job is going well thanks to her dedication and effort.

Virginia is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help provided she will be able to improve her home. She wants to buy construction materials to her make her home more secure. In this way she will be able to keep working and making an effort to achieve her greatest dream, which is that her son have a good professional career.

loans.use: to improve her home

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 27-year-old married man, who has been working in motorcycle repairs for eleven years to make his living.

In 2008, he started his own business to improve his living and increase his income. It was an impressive step forward, and that's why he is working hard to improve it.

Today, Ibrahim is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary spare parts for his business and register his business car.

He hopes that he can stay capable of developing his business and increasing his income.

loans.use: To buy necessary spare parts for his business, and to register his business car

loans.name: Merida

texts.en:
Merida is a 45-year-old married woman with four children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. Her main business is a retail shop for second-hand clothes, but she also practices farming to earn additional income. She has hardships of stiff competition and bad weather, while her vision is to own a wholesale shop and buy land to expand her farming activities.

Merida intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Can

texts.en: Can is requesting a new loan to buy new gym equipment to better satisfy her customers. Can's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business and attract new customers. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase better quality gym equipment.

loans.name: Edwin Jesus

texts.es:
Edwin es un hombre de 22 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Edwin no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Edwin trabaja como vigilante y adicionalmente los fines de semana maneja su taxi brindando servicios de transporte en su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Edwin se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada cubrirá los gastos de mantenimiento y reparación de su vehículo, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose con el deseo de lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Edwin, 22, is single living with his parents and siblings in the city of Ica.  He’s very hardworking and enthusiastic and very much wants to improve.  Sadly, for lack of economic resources and because he needed to start working, Edwin was unable to study a professional career.

On his own initiative, Edwin works as a security guard and also on weekends as a taxi driver providing transportation services in his city.  He works every day for about 12 hours and believes he does well because of his dedication and effort.

Edwin’s very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will be able to cover the cost to service and repair his vehicle thus being able to continue working and striving to reach is great dream of having a house of his own.

loans.use: to pay to service and repair his taxi.

loans.name: Yeisson Javier

texts.es:
Yeisson es un hombre de 21 años, es soltero vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Yeisson no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de de Ingeniería Mecánica.
Por iniciativa propia, Yeisson trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Yeisson se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada cubrirá los gastos de reparación de las tuberías y servicios higiénicos de su vivienda, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Yeisson, 21, is single and lives in Ica with his parents and siblings. He works hard and enthusiastically to get ahead. Sadly Yeisson lacked the money to study mechanical engineering and had to work instead. Yeisson decided to become a field worker for a municipal agriculture project. He works about 10 hours a day and thinks things are going well due to his dedication and efforts.

Yeisson thanks the Kiva lenders, whose funding will allow him to repair pipes and toilets in his house. He will continue working hard to achieve his dream of studying for a professional career.

loans.use: to repair pipes and toilets in his house.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is a 36-year-old married man with three children living in Masindi, Uganda. He is a civil servant working with the Ministry of Health, but also operates a drug shop to supplement his meager salary, which is even not paid on time by the government.

The high cost of rent and license fees affect his business growth, while his dream is to own a pharmacy. 

Innocent intends to use the loan to buy drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy drugs to sell in his drug shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mable

texts.en: Mable is 40 years old with 12 dependent children, all in school. She married to a man who does not offer any support to the family. She operates a banana farm that produces over 50 bunches of bananas in a month. This business enables her to pay tuition for her children and take care of all the other needs of the whole family. The banana plantation has also enabled her to construct a semi-permanent house for her family. She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to add organic manure into her plantation and also to compete her house under construction. In the photo is Mable with her husband.

loans.use: To buy organic manure and complete the family residential house

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
Abbass is a 28-year-old married father of two children who has been working as a baker for 11 years.
In 2003, he opened his own bakery to improve his living. His bakery is well known in his region, but he still needs to increase his business capital. 
He is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to buy necessary raw materials for his business such as flour, sugar and yeast. In this way, Abbass will be capable of increasing his production and selling, which will improve his family's socioeconomic situation.
His dream is to provide his children with the best standard of living and he will work hard to provide them the best education possible. He only had the chance to acquire his intermediate studies.
He is meeting almost all of the home delivery requests, but he is planning to start supplying schools which will  increase his income and will require extra employees.

loans.use: To buy necessary raw materials for his business such as flour, sugar and yeast

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a taxi.

loans.name: Melsa

texts.en:
Melsa, 35, is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Noel, a driver, and a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manage their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Melsa maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers are investing in as their income. 

Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise such as shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments, and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands it.  

Melsa dreams to be successful in her business and hopes to help her family financially. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional merchandise such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 40 years old and married with seven children.

Rowena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries like soap, snack foods, sardines and spices.

Rowena has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from furniture making.

Rowena aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like soap, snack foods, sardines and spices.

loans.name: Dao

texts.en: Dao would like to take another loan to buy a greater quantity of green beans to make bean sprouts for selling. Dao's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of green beans to make bean sprouts

loans.name: Sabas

texts.en:
Sabas has managed his transportation service business for twelve years. His riders carry passengers to and from the town to their destination nearby. He  successfully repaid his previous loan from GDMPC that he used for vehicle spare parts and accessories. 

Recently, he borrowed a new loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase tires and spare parts. He plans to buy a four-wheel vehicle in the future.

loans.use: to purchase tires and spare parts.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
This is Jonathan. He previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that he used to buy feeds and additional hogs needed in his business. His earnings were a big help in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for him to buy feeds and additional hogs needed in his business. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Jonathan hopes that his business will continue to expand and dreams of having his own family. He meets every week with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work. It is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for feeds and additional hogs needed in his business.

loans.name: Ricardo Cesar

texts.es:
Ricardo es un hombre de 33 años, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el distrito de Guadalupe con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el es  muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia;lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajara, Ricardo no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Ricardo trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de menestras y tubérculos, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Ricardo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada mejorara su vivienda, ya que desea comprar materiales de construcción para avanzar una habitación y reforzar su hogar, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Ricardo, 33, lives in the city of Chiclayo, Guadalupe District, with his wife and three children.  He’s very hardworking and enthusiastic and focuses all his efforts into moving his family forward.  Sadly, for lack of economic resources and because he needed to work, Ricardo was unable to study a professional career.

On his own initiative, Ricardo works in a small business selling vegetables and tubers.  He works every day for about 10 hours and believes he does well thanks to his dedication and effort.

Ricardo is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will be able to do some home improvements.  He wants to buy building supplies to add a room and to reinforce his home.  He will thus continue working and striving to reach his great dream of seeing his children become good professionals.

loans.use: to do some home repairs.

loans.name: Priscilla Judith

texts.es:
Priscilla es una mujer de 21 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus padres y hermanos, ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar,Priscilla no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Priscilla trabaja vendiendo ropa, calzado y brinda servicios de costura y compostura de ropa, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Priscilla se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva,ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprara una maquina de coser industrial para acondicionar su negocio, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su taller de confecciones.
texts.en:
Priscilla, 21, is single and lives in Pucallpa with her parents and siblings. She works hard, is enthusiastic, and wants to succeed. Unfortunately, Priscilla needed to work and did not have funds to study for a professional career. Priscilla decided to start selling clothing and footwear and offer dressmaking and alteration services. She works about 10 hours each day and believes things are going well due to her dedication and efforts.

Priscilla thanks the Kiva lenders, whose funding will allow her to buy an industrial sewing machine for her business. She will keep working and striving to achieve her great dream of having a dressmaking shop.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cooking supplies and ingredients.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha, 55, is married and has three children. She lives with her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. They have been running a business of thread weaving for thirty years. Ha is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more raw materials to increase her production and sales.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and generates a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials to increase her production of thread in her thread weaving business.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is requesting a new loan to buy a greater variety of flowers to sell in her store. Hoa's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of flowers to sell in her store.

loans.name: Choulin

texts.en:
Choulin is 48 years old, a married mother of seven children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Choulin has a fishing business in the Philippines. Choulin requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Choulin has been in this business for nine years.  In the future, Choulin would like to save enough money to build a variety store at public market.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Chinh

texts.en:
Chinh is 43 years old, and is married. She and her husband have been running a business making and selling shoes. They started this business 25 years ago. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.
