Chinh is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying leather materials to increase her production of shoes. With that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy leather materials to increase her production of shoes.

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van is a 45-year-old married woman. She lives with her two children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn money through working as tailors. They serve people in their community. They started this business eighteen years ago.

Van would like a loan to purchase a larger quantity of thread and sewing materials. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To purchase a larger quantity of threads and sewing materials.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen is a 39-year-old married woman. She lives with her two children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money by working as a painter.  Yen supports her family by running a sewing business that serves people in her community. She started this business twenty-three years ago.

Yen would like a loan to purchase a larger quantity of threads and sewing materials. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of threads and sewing materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Lazia

texts.en:
Lazia is married with five children who all go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for five years. She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from selling fried cassava and chapatti at the market. 

She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 100,000 from MCDTSACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. Her major business challenges include seasonality (rainy season) which hinders her movements and transportation. She is aspiring to educate her children to university level. She resides in rented house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expense includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Mariela Annabelle

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar vive la señora Mariela, tiene 22 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 3 años y el menor de apenas un mes de nacido. El  esposo trabaja en Manta en una fábrica. 

Doña Mariela para ayudar con los gastos del hogar se  dedica a la cría de chanchos y pollos, ella compra estos animalitos cuando aun están pequeños y  luego los tiene por espacio de tres a cuatro meses hasta que tengan un peso adecuado para después venderlos a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa los mismos que los trasladan hasta los centros de faenamiento o a los distintos mercados de la ciudad y comercializar la carne en estos lugares.  Esta actividad la realiza en sus momentos desocupados así ella se gana algo sin salir de su casa.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar alimentos y medicinas para pollos y chanchos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 4 ciclos y  le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos.  

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “María Auxiliadora” communal bank meets in La Sequita Parish that belongs to Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manabí that’s full of hardworking, dedicated people who are proud of their roots.  La Sequita is a parish of honest people who just work and are dedicated to their families.

Mariela, 22, lives here.  She’s married and has two children, a three-year-old and a newborn that’s barely a month old.  Her husband is a factory worker in Mata.

To help with household expenses, Mariela works raising pigs and chickens.  She buys these animals when they are still small and raises them for a period of three to four months until they reach an adequate weight to then sell them to merchants who come by her house and subsequently take them to butchering centers or to various markets in the city to sell their meat there.  She does these activities in her free time earning income this way without having to leave home.

The will use this loan to buy feed and medicine for chickens and pigs.  She’s been in the communal bank for four cycles and she likes it because of the help the credits provide.  Her dream is to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
This is Lolita. Her previous loan was a big help in her business as she was able to buy the raw ingredients needed on her food stall. Her income from the loan assisted her everyday expenditures at home. She has had this business for three years now. She is continuously working to provide for her everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lolita dreams of expanding her business and hopes to be successful in life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Lauriana

texts.en:
Lauriana is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lauriana is 50 years old and has two children who are in school.

Lauriana has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Lauriana requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional raw materials like abaca fiber, etc. for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lauriana has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Lauriana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials like abaca fiber for her business.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Hai, 49, is married and has one son. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband run a business selling chicken. 

Hai is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a cold-storage unit to keep the chicken in a good condition and provide a better quality product to her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a cold-storage unit to keep chicken in a good condition.

loans.name: Hiep

texts.en:
Hiep is 56 years old and is widowed with three children. She has been running a business selling coconuts for five years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Hiep is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity of coconuts for sale and hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Fati

texts.fr:
Madame  Fati est âgée de 57 ans,  mariée  et   mère de 5 enfants, elle vit dans une famille nucléaire  au quartier Bagadadji  (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté  l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle commença très tôt à faire le petit commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait des poissons. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage à côté de cette dernière, elle finit seule à  mener plusieurs activités : vente de céréales, de moutons et exploitation d’un moulin. 
Dans  le but d’avoir un équipement flamboyant neuf  afin de faire face à la demande clientèle, elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 48 mois,  après 2 prêts solidaires et 2 prêts individuels bien remboursés. Elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter  un moulin. Elle s’approvisionne sur place. 
Madame Fati vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 22.500 FCFA, qui lui sert à rembourser son prêt et à aider son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Ms. Fati is 57 years old, married, and the mother of five.
She lives in a nuclear family in the Bagadadji district (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having attended school due to societal reasons, she soon started to work in small-scale commerce along side her mother, who used to sell fish. After several years of apprenticeship at her side, she is finally working by herself running several businesses: selling grains and sheep and making use of a grinder (mill). 

With the goal of acquiring new, shiny equipment to cope with customer demands, she turned toward the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. She has had an association with the institution for the last 48 months. After two solidarity loans and two individual loans, which she repaid, she is now on her third individual loan, which she intends to use to purchase a grinder. She gets her supplies locally. 

Ms. Fati accepts cash or credit from her customer base, composed mostly of women. She plans on making a monthly profit of 22,500 francs CFA that will be used to pay back the loan and to help her husband to cover family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a grinder

loans.name: Marchie

texts.en: Marchie manages her own farm of rice while, at the same time, works in a private company to earn a living. She resides in her new house located in Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She had successfully repaid her previous loan that was used for farm inputs. Recently, she borrowed a new loan of 50,000 PHP to cover the costs of farm maintenance and fertilization. She is hopeful to gain a higher profit this season to use it for her house's improvement.

loans.use: to cover the costs of farm maintenance and fertilization

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Joel works hard to support his family.

Joel has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store and raising ducks. Joel is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for his tricycle.

Joel has been sustaining his business activities through his past 15 loans from NWTF. Joel hopes that his hard work will help him attain his dream: to save enough money so he can afford to send his children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his tricycle.

loans.name: Katerina

texts.ru: Катерине 21 год. Она учится на фармацевта на 4 курсе колледжа. Учится дистанционно, так как работает фармацевтом на частичной занятости. Катерина живет вместе с мамой, которая поддерживает ее в учебе. Она просит предоставить ей кредит в размере 5,000 гривен для оплаты зимнего семестра в колледже.
texts.en: Katerina is 21 years old. She is a distance learning pharmacy student in her fourth year. She is working part-time as a pharmacist. Katerina lives with her mother, who is supporting her while she goes to school. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 hryvnia to pay for the winter semester of college.

loans.use: pay her college tuition

loans.name: Fatoumata Sékou

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata Sékou est âgée de 60 ans,  veuve  et  grand mère de plusieurs enfants, elle vit dans une famille nucléaire  au quartier Sokalakono  de Ségou  (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elle n’a pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons sociales car ses parents    conservateurs des années de la colonisation  voyaient en la scolarisation d’une fille, une porte de déperdition sociale. Elle commença alors très tôt à faire le petit commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait des poissons. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage à côté de cette dernière, elle finit par opter mener les activités d’achat et de vente de céréales notamment le riz. 
Dans  le but d’avoir d’augmenter son fonds de commerce  afin de faire face à la demande clientèle, elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 24 mois,  après  2 prêts individuels bien remboursés. Elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel qu’elle utilisera pour acheter  2 tonnes de riz   . Elle s’approvisionne sur place et à Niono. 
Madame Fatoumata  vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle mixte citadine. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000 FCFA, qui lui sert à rembourser son prêt et de se prendre en charge ainsi que ses petits enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatoumata Sékou is 60 years old, a widow, and the grandmother of several children. She lives in a nuclear family in the Sokalakono district of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). She did not attend school because of her parents, conservative from years of colonization, who saw that educating girls was wasteful in life. So she started early on to work in small-scale commerce along side her mother, who used to sell fish. After several years of apprenticeship at her side, she finally opted to run a business buying and selling grains, especially rice.

With the goal of increasing her business capital to cope with customer demands, she turned toward the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. She has had an association with the institution for the last 24 months. After two individual loans, which she repaid, she is now on her third individual loan, which she will use to purchase 2 tonnes of rice. She gets her supplies locally and in Niono. 

Ms. Fatoumata accepts cash or credit from her mixed customers base of city folks. She plans on making a monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will be used to pay back the loan and to support herself, as well as her grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 28-year-old married man, who has been working in the chicken business for the last ten years. In 2007, he decided to start his own business to increase his income and improve his living.

His sells fresh chicken, but he is planning to expand his working zone. That's why he is applying for a YOUTH loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmou to buy a  new display refrigerator and a special gas grill for chicken (roasting-jack). He wants to start selling grilled chicken and prepared sandwiches in order to open his small, special chicken sandwiches snack store soon.

He dreams of having his own restaurant in the future and he believes that this is his first step toward making this dream come true.

loans.use: to buy a display refrigerator and a special gas grill for chicken (roasting-jack)

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is a permanent resident of a village in Rugando in Mbarara district. He is married with eight children and four dependents from his brother who died of AIDS five years ago. 

He grew up with only a mother as his father was not known to him, and the mother made his life difficult. Being pushed by the need to survive and support his mother, he started banana farming on a small scale on the land he got from his grandmother. This banana plantation was used as a source of food for the family and income for their survival. 

Johnson is a hardworking man who managed to start other businesses like poultry. These businesses have grown, giving him an opportunity to support his family and dependents, and construct a house for his family. 

He is requesting for a loan of UGX 4,000,000 to complete his house and adequately accommodate the dependents. In the picture is Johnson with his brother(left to right) who also signed the waiver form.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to complete building his house and adequately accommodate his dependents.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 57 years old and is married with seven children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Letecia is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs.

Letecia has been raising pigs for 20 years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Amirkhon

texts.ru: Амирхону всего 29 лет. Он один обеспечивает большую семью. У него пожилые родители, жена домохозяйка и маленькие дети. У Амирхона высшее образование, но по специальности он не нашел работу и некоторое время работал в будке по ремонту часов. Амирхон хочет купить технику по чистке и переработке хлопка. Они надеются, что вместе с другом справятся с таким видом деятельности. Когда он купит подходящую технику, он сможет начать свой бизнес и уличшить свои жизненные условия. Для Амирхона очень важна это работа. Ведь в районе Хамадони основной вид деятельности только животноводство. Он не хочет упустить свой шанс и серьезно взяться за это дело. Желаем Амирхону успехов.
texts.en: Amirkhon is only 29 years old. He supports a large family including his elderly parents, his wife (who is a housewife), and his young children. Amirkhon has a higher education, but he has not been able to find a job in his field. For a time, he worked repairing clocks. Amirkhon wants to buy equipment for cleaning and processing cotton. He is hoping that, along with his friend, he can successfully make a business of this.  They hope that, together with a friend cope with this kind of activity. When he buys this equipment, he will be able to start a business and improve their standard of living. This work is very important to Amirkhon. In Hamadoni, just about the only way to make a living is by raising livestock. He does not want to miss his chance to seize this opportunity. We wish Amirkhon success.

loans.use: purchase of equipment for cleaning and processing cotton

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 35 años, está casado con Vilma quien es madre de sus 3 hijos que viven con él en su casa hecha con bloques de adobe. Hace más de 10 años se dedica a la agricultura en sus terrenos de 3 hectáreas, el cual logro adquirir con ayuda de sus padres y el dinero que ahorró desempeñándose de manera independiente.
Tiene el orgullo de haber sacado adelante a su familia con la venta de sus productos como son el cacao orgánico, barbasco; entre otros. Cuenta con el firme apoyo de su esposa quien lo acompaña desde muy temprano en sus labores cotidianas que consisten en brindarle un adecuado mantenimiento a sus plantaciones.
En  más de una ocasión contrata a trabajadores del lugar para tareas complicadas tales como el retiro de maleza y recolección de los frutos maduros que posteriormente vende a los comprandores zonales quienes lo conocen por obtener una buena producción. Se siente muy contento por la manera en como desempeña su labor porque tiene las condiciones del caso en cuanto a la calidad de suelo y obtención del abono orgánico.
Uno de sus principales objetivos es adquirir un terreno adicional e iniciarse en la producción de café, así como el cultivo de otros árboles frutales. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta oportunidad desea contar con 1,500 nuevos soles para comprar abono orgánico y contratar trabajadores del lugar.
texts.en:
Juan, 35, is married to Vilma who is the mother of their three children; they all live with him in an adobe house.  He’s worked in agriculture for the last 10 years growing on his 3-hectare parcel of land that he managed to acquire with his parents’ help and with money he saved working independently.

He’s proud to have moved his family forward with the sale of his products like organic cocoa beans and barbasco [an evergreen bush], among others.  His wife is his main support and she goes with him every day starting very early to help him with his daily chores consisting in providing adequate care to his crops.

On more than one occasion he hires local workers to help with the more complicated tasks like weeding and picking the ripe fruit that he then sells to regional buyers who know him because of his good production.  He feels very happy with the way he does his work because he has good soil and is able to get organic manure.

One of his main objectives is to buy additional land to start growing coffee as well as fruit trees.  This is his first Kiva loan and he feels grateful for the financial support he gets to continue forward.  Also, he commits to make his installment payments punctually.  On this occasion he needs 1,500 new soles to buy organic manure and to hire local workers.

loans.use: to buy organic manure and to hire local workers.

loans.name: And Siggil Hann 13 Group

texts.fr: L’Association And Siggil Hann regroupe plusieurs femmes ressortissant de l’une des banlieues  Dakaroises. Au départ elles se fréquentaient   a travers des  tontines  hebdomadaires  qui leur permettaient de s’autofinancer pour soutenir leurs activités génératrices de revenus .Actuellement l’association vient de signer un partenariat avec l’UIMCEC dans le cadre du renforcement du pouvoir économique des femmes  pour les aider  a mieux gérer leurs activités et lutter contre la pauvreté. De ce fait And Siggil Hann 13  est un groupe de crédit de 14 membres  qui habitent la  même localité  et évoluent  dans le même secteur d’activité. Elles sont représentées par madame Diatou, femme mariée qui  pratique la vente de tissus et de chaussures depuis 4 ans .Parallèlement  aussi elle  évolue dans la vente de poissons fumés. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC et sollicite un crédit prévu pour l’achat de tissus, chaussures et poissons fumés  a revendre. Elle ambitionne de développer son activité de commerce pour accroitre ses bénéfices  pour épargner et parvenir a diversifier les  produits qu’elle commercialise. Son  projet dans le futur consiste à acquérir son propre magasin de  vente de tissus.
texts.en:
The association "And Siggil Hann" comprises several women citizens from a suburb of Dakar. At first, they used to associate with one another through weekly tontine meetings enabling them to finance themselves to support their revenue-generating businesses. Today, the association just signed a partnership with the microfinance institution U-IMCEC to bolster the women's economic power in order to help them manage their businesses better and to fight poverty.

To this end, "And Siggil Hann 13" is a group of fourteen members who live in the same town and who work in the same business sector. They are represented by Ms. Diatou, a married woman who has been selling cloth and shoes for four years. She is a member of a U-IMCEC branch and is requesting a loan for purchasing some cloth, shoes, and smoked fish to resell. Her ambition is to develop her business and to increase her profits in order to save money and to diversify successfully the products she sells. Her future plans include acquiring her own store for selling cloth.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, shoes, and smoked fish to resell

loans.name: Victoria Ana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar vive la señora Victoria, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una  hija mayor de edad e independiente. Su esposo se dedica a la albañilería.
 
Doña Victoria trabaja en una guardería en la localidad, pero además de eso también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  lugar de trabajo,  ella en su casa también se dedica a la cría de pollos y chanchos con lo cual le queda algo extra cuando vende estos animalitos, la roa la deja a crédito a sus clientes y cobra cada ocho días. Su mercadería la va a comprar a Portoviejo o a  Guayaquil. Tiene más de 10  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa y alimento para chanchos. Está en el Banco Comunal casi desde sus inicios y  le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio. 

Su sueño es seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The communal bank María Auxiliadora is in the parish of Sequita. It is in Montecristi, a prosperous canton in the province of Manabí, which is full of hardworking and dedicated people who are proud of their roots. The inhabitants of the parish of Sequita are honest people who only ever work and dedicate themselves to their families.

Victoria, who is 47 years old and married, lives in this parish. From her marriage, she has one daughter who is over the age of majority and independent. Victoria's husband works in masonry.

Victoria works in a daycare in the area, but on top of that she also works selling all different types of clothes. She sells door to door and she also makes sales at her place of work. She gives her customers the clothes on credit and collects payments every eight days. She buys her merchandise in Portoviejo or Guayaquil. She has been working at this activity for than ten years, and it is going very well for her.

At home, she also works raising chickens and pigs, which gives her some extra income when she sells the animals off. 
 
She will use this loan to buy clothes, as well as to purchase feed for her pigs. She has been with this communal bank since it opened, and she likes it because she started her business with a loan from them.

Her dream is to continue moving forward.

loans.use: to buy clothes, as well as feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Leonilda Ines

texts.es:
Leonilda es una mujer de 34 años, vive con su esposo en la ciudad de Ica, ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar Leonilda no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Leonilda trabaja como empleada del hogar en diversas viviendas de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Leonilda se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará materiales de construcción para mejorar su vivienda, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un negocio comercial.
texts.en:
Leonilda, 34, lives with her husband in the city of Ica.  She’s very hardworking and enthusiastic and focuses all her efforts into moving her family forward.  Sadly, due to the lack of economic resources and the need to work, Leonilda was unable to study a professional career.

On her own initiative, Leonilda works as a domestic employee in various houses in her city.  She works every day for about 10 hours and believes she does well because of her dedication and effort.

Leonilda is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help provided she will buy building supplies to improve her home.  She will continue working and striving to reach her greatest dream: to own a business.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Sanita

texts.en:
Sanita manages a mini grocery store, which is located in front of her house.Her husband is a farmer as well as, at the same time, a manufacturer of hallows blocks. Sanita started her business with minimal capital and strong determination  which makes her proud and grateful.

Sanita has three children. Profits she gained were used to educate two of her children. Sanita’s goal is to keep her business profitable and supply all of her costumers' demands. She decided to ask for a loan of 30,000 PHP to increase the stock of merchandise she offers. This loan will allow her to buy breads, seasoning, coffee, sugar, and cooking oil. She knows that this loan amount has a lot to do with her business growth. She just hope that lenders will continue to provide her financial assistance so she can let her youngest child finish her studies.

loans.use: to buy breads, seasoning, coffee, sugar, and cooking oil for her variety store

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe est composé de deux femmes qui sont voisines et amies de longue date, elles font partie d'un Banc Villageois qui existe depuis le 9 juillet 2011.

Madame Awa la représentante du groupe est une femme mariée âgée de 43 ans, elle est mère de cinq enfants trois garçons et deux filles. Elle mène un petit commerce de petit déjeuner chez elle. Elle a une bonne expérience dans son domaine d'activité. Elle est debout à droite habillée de robe multicolore à gauche de la photo.

Son prêt lui servira à acheter 40 litres d'huile, 1 sac de farine, 1 sac de sucre, 10 tablettes d’œufs pour espérer plus de revenus. 

Avec ses bénéfices elle a pu carrelé sa chambre à coucher et son salon.
texts.en:
This group is composed of two women who has been neighbors and friends for a long time. They are part of the 'banc villageois' in existence since July 9, 2011.  

Ms. Awa, the group's representative, is a married woman, 34 years old, and the mother of five children, three boys and two girls. She has a small business selling breakfasts at her home. She has good experience in this domain of work. In the photo, she is the one standing at the left and wearing a multi-colored dress.

Her loan will be used to purchase 40 liters of oil, a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, and 10 trays of eggs in hopes of more income. 

With her profits, she has been able to tile her bedroom and her living room.

loans.use: to sell breakfast.

loans.name: Redeth

texts.en: Redeth is married with one child and she does not go to school. She has one additional family member. She operates a restaurant at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for three years. She works seven days a week.  She has applied for a loan of 100,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy rice, beans, flour and charcoal. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to get a permanent residence.  She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity and running water. Her monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more rice, beans, flour, and charcoal.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is widowed with four children; all of her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells secondhand clothes from home. She has been in business for five years. She works seven days a week.  

She has applied for a loan of 100,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy bales of secondhand clothes. Her major business challenges include seasonality (rainy season) which hinders her movements and defaulters. She is aspiring to get her own house and also to become a wholesaler . She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of secondhand clothing.

loans.name: Antony Ismael

texts.es:
Antony es un hombre de 22 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Piura, en el distrito de Jayanca con su madre, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de su madre pudo estudiar una carrera técnica.
Por iniciativa propia, Antony trabaja en su pequeña peluquería donde brindar servicios de corte de cabello y otros, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Antony se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará muebles especiales para cortes de cabello, de esta manera acondicionara su negocio, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño
texts.en:
Antony, 22, is single living with his mother in the city of Piura in Jayanca District.  He’s very hardworking and enthusiastic and focuses all his efforts into getting ahead.  Thanks to his efforts and his mother’s support he was able to study a technical career.

On his own initiative, Antony works in his small barber shop providing haircuts and other services.  He works every day for about 10 hours and believes he does well because of his dedication and the kind way he treats others.

Antony is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will buy special hair-cutting furniture thus equipping his business.  He will continue working and striving to reach his great dream.

loans.use: to buy furniture.

loans.name: Edson Junior

texts.es:
Edson es un joven de 24 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus padres, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; gracias a su esfuerzo Edson pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Contabilidad.
Por iniciativa propia, Edson trabaja en el área de almacén de una empresa comercial de su ciudad, adicionalmente tiene un pequeño negocio de venta y reparación de equipos celulares, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Edson se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprara mayor cantidad de equipos celulares, repuestos, baterías y otros, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un gran negocio comercial.
texts.en:
Edson, 24, is a single young man living with his parents in the city of Pucallpa.  He’s very hardworking and enthusiastic and focuses all his efforts into getting ahead.  Thanks to his efforts, Edson was able to study Accounting.

On his own initiative, Edson works in the warehouse department of a commercial firm in his city and he also has a small business selling and repairing cell phone equipment.  He works every day for about 10 hours and believes he does well thanks to his dedication and effort.

Edson is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will buy larger amounts of cell phone supplies, spare parts, batteries, etc.,  and will continue working and striving to reach his great dream: to own a great commercial enterprise.

loans.use: to buy cell phone equipment, spare parts, batteries, etc.

loans.name: Estrellita

texts.en:
Estrellita is 41 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Estrellita has a business buying and selling seafood in the Philippines. Estrellita requested a 27,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more cooler boxes and plastic-ware to increase her seafood to offer for sale.

Estrellita has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Estrellita would like to save enough money to build a grocery store at the public market.

loans.use: to purchase more cooler boxes and plastic-ware to increase her seafood to offer for sale.

loans.name: Turamirize Group

texts.fr:
Mugeni  fait partie du groupe  Turamirize et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle est mariée  à Séverin, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants  âgés de 1 à 18 ans dont 4 étudient. 
 
Elle fait le commerce du riz   depuis 9 ans. 

Elle  est   à son  huitième    crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de kilos de  riz, à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle  voudrait acheter une parcelle  puis construire une maison et voir ses enfants  étudier.
texts.en:
Mugeni is part of the group Turamirize and lives in Bujumbura. She is married to Séverin, a merchant. Together they have five children, from 1 to 18 years old, of whom four are students. 

Mugeni has been doing commerce in rice for nine years. 

She is on her eighth Turame loan. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase many kilograms of rice to resell, so as to earn more. 

In the coming years, she would like to purchase a parcel of land to build a house and to see her children educated.

loans.use: to purchase many kilograms of rice to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Verónica Johanna

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar vive la señora Verónica, tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación  tiene dos  hijos de 8 y 2 años, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.

Doña Verónica para ganar algo por su cuenta y poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende maíz, balanceado y otros alimentos para animales de granja, este negocio es muy bueno ya que la mayoría de las personas de su localidad se dedican a la cría de estos animalitos por lo cual sus ventas están aseguradas, a ella le gusta lo que hace ya que se gana algo sin tener que salir de su casa, esto le permite además estar al tanto de las necesidades de sus hijos y de su hogar. Lleva 5 años con su  negocio el mismo que le deja muy buenas ganancias.

Va a utilizar este crédito para comprar maíz, balanceado y arrocillo. Lleva 5 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con su primer crédito empezó en su negocio. 

Su sueño es seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank María Auxiliadora meets in the parish of Sequita. Sequita is in Montecristi, a prosperous canton in the province of Manabí, which is full of hardworking and dedicated people who are proud of their roots. The inhabitants of the parish of Sequita are honest people who only ever work and dedicate themselves to their families.

Verónica, who is 29 years old and married, lives in this parish. She has two children from her marriage, who are eight years old and two years old. The eldest goes to school. Verónica's husband works in a factory in Manta. 

In order to earn some of her own income and to be able to help her spouse with household expenses, Verónica works in sales. She sells corn, animal feed and other foodstuffs for farm animals. This business is very good because the majority of people in her area work raising these animals. This means that Verónica's sales are secure. She likes what she does, since she can make money without having to leave her house. This permits her to take care of her children's needs and look after her household. She has been in this business for five years and she makes very good earnings.

She will use this loan to buy corn, animal feed and "arrocillo" [a type of wild grass]. She has been with the communal bank for five years, and she likes it because she started her business with her first loan.

Her dream is to continue to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy corn, animal feed and arrocillo.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
Jose es un hombre de 39 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con su padre, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante;lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Jose no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Agronomía.
Por iniciativa propia, Jose trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Jose se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará una moto lineal, la cual utilizara para transportarse hasta su centro de trabajo el cual esta muy lejos de su hogar, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una vivienda adecuada y segura.
texts.en:
José, 39, is single living with his father in the city of Ica, Santiago District.  He’s very hardworking and enthusiastic and focuses all his efforts into getting ahead.  Sadly, due to the lack of economic resources and because of the need to start working, José was unable to study Agronomy.

On his own initiative, José works as a field hand at a large agricultural estate in his city.  He works every day for about 10 hours and believes he does well because of his dedication and effort.

José is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will buy a motorcycle that he’ll use to get to work which is quite far from home.  He will continue working and striving to reach his great dream: to own a proper, safe dwelling.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
Jose es un hombre de 24 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante.
Por iniciativa propia Jose trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, vende ceviche y comida a base de pescado, el trabajo todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buena sazón.
Jose se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprara mesas y sillas para su acondicionar su negocio, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una gran cevichería.
texts.en:
José, 24, is single living with his parents in the city of Ica.  He’s very hardworking and enthusiastic and focuses all his efforts into getting ahead.

On his own initiative, José works in his small food vending business.  He sells 'ceviche' [seafood cocktails] and other fish-based dishes.  He works every day for about 10 hours and believes he does well because of his dedication and tasty food preparation.

José is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve provided he will buy tables and chairs to furnish his business.  He will thus continue working and striving to reach his great dream: to own a great ceviche shop.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Amalia successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Amalia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sovannary's Group

texts.en:
Sovannary, age 43, is a resident of Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of five children, two of them are still in school and count on her. 

She struggles to make a living. She grows rice on one hectare of her farmland as a main source of her income. She has been involved in this business for several years and can earn about 27,800 KHR per day to support her family. 

Sovannary is a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). She and her one group member are applying for a loan amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. 

As the group leader, she will spend her portion on buying fertilizer and pay for labor cost for her agribusiness. She hopes to make a good income to expand her business and make a better living condition for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay to hire labor for her farming.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre is 40 years old. He is the father of three children aged between six and twelve years. Jean Pierre has requested the loan to buy more fertilizer and quality seeds for use during the production of potatoes. The profits from the produce will be used to provide for the family's needs. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and quality seeds for use during the production of potatoes

loans.name: Kanze

texts.en:
Kanze lives in Kilifi county, north of Mombasa town, Kenya. She is 44 years old and married with eight children. She sells roofing materials that are commonly known as "Makuti." She has been doing this business for more than ten years and the business is doing great. To supplement her income she also sells paraffin.

She has a farm and she practices agriculture as well, and that is what makes her ask for the loan. She started the business out of her personal savings. Her friends told her about Milango and now she seeks a loan to buy seeds for her farm. 

The extra income that she will raise will improve her standard of living and allow her children go to school.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mary Ann has been in this business for four years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Mary Ann successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Mary Ann aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Doris Esther

texts.es:
Doris es una mujer de 45 años, vive en la ciudad de Piura, en el distrito de Jayanca con su hijo, ella es madres soltera, muy trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, Doris trabaja en su pequeño negocio de crianza y venta de animales de corral, ella trabaja todos los días por aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Doris se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá construir las paredes de un terreno, el cual en poco tiempo sera su vivienda, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una vivienda adecuada y segura.
texts.en:
Doris, 45, lives with her son in the city of Piura.  She’s a very hardworking single mother who focuses all her efforts into moving her family forward.  

On her own initiative, Doris works in a small business raising and selling barnyard animals.  She works every day for about 10 hours and believes she does well because of her dedication and effort.

Doris is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help provided she will be able to erect walls on a piece of land that in a short time will become her dwelling.  She will continue working and striving to reach her great dream: to own a proper, safe dwelling.

loans.use: to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Chum's Group

texts.en: A rural villager from Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Chum lives with his wife and three children. All of his children are still in school and rely on him. He is 43 years old and strives for a living through paddy rice farming and cassava growing. He has been involved with his current business for 25 years. Chum is a first-cycle client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, he leads a group consisting of three members to request the same loan amount of 500,000 KHR each. As the group leader, He will spend his loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for his farmland as well as to pay for plowing and the hired labor fee. He hopes to make a good income to make his lifestyle better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide for his farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To cover all the tuition fees for her son

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is 55 years old. He is married, and together, he and his wife have six children. With the loan requested, he will buy fertilizer and quality seed, for use during the production of potatoes. The profits from the produce will be used to benefit the family needs.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition, because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and quality seed, for use during the production of potatoes

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah, 35, is a farmer from the Chisamba District in Zambia and the father of four children.  He is asking for a Kiva loan so that he can purchase a water pump to irrigate and expand his farm.

For over five years, Jeremiah has been growing butternut squash, watermelons, and tomatoes that he sells to local markets.  Using a nearby stream, Jeremiah has been watering his crops, but is limited in the area that he is able to effectively irrigate without a new water pump.  

Water pumps can be a major boost for many farmers such as Jeremiah.  They allow for farmers to continue growing high value crops, even in the dry season, while also expanding the size of their fields.  Unfortunately the upfront costs of such a water pump can be quite prohibitive.  Once he secures a Kiva loan, Jeremiah will get a water pump from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the pump to his farm, and provide training on how to properly maintain and use the equipment.

Jeremiah plans to use the new water pump to expand his production to include green beans and cabbage.  He will be able to use the new profits to continue to support his children who are attending school.  It is for this reason Jeremiah is asking Kiva lenders to assist him with a loan so that he can secure a water pump as soon as possible.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses, 45, has one child and lives in Kabwe District, Zambia.  He is asking Kiva lenders to assist him with a loan so that he can obtain a water pump to help him irrigate and expand his small farm.

For the past five years, Moses has been growing onions and fresh greens on his small farm to sell at the local market.  Using a small manual powered pump, he has been managing to irrigate his crops.  However, without a motorized water pump, Moses is unable to expand his farm further.

Water pumps can be a major boost for small-scale farmers such as Moses.  They allow for farmers to continue growing high value vegetable crops, even in the dry season, while also expanding the size of their fields.  Unfortunately, the upfront costs of such a water pump can be quite prohibitive.  Once he secures a Kiva loan, Moses will get a water pump from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the pump to his farm, and provide training on how to properly maintain and use the equipment.

Moses hopes to significantly expand his farm once he secures a water pump.  He also hopes to continue to support his child who is attending school and even open a savings account to put money away for future use.  It is for this reason Moses is asking Kiva lenders to assist him with the loan so that he can obtain the water pump as soon as possible.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Jose Lombardo

texts.es: José, tiene 30 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene tres hijas y reside en el municipio de San Pedro Sula. José trabajo en un taller automotriz, pero sus ingresos no eran suficientes y decidió junto con su esposa establecer una pulpería y venta de comidas. Lleva 2 años de tener el negocio. El préstamo que solicita es por 16,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de más productos como ser refrescos, azúcar, harina, arroz, carnes, jabón, pasta, frijoles, manteca etc. Este préstamo le ayudara a incrementar el inventario del negocio de pulpería y aumentar los ingresos en ventas. Su sueño a futuro es utilizar las ganancias en hacer una habitación solo para sus niñas, ampliar el negocio y comprar un automóvil.
texts.en:
José, 30, is in a common law relationship with his wife with whom he has three daughters.  He lives in the municipality of San Pedro Sula.  José worked in an auto repair shop but his income was insufficient so he and his wife decided to open a grocery store and to sell food.  He’s been in business two years. 

He’s asking for a 16,000 Lempira loan to buy more goods like soft-drinks, rice, flour, sugar, meats, soap, pasta, beans, etc.  This loan will help him increase his inventory in the grocery store and increase sales income.  His future dream is to use profits to build a bedroom just for his daughters, to expand the business and to buy an automobile.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Mabvuto

texts.en:
Mabvuto, 26, is a young farmer and the father of four children from Nyimba District in Zambia.  He is asking Kiva lenders to assist him with a loan so that he can obtain a water pump to irrigate and expand his farm.

For the last eight years, Mabvuto has been growing tomatoes, cabbage, and fresh greens to sell in local markets across the Eastern Province.  Using buckets, he and his young family have been irrigating crops from a nearby river and a hand-dug well.  Mabvuto has big plans to expand his small farm and secure his future, but currently lacks a water pump – a piece of equipment he believes is necessary for success.  

Water pumps can be a major boost for small-scale farmers such as Mabvuto.  They allow for farmers to continue growing high value vegetable crops, even in the dry season, while also expanding the size of their fields.  Unfortunately, the upfront costs of such a water pump can be prohibitive.  Once he secures a Kiva loan, Mabvuto will get a water pump from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the pump to his farm, and provide training on how to properly maintain and use the equipment.

Mabvuto predicts that with a water pump he will be able to almost double his current production.  He hopes to be able to support his children through school and even build a new house.  It is for this reason Mabvuto is asking Kiva lenders to assist him with the loan so that he can secure a water pump as soon as possible.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Aziza

texts.ru: Несмотря на свой юный возраст, ей 28. Азиза в жизни уже пережила многое. Она развелась с мужем и сейчас одна воспитывает двоих детей. Азиза рано вышла замуж, поэтому ее дети уже ходят в школу. Каждая мама знает, как тяжело собрать ребенка в школу. Форма, сумка, книги, тетрадки и многое другое. Азиза хочет, чтоб у детей было все и старается всеми способами сделать их счастливыми и обеспеченными. Азиза окончила курсы шитья, и хочет брать заказы и шить национальные платья на дому. У нее дома есть швейная машина производства СССР, к сожалению, к работе она не пригодна. Азизе нужны деньги, чтоб купить новую машинку, с такой целью она пошла в МДО "Хумо". Она надеется, что кредит поможет ей устранить финансовые проблемы и обеспечить своих детей лучшим образованием. Сейчас Азиза работает парикмахером и принимает клиенток на дому.
texts.en: Despite her young age (she is 28), Aziza has already experienced a lot in life. She divorced her husband and is now a single mother with two children. Aziza married young, so her children are already in school. Every mother knows how hard it is put a child through school; they need uniforms, bags, books, notebooks, and more. Aziza wants her children to have everything and tries her best to make them happy and prosperous. Aziza finished sewing courses and wants to take commissions to make traditional dresses at home. At home, she has a sewing machine produced in the USSR. Unfortunately, it is not suitable for work. Aziza needs money to buy a new machine. Therefore, she approached MLO Humo. She hopes that a loan will help her resolve her financial problems and provide her children with the best possible education. Aziza currently works as a hair dresser from her home.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine

loans.name: G.s. Luz Divina Group

texts.es:
El G.S  Luz Divina está conformado por tres integrantes, madres solteras, con siete hijos bajos su responsabilidad, originarias de la ciudad de León, león está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Estas mujeres se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libres le gusta disfrutar de sus familias y tener tiempo de calidad con sus hijos. Lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar por falta de recursos económicos se vieron obligadas a trabajar desde temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante,  Adela María es la  coordinadora del grupo solidario tiene por actividad económica una sala de belleza, donde realiza corte de cabello, maniquiur, pediquiur, alisados, tintes, uñas acrílicas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias brindando sus servicios. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos cosmético como tintes, crema de alisar, pinturas de uñas,  crema reparadoras del cabello, shampoo,  acetonas, uñas acrílicas, rellenos, brochas, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El grupo solidario agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Luz Divina [Divine Light] is made up of three members who are single mothers with seven children under their care. They are from the city of Léon, which is located in the western part of the country. These women are hardworking, responsible, and always aspire to personal growth. In their free time, they like to be with their families and spend quality time with their children. Unfortunately, they were not able to study because of a lack of economic resources. They were obligated to work from a very early age in order to help with household expenses.

Thanks to her hard work and desire to get ahead, Adela María is the coordinator of the solidarity group. She earns her income by running a beauty salon, where she offers services like haircuts, manicures and pedicures, hair straightening and dyeing, and acrylic nails. She works at her business for ten hours a day, offering her services. She will use this loan to invest in working capital and stock her business with items to buy and sell, like hair dye, hair relaxing cream, nail polish, hair repair creams, shampoo, nail polish removers, acrylic nails, fillers, and brushes. This way she will earn more income in the not-too-distant future. 

The solidarity group is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders offer to people with few resources in poor countries like Nicaragua, so that people can have decent work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Rovita

texts.en:
Rovita is single, with two children, both in school. She has no additional family members. 

Rovita operates a stall of fruits and vegetables at the market. She sells her goods to all kinds of people on a retail basis. She has been in business for two years. She works seven days a week.   

Rovita has applied for a loan of UGX 100,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy fresh beans, tomatoes, onions, Irish potatoes, and passion fruits.  Her major business challenges include transportation and the seasonality of fruits and vegetables. 

She aspires to start to grow vegetables so as to increase her profits.  She resides in a rented house, and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables for her stall

loans.name: Martha Asunción

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar vive la señora Martha, tiene 38 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos de 15, 11, 8, 6  y 3 años, la mayor estudia en colegio y vive con los abuelos ya que es de otro compromiso que tuvo, los tres siguientes están en escuela. El marido es comerciante. 

Doña Martha  tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa, vende empanadas, alas de pollo asadas, corviches, aguas, sodas, jugos, entre otras cosas, ella en la mañana prepara algunos de sus productos para luego en la tarde venderlo. También cría pollos y chanchos ya que cuenta con espacio suficiente en su casa para aquello, esta también es una pequeña fuente de ingresos que tiene para salir adelante. Lleva más de 4 años en estas actividades y le va bastante bien.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar pollos y alimento para que estos tengan un buen desarrollo. Lleva 9 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho en su vida. 

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “María Auxiliadora” communal bank meets in La Sequita Parish belonging to Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manabí that’s full of hardworking, dedicated people who are proud of their roots.  La Sequita is a parish full of honest people who only know work and to be dedicated to their families.

Martha, 38, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has five children who are 15, 11, 8, 6 and 3 years of age.  The eldest attends secondary school and lives with her grandparents since she had her with a previous partner.  The next three attend school and her husband’s a merchant.

Martha has a small home-based business.  She sells turnovers, grilled chicken wings, ‘corviches’ [stuffed, fried banana balls], water, soft-drinks and juice, among others.  She prepares some of her products in the morning to then sell in the evening.  She also raises chickens and pigs since she has enough space at home to do so.  This is also a small source of income she has to get ahead.  She’s been in these activities more than four years and she does quite well.

She will use this loan to buy chicks and feed so that they will develop well.  She’s been in the communal bank nine years and likes it because the loans have helped her much in her life.  Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy chicks and feed.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.es: Leonora es una mujer de 50 años y está casada con Constantino con quien tuvo varios hijos que actualmente son personas mayores e independientes. Vive junto a su esposo en su casa construida a base de adobe. Leonora se dedica a la agricultura, está actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso, por lo tanto considera su labor muy abnegada a pesar de realizar un trabajo rutinario brindándole una serie de cuidados a sus plantaciones con el objetivo de obtener frutos de calidad. En sus terrenos de cultivo posee más plantaciones de cacao orgánico por ser uno de los productos más rentables, no obstante es necesario contar con dinero en cada campaña que facilite la compra de abono orgánico y el contrato de trabajadores del lugar. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. En está oportunidad desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de herramientas tales como picos, tijeras de podar y abono orgánico para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Leonora, 50, is married to Constantino and she had several children with him all of which are independent adults now.  She lives with her husband in an adobe house. Leonora works in agriculture which is her main source of income.  She considers it to be very demanding work even though it’s routine to provide a series of care measures to her crops aimed at obtaining quality fruit.

What she grows the most is organic cocoa beans because it’s one of the most profitable crops.  However, she still must have money available each growing cycle to buy organic manure and to hire local workers.

This is her first Kiva loan and she feels grateful for the financial support she gets to continue forward.  She also commits to make her payments punctually.

She needs 2,000 new soles on this occasion to buy tools like picks, pruning shears and organic manure for her crops.

loans.use: to buy tools and organic manure.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Flordeliza works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from pig fattening.

Flordeliza is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

Flordeliza has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar is from Iraq. He is a youth client, 28 years of age, who is married and has a child. Haydar provides his family’s income, while his wife takes care of their child.

Haydar owns a small shop where he sells plate glass, which is used for the installation of display windows. He not only sells these glass sheets, but also specializes in their installation. These glass sheets are highly demanded in the area. Haydar has been in this field since 1999, and this business has been in his family for generations. His business has grown rapidly, because he is famous for this work and he has a lot of experience. 

Haydar is requesting a youth loan of 3,000 USD. He will use this loan to pay the annual rent of his shop. With help from this loan, Haydar aims to improve his business and increase his profits, so that he will be able to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop, where he sells glass sheets and display window installation services

loans.name: Marcel

texts.en:
Marcel is a father of one child, aged seven. His wife is also a farmer, and they have been farming for the past 18 years. With the loan, Marcel would like to buy more fertilizer and quality seed, for use during the production of potatoes. The profits from the produce will be used to buy another parcel of land for growing more potatoes, for a better future.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more more fertilizer and quality seed, for use during the production of potatoes

loans.name: Buaisha

texts.ru: Буайше 54 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Буайши - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи  Буайша занимается животноводством, стартовав 25 лет назад, с покупки скота на 12,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Буайши, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 лошади. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Буайша обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Буайша планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а также накопить средства для приданного для дочери.
texts.en:
Buaisha is 54 years old, married and together with her husband, she is raising 5 children.  Buaisha has a high school education.  The main source of income for the family comes from her livestock business, which she started 25 years ago when she bought cattle for 12,000 sonomi.  Thanks to Buaisha's hard work, she currently has two horses on her farm.  Her monthly income is 10,000 som.  

In order to expand her business, Buaisha applied for a loan of 80,000 som from the microfinance bank of Bai Tushum and Partners.  She will use the loan to purchase cows for resale at the market at a premium price.  Buaisha is planning to reinvest the added profits into the expansion of her cattle business and to save some of it for her daughter's dowry.

loans.use: to buy cows for resale

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia tiene 51 años, es viuda y madre de dos hijos que viven con ella en su casa hecha con bloques de adobe.
Lidia creció en el campo apoyando a sus padres en las labores que realizaban para el sustento económico de su familia cultivando uno de los productos más rentables de su región como es el cacao orgánico.
Al cumplir 20 años se comprometió y recibió por parte de sus padres una hectárea de cultivo en donde se inicio a trabajar de manera independiente. Cuenta con mas de 30 años de experiencia y a lo largo de este tiempo ha logrado obtener ingresos que le permitieron adquirir más terrenos agrícolas logrando contar con 3 hectáreas repletas de abono orgánico. Se siente muy orgullosa de tener terrenos muy fértiles ya que facilitan la obtención de frutos de calidad. No obstante también fertiliza sus terrenos de cultivo con abono orgánico.
Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta oportunidad desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para comprar abono orgánico y nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Lidia, 51, is a widow and mother of two children living with her in a house made of adobe bricks.  Lidia grew up in the fields helping her parents with the chores they did growing the region’s most profitable crops like organic cacao to support the family economically.

When she turned 20 and became engaged, her parents gave her a hectare of farmland for her to start working independently.  She has more than 30 years’ experience and along this time she’s managed to earn income that made it possible for her to acquire more, very fertile land that yields quality fruit.  Nevertheless, she fertilizes her crops with organic manure.

This is her 4th Kiva loan and she feels grateful for the financial support she gets to continue forward.  In addition, she commits to make her payments punctually.  On this occasion she needs to get 2,000 new soles to buy organic manure to nourish her plants.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Raqibjon

texts.ru: Ракибджон водитель с большим стажем и еще отличный семьянин. У Ракибджона двое детей, мальчик и девочка. Каждое утро Ракибджон просыпаясь благодарить Бога за данную жизнь. У него есть все что ему важно, красивую жену, здоровых детей и хорошую работу. Ракибджон имеет машину марки "Волга" и использует его не только как средство передвижения, но и зарабатывает на нем. Он возит людей от его родной деревни Тутк до города Истаравшана и привозит обратно. В день он может заработать до 16 сомони. Это мало, но ему нравится водить машину и возит людей с одной точки на другую. Ракибджон берет кредит потому что его "Волга" 1980 года производства, сломалась и ему срочно потребуется ремонт. Чтобы восстановить машину Ракибджон берет кредит. Ракибджон с помощью кредита сможет починить машину, и вернутся к работе. В будущем он надеется купить новую машину. Надеемся, Ракибджона ждет удача с вашей помощью.
texts.en: Raqibjon is an experienced driver and a great family man. Raqibjon has two children, a boy and a girl. Raqibjon wakes up every morning and thanks God for this life. He has everything that is important to him: a beautiful wife, healthy children and a good job. Raqibjon has a Volga car and uses it not only as a means of transportation, but also as a means to make a living. He drives people from his village to the city of Tutk Istaravshan and back again. In a day, he can earn up to 16 somoni. It's not much, but he likes to drive and taxi people from one point to another. Raqibjon is taking out a loan because his 1980 Volga broke down and he urgently needs to repair it. With the loan, Raqibjon will repair the car and get back to work. In the future, he hopes to buy a new car. We hope that, with your help, Raqibjon will have good fortune.

loans.use: buy spare parts for his car

loans.name: Akbar

texts.ru: Не каждый человек занимается любимым делом и не каждый человек выполняет свою работу с удовольствием, но Акбару повезло. Ему в двойне повезло, потому что он занимается двум видом деятельности. Акбар с детства работал на грядке и ему до сих пор нравится заниматься этим делом, ведь свой урожай вкуснее. Акбар любит водить машину и в свободное время предоставляет услугу такси. Сейчас у него сломалась машина, и он берет кредит с целью купить запчасти и починить машину самому. Скоро ему придется собирать осенний плоды и часть урожая он хочет продать. Чтобы товар дошел до прилавок рынка, нужна машина. Поэтому ему срочно нужно отремонтировать машину и заняться приятным делом.
texts.en:
Not every person has a job that they love and not every person does that job with pleasure, but Akbar is a lucky man.  He is doubly lucky because he is doing two such jobs.  From the time of his youth until now, Akbar has enjoyed working in a garden, since, your own harvest tastes best.  Akbar loves to drive a car and in his free time he provides a taxi service.  

Recently, his car broke down.  Akbar has applied for a loan to purchase spare parts so he can fix the car himself.  Soon he will need to harvest the produce from his garden, some of which he is planning to sell.  In order for his produce to get to the market stall, he needs a car.  This is the reason why he need to fix his car immediately and get back to doing the work which he enjoys so much.

loans.use: To fix his car which he uses to transport his fruits and vegetables to the market to sell.

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru: Каждый ребенок хвастается, что у его мамы самые добрые, самые нежные и самые золотые руки. Наверное, дети Саломата больше всех говорят теплые слова о своей матери, ведь их мама настоящая мастерица. Саломат корме того, что очень вкусно готовит, она еще шьет национальные платья, делая на них акцент вышивкой. Она вышивает бисером, разноцветными камнями и золотистыми нитками, не только на платьях, но и на скатертях. Сидеть за столом с такой скатертью всегда приятно. Просидеть за такой работой можно очень долго и не заметить, как пролетает время. Саломат с детства любила шить и вышивать. Она научила и свою невестку такому мастерству. На деньги от кредита он собирается купить бисера разного размера и разноцветных ниток для вышивки, чтоб ее невестка могла освоить больше, чем она знает.
texts.en: Every child boasts that his mom is the kindest, most gentle, and most talented mother around. Perhaps more than any other children, Salomat's children brag about their mother since she is a true master of her craft. Salomat is not only an outstanding cook, she also sews traditional dresses with embroidery. She embroiders with beads, colored stones, and gold thread, not only on dresses, but also on tablecloths. Sitting at a table with such a tablecloth is always pleasant. This kind of intense work takes a long time, and you don't notice how time flies. Since she was a child, Salomat loved to sew and embroider. She is teaching her sister-in-law this skill. With the money from the loan, she is going to buy different sized beads and colored thread for embroidery, so that her sister-in-law can continue to master this skill.

loans.use: acquire the necessary materials for embroidery and sewing

loans.name: Batsuh

texts.en:
Mrs. Batsuh is 43 years old, and she lives with her husband and three children in a small house in the Selenge province of Mongolia. Her husband Amarjargal is 40 and works as an assistant worker in the construction business. Her two younger sons study at local schools, and her older son Ganzorig is a university student. 

Batsuh has been herding livestock since 2003 and raised her livestock since.  She produces organic dairy products and sells cattle, sheep, and goats. 

She is now planning to raise poultry and pigs to expand her farming business. She is a hard-working and diligent woman who now requests a loan of MNT 2,000,000 to buy chickens and pigs for her farm. 

Her husband and children help her take care of her business.

loans.use: to buy chickens and pigs for her farm

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus works hard to support ten children. She is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Jesus has requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good light source that is waterproof during the rainy season.
