Jesus is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing the health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Deiby Felipe

texts.es:
Deiby es un hombre de 20 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, el es muy trabajador,entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Deiby no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Agronomia.
Por iniciativa propia, Deiby trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buen desempeño.
Deiby se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva,ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada mejorara su vivienda, ya que desea construir un habitación en su hogar, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de estudiar una profesión.
texts.en:
Deiby, 20, is single living with his parents and siblings in the city of Ica.  He’s very hardworking and enthusiastic and very much wants to improve.  Sadly, because of the lack of economic resources and his need to start working, Deiby was unable to study Agronomy.

On his own initiative, Deiby works as a field hand on a large agricultural estate in his city.  He works every day for about 10 hours and believes he does well because of his dedication and the good way he does his work.

Deiby is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help provided he will make some home improvements.  He wants to add a room to his house.  He will continue working and striving to reach his great dream:  to study a profession.

loans.use: to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan, 35 years old, is married and has a son. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a cook for a food stall. She supports her family through the income she earns, from a business of producing and selling clothing. She began this business ten years ago. 

Loan intends to take a loan, which she will use to increase her working capital and buy more sewing materials. The additional capital will enable her to increase her production of clothing to sell. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy material to make clothing to sell.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 43-year-old, Lebanese man. He lives with his wife and their four children, who are attending school. He has been working in the construction field for the past 15 years. He is very qualified and knows how to get the work done properly. He works on a freelance basis and has two part-timers helping him to achieve the work.

Today, Hasan is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l. He will use the loan funds to purchase wood. It’s common for all construction workers to possess wood products, to be used as ladders or scaffolds to help them reach higher heights. Hasan is pretty sure that a Kiva loan will assist him in improving his work. He looks forward to owning an office where he will deal suitably with construction entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase wood

loans.name: Fawziya

texts.en:
Fawziya is an Iraq client. She is 68 years old, married, and has no children. Fawziya and her husband provide their living together.

Fawziya runs a small grocery store where she sells some basic needs of a house but mostly emphasizes selling grains, sugar, and flour. She has been in this field since 1980 and has a big reputation in the neighborhood and is respected by many.

Fawziya is requesting a loan of US$ 2,500 to buy a new refrigerator for her grocery store and to buy an electric generator. 

Fawziya is aiming to grow her business more, and she dreams of opening a bigger grocery store and providing better services for her neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator for her grocery store and to buy an electric generator

loans.name: Olaya Georgina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar vive la señora Olaya, tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera de  tres hijos de 24, 20 y 18 años, el menor de ellos estudia en colegio  y es el que aun  vive en su casa. 

Doña Olaya tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí  vende toda clase de víveres y también vende productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), productos que vende en su casa y también sale a recorrer,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00, su  hijo le ayudan en su negocio cuando está desocupado y en los momentos que ella sale a vender y cobrar ya que deja a crédito y cobra por semanas, ella lleva más de 3 años con su tienda y con sus productos de Yanbal mucho más tiempo, es así como ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar víveres y productos de Yanbal para surtir su negocio. Está desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque el grupo es muy ordenado y cumplido.

Su sueño es seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The “María Auxiliadora” communal bank meets in La Sequita Parish belonging to Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manabí full of hardworking, dedicated people who are proud of their roots.  La Sequita is a parish whose inhabitants are honest people who only know work and dedication to their families.

Olaya, 41, lives here.  She’s a single mother of three children who are 24, 20 and 18 years old.  The youngest attends secondary school and is the only one still living at home.

Olaya has a home-based grocery store.  She sells all sorts of foodstuffs there and also sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumery and women’s accessories).  She sells them at home and also door to door.  She works every day from 6am to 8pm.  Her son helps her with the business when he’s not busy and when she has to go out to collect since she sells on credit and collects weekly.  She’s had the store for more than three years and has been selling Yanbal products for much longer.  This is how she was able to support her children.

She will use the loan to buy grocery items and Yanbal products to stock her business.  She’s been in the communal bank since the beginning and likes it because it’s a very orderly, responsible group.  Her dream is to continue moving forward.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and Yanbal cosmetics.

loans.name: Nhanh

texts.en:
Nhanh is requesting a new loan. She will use it to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that her new loan will assist her to increase the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to sell in her store.

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg and his family live in the city of Spitak which is in Lori region. Gevorg has a higher education, since he graduated from the Polytechnic Institute of Vanadzor city and he has a specialty of engineering. Gevorg is married and has a son, who is now doing his military service serving in the army, and a daughter, who is school-aged. Gevorg’s wife does not work, she is a housewife. Now Gevorg works for the Municipality of the city of Spitak as a leading specialist.

Gevorg needs a loan of 800,000 Armenian drams since he greatly wants to furnish his daughter’s room, as she has no comfort at all there to do her lessons. Gevorg wants to buy a desk and a chair as well as a bookcase in which she can place her books and to make a separate room for her, where she can both prepare her lessons and spend her leisure time.

loans.use: to furnish his daughter’s room and buy her a desk, a chair and a bookcase so she has comfort to do her lessons.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 38 years old. She is married to a farmer, and they have four children. 

She has been a potato farmer for ten years. With the loan, she would like to buy more fertilizer and quality seeds for use during the production of potatoes. She plans to use the profits for providing food for her family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. 

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and quality seeds for growing potatoes

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina, tiene 31 años de edad, es medre soltera y vive con su hermana y sus dos hijos en el municipio de Santa Rita, Yoro. Tiene 3 años de tener la venta de tortillas de maíz y venta de comida como ser pollo frito con tajadas, baleadas, chuleta frita y pastelitos rellenos con carne para vender según encargos. El préstamo que solicita es por 21,000 Lempiras y lo utilizara para cancelar un saldo de préstamo que tiene con otra institución para quedar solvente y con la otra parte necesita invertir en el negocio, comprara los insumos como maíz para elaborar tortillas y carnes, vegetales, bananos verdes, manteca, condimentos para la elaboración de comidas y poder obtener mayor ganancia.  Su meta es seguir dándole los estudios a sus hijos hasta que se gradúen.
texts.en:
Catalina, 31, is a single mother living with her sister and two children in the municipality of Santa Rita, Yoro.  She’s been selling corn tortillas and food like fried chicken with fried bananas, filled flour tortillas, fried pork chops and meat turnovers to order for three years.  

She’s asking for a 21,000 Lempira loan to pay off an outstanding loan she has with another institution so that she can be solvent and will use the other part to invest in the business.  She will buy ingredients like corn to make tortillas and meats, vegetables, green plantain, lard and condiments to prepare her dishes and earn higher profits.  Her goal is to continue providing schooling for her children until they graduate.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, tortillas and to pay an outstanding loan.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is single with one child and she goes to school. She has one additional family member. She operates a stall of fruits and vegetables at the market. She sells her goods to all kinds of people on a retail basis. She has been in business for two years. She works six days a week. She has applied for a loan of 100,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy fresh beans, tomatoes, onions, Irish potatoes, and french beans. Her major business challenges include transportation and defaulters. She aspires to educate her children to the university level. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more fresh beans, tomatoes, onions, irish potatoes, and french beans

loans.name: Bayasgalan

texts.en:
Mrs. Bayasgalan is 31 years old,  and she lives with her husband and daughter in a ger, a traditional nomadic tent, in the Uvs province of Mongolia. Her daughter Monhjin is three and goes to a local kindergarten. Her husband Zorigoo helps his wife's mother and sister in running their business of selling furniture in a local market. 

Bayasgalan used to help her mother's business, and she has gained a lot of knowledge and experience in that business. She is now planning to start her own business of selling furniture -- in another market, in order not to compete with her mother. Her husband will help her run their family business. 

She is now requesting a loan of MNT 7,000,000 to purchase a starting inventory for her new furniture sales business. She has good taste and sense in selection, and she is a hard-working lady.

loans.use: to buy starting inventory for her new furniture sales business

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Emprendedoras esta en su segundo ciclo del programa de comité, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para conocer la situación de cada una de ellas. Una integrante es Fanny, quien en su última encuesta tuvo un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir con ingresos muy bajos. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta con la venta de ropas, también se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder superar la pobreza.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de productos, como ser blusas, shorts, camisas, zapatillas etc. lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
“Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Enterprising Women) is a group that is in its second loan cycle with the committee program.  All of the members have taken a poverty elimination survey so that each one can become familiar with her situation.  

One member is Fanny, whose latest survey results indicated that she was around a poverty stage of Level 1.  In other works, this indicates a very low income.  Through her effort and continuous work, Fanny puts into practice the vital behaviors exhibited by a successful woman, which is helping to improve her poverty situation.  Her work involves selling clothes.  

What should also be noted is the work of the counselors who continuously monitor the training and verify the progress that has been made.  At the same time, they provide these women with the encouragement they need as they strive to overcome poverty.  

Sra. Fanny is requesting a loan in order to buy products such as blouses, shorts, shirts, slippers, and other items.  This will help to solidify her business plan, which will help to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shorts, shirts, slippers, and other items.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business selling seafood in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more seafood to sell to her customers.

Jocelyn has been in this business for five years. She earns other income from pig fattening and a coffee shop.

Jocelyn has sustained her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Melmi Nohemy

texts.es: Melmi, tiene 27 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una hija con quien vive en el municipio de Gracias Lempira. ella se dedicaba a estudiar y tenia una pequeña pulpería, ahora su negocio esta mas surtido y vende también mercadería como ropa y zapatos. Ha solicitado un segundo préstamo que es por  15,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de más productos de la canasta básica como ser frijoles, arroz, manteca, maíz, harina, refrescos, pan, queso, mantequilla etc. y también para la compra de más mercadería como ser zapatos y ropa para dama y caballeros, con el fin de aumentar la clientela y sus ventas, la meta que tiene  es salir adelante con el negocio e ir creciendo poco a poco.
texts.en:
Melmi, 27, is a single mother; she has a daughter living with her in the municipality of Gracias, Lempira.  She used to study and had a small grocery store.  Now her business is better stocked and she also sells merchandise like clothes and shoes.

She’s asked for her second loan for 15,000 Lempiras to buy more basic staple goods like beans, rice, lard, corn, flour, soft-drinks, bread, cheese, butter, etc. and also to buy more merchandise like shoes and clothes for women and men aimed at increasing clientele and sales.  Her goal is to move forward with the business and to gradually grow.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and basic staple goods.

loans.name: Justin

texts.en:
Justin is 49 years old. He is a father of seven children. He has been a farmer for the past 10 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more fertilizers and quality seeds for use during the production of potatoes. The profits from the produce will be used to upgrade his farming to a modern way with much output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and quality seeds for use during potato production

loans.name: Marlon Enrique

texts.es: Marlon, tiene 35 años de edad, esta soltero  y vive con su padre y su hermano en el municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa. Tiene 4 años de ser productor de café, banano, plátanos  y a la sastrería. la producción la vende en el mercado local. La actividad de sastrería la realiza según pedidos de los clientes donde confecciona pantalones para caballeros y genera otros ingresos. El préstamo  que solicita es por 9,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de fertilizantes para el cultivo de café y lograr mejor producción. Su meta es incrementar sus ingresos y mantener la finca en buen estado para tener mejores cosechas.
texts.en:
Marlon, 35, is single living with his father and brother in the municipality of Santa Cruz de Yojoa.  He’s been growing coffee, plantain and bananas for four years and also has a tailor shop.  He sells his crops in the local market and does the tailoring to customer order making men’s trousers thus earning extra income.

He’s asking for a 9,000 Lempira loan to buy fertilizer for the coffee crop to attain greater crop yields.  His goal is to increase his income and to keep his grove in good condition to obtain better harvests.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth works hard to support four children. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Lilibeth requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to be able to extend their business hours even after nightfall and minimize her kerosene expenses.

Lilibeth is aware that by using the solar lamp she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 47 years old. He is married and has been blessed with seven children. His wife works as a farmer. He has requested the loan, which he will use to buy more fertilizer and quality seed, for use during the production of potatoes. The profits from the produce will be used to reinvest, for better output in the future.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and quality seed, for use during the production of potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: María Candelaria

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación  tiene 4 hijos de 18, 17, 15 y 13 años, los menores estudian en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.

Doña María  es una gran madre y esposa que realiza los créditos para ayudarle a su marido,  él se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres para lo cual recorre en un carro la localidad y lugares cercanos, él trabaja todos los días desde la madrugada que se traslada a Portoviejo o a Manta a los mercados de mayoristas para surtirse de productos que luego lleva a vender a sus clientes. Lleva más de 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad y gracias a esto ellos salen adelante honradamente. 

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar frutas y legumbres. Está en el Grupo De Crédito  más de 4  años y le gusta por las facilidades para realizar los créditos.  

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y que nunca le falte nada a su familia.
texts.en:
The “María Auxilidora” communal bank meets in La Sequita Parish belonging to Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manabí full of hardworking, dedicated people who are proud of their roots.  La Sequita is a parish whose inhabitants are honest people who only know work and dedication to family.

María, 35, lives here.  She’s married and has four children who are 18, 17, 15, and 13 years old.  The youngest ones attend a secondary school and her husband’s a merchant.

María is a great mother and wife who takes out all the loans to help her husband.  He works selling fruit and vegetables driving his car throughout the location and nearby areas.  He works every day starting at dawn heading to Portoviejo or to Manta to stock up in the wholesale markets there and then go sell to his customers.  He’s been in this activity for more than 20 years and thanks to this they get ahead honorably.

She will use this loan to buy fruit and vegetables.  She’s been in the communal bank for more than four years and likes it because of the ease in getting loans.  Her dream is to continue forward and that her family never lacks anything.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Fanny Amarily

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

La señora Fanny tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 5 hijos, 4 son mayores de edad y el último de 17 años que estudia en colegio, todos sus hijos aun viven en su casa a pesar de que ya algunos están comprometidos. Su esposo es comerciante.

Doña Fanny tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí  vende toda clase de víveres,  algunos remedios y tarjetas telefónicas ya que esto le da ganancias extras, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 19h00, tiene muchos clientes porque en su tienda se encuentra de todo desde carne, queso, embutidos pescado, etc. sus hijos le ayudan en su negocio cuando están desocupados. Ella lleva más de 15 años con su negocio el cual le ha dado muchos beneficios y con el cual ha logrado salir adelante junto a su familia.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar víveres, remedios y tarjetas telefónicas para surtir su negocio. Está en el Banco Comunal 9 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. 

Su meta es agrandar aun más su negocio.
texts.en:
The “María Auxilidora” communal bank meets in La Sequita Parish belonging to Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manabí full of hardworking, dedicated people who are proud of their roots.  La Sequita is a parish whose inhabitants are honest people who only know work and dedication to family.

Fanny, 45, is married and has five children.  Four of them are adults and the youngest is 17-years-old and attending high-school.  All of her children still live at home even though some of them are already engaged.  Her husband is a merchant.

Fanny has a home-based grocery store where she sells all sorts of food items, some medicine and phone cards since they provide extra profits.  She works every day from 6am to 7pm and has many customers because everything from meat to cheese to canned goods to fish, etc. can be found in her store.  Her children help her with the business when they aren’t busy.  She’s been in business more than 15 years and it’s given her many benefits that have helped her get ahead with her family.

She will use this loan to buy food items, medicine and phone cards to stock the store.  She’s been in the communal bank nine years and likes it because of the help the loans provide.  Her goal is to expand the business even more.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Hajar

texts.en: Hajar is a 23-year-old married woman from Lebanon living with her husband and only child. She has worked as a secretary at a local company since 2008. Her income plus her husband’s is barely sufficient to cover the heavy life expenses. That’s why Hajar is asking today to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, to get extra financial support. The loan will be fully used to register her daughter at the school. Hajar only aims to provide her child with a good education and only wishes to keep away from having school problems. In the future, she plans to start to work in another job in her free time with the intention of gaining a higher income and enhancing the family’s way of living.

loans.use: to register her daughter at the school

loans.name: Altanhuyag

texts.en: Mr. Altanhuyag is 34 years old and lives with his wife in a small house in the Arkhangai province of Mongolia. His wife Suvd-Erdene is 24 and started their family business together with her husband. Altanhuyag used to work in South Korea as contract worker in heavy and tough factories. He saved a little money to start his own business in his hometown and started a small frozen-food manufacturing business with his wife. Their business has been running successfully for a few months now and needs an additional investment of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of meat to reserve for producing more traditional frozen dumplings to sell to his clients. He is a hardworking and modest man.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of meat to reserve for producing more traditional frozen dumplings to sell to his clients

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila works hard to support five children. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Mila requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Mila is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing the health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Ronah

texts.en:
Ronnah is an enterprising lady, aged 32, in the Kizinda trading centre.  She owns a grocery that she started in 2005. She has three children, ages 12, 7, and 3, and she has one dependent who helps her with house chores. She works seven days in the week and gives the business an average of eight hours per day. 

The business is located in the Kizinda trading centre, Ishaka-Bushenyi.  She started the business so she could get money to help her and the rest of her family members to survive. Her clients are people in the same trading centre.  She hopes to grow her business further if given the money (UGX 3,000,000) and she buys more items to stock, since it's back to school season.

loans.use: To buy stocks of school materials and food to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 46 years old. She is married to a farmer and they have only seven children. With the loan, she will buy more fertilizers and quality seeds for use during the production of potatoes. The profits from the produce will be used to reinvest in the future business.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and quality seeds for use during the production of potatoes

loans.name: Rachelle

texts.en:
Rachelle works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rachelle is borrowing PHP 1,800 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good light source that is waterproof during the rainy season.

Rachelle is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, helping the environment, and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en:
Faustin is 43 years old.  He is a father of five children. 

With the loan, he would like to buy more fertilizer and quality seeds for use during the production of potatoes. He plans to use the profits for reinvestment to get more output in the future.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and quality seeds for use during the production of potatoes.

loans.name: Wadah

texts.en:
Wadah is an Iraqi client. He is 34 years old, married, and has two children, for whom he works hard to provide.

Wadah owns a barber shop. In order to gain some experience, he worked as an employee in another barber shop. After gaining enough experience, Wadah established his own business in 2003, and now he has an employee. He has gained good experience in this field and is well known in the surrounding area and has an excellent reputation. 

Wadah is requesting a loan of US$ 2,400 that he will use to pay the annual rent for his barber shop and to buy a new barber chair. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his barber shop and to buy a new barber chair

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean De Dieu is 39 years old. He is married and has been in the farming business for the past 19 years. 

He has requested the loan to buy more fertilizer and quality seeds for use during the production of potatoes. The profits from the business will be used to upgrade the standards of his family members by providing for the needs of the family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and quality seeds for use during the production of potatoes.

loans.name: Benedicta Aurentina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.


En este lugar vive la señora Benedicta, tiene 67 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene 7 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo no trabaja porque está enfeMO.

Doña Benedicta para ganar el sustento diario de ella y su esposo se  dedica a la cría de chanchos y pollos, ella compra estos animalitos cuando aun están pequeños, los pollos en una incubadora en Portoviejo y los chanchos en el mercado o a vecinos que los venden pequeños, los chanchos los cría por espacio de tres a cuatro meses hasta que tengan un peso adecuado y luego los vende a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa para luego llevarlos a los distintos mercados de la ciudad, en cuanto a los pollos también los entrega a comerciantes  o si no los pela y los vende por libras a vecinos y tiendas de sus localidad.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas tanto para pollos y chanchos. Lleva en el  Banco Comunal ya por 13 años y  le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otros lugares de crédito. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener salud.
texts.en:
The “María Auxilidora” communal bank meets in La Sequita Parish belonging to Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manabí full of hardworking, dedicated people who are proud of their roots.  La Sequita is a parish whose inhabitants are honest people who only know work and dedication to family.

Benedicta, 67, lives here. She’s in a common law relationship and has seven adult, independent children.  Her husband does not work because he’s ill.

To earn daily sustenance for her and her husband, Benedicta works raising pigs and chickens.   She buys these little animals when they are still small.  She buys the chicks from an incubator in Portoviejo and the pigs in the market or from neighbors that sell piglets.  She raises the pigs for about three or four months until they reach adequate weight and then sells them to merchants that come by her house to take to various parts of the city.  As for the chickens, she also delivers them to merchants or if not, she butchers them and sells them by the pound to neighbors or to local stores.

She will use the loan to buy chicks and feed and medicine both for the chicks and for the pigs.  She’s been in the communal bank for 13 years and likes it because interest rates are much lower than in other credit places.  Her dream is to continue forward and to be healthy.

loans.use: to buy chicks and to buy feed and medicine for chicks and pigs.

loans.name: Felecien

texts.en:
Felicien is 47 years old. He is a father of six children, aged between 10 and 23. He has spent more than ten years in the agriculture sector. 

With the loan, he would like to buy more fertilizer and quality seeds for use during the production of potatoes. The profits from the produce will be used to build a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and quality seeds for use during the production of potatoes.

loans.name: Sheham

texts.en:
Sheham is a second-time borrower of the institution, applying for UGX 1,500,000. She is a single lady, but she has three children that she takes care of, using her small income from her shop. She runs the shop herself. Using her small income, she has managed to pay tuition for her two school-going children and maintain her average stock. However, her capital is not yet adequate. Thus, she is borrowing from UGAFODE. She will use the loan to add stock, which will make her shop attractive to many customers, in preparation for the festive season ahead. She will buy new clothes to sell, using the loan.

She has future plans of seeing her stock increasing even more, and getting more loans from UGAFODE. She plans to pay them well, to maintain a clean record of loan repayment and also maintain the partnership with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell in her shop

loans.name: Derchinnamsrai

texts.en: Mr. Derchinnamsrai is 48 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in a small house in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. His wife, Tsermaa, works at a local school as a cleaning lady. His two daughters attend the local school and university. He has been crafting Mongolian traditional metal dead-latches since 2000. He is very talented and has lot of clients. He has built small houses for his two sons, and now he is planning to purchase inventory to increase his sales in order to save some money for his daughter's tuition fees and other school expenses. He is requesting 3,000,000 MNT for purchasing a large amount of metal from Erlian, China, to produce traditional latches for his clients. He is a hardworking, optimistic, and enthusiastic man.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of metal from Erlian, China, to produce traditional latches for his clients

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is widowed and has five children, and all of them go to school. She has no additional family members. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

She sells second-hand clothes at the market, on a retail basis. She has been in business for five years. She works six days a week. 

She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 400,000 from MCDT-SACCO. She will use the loan to buy bales of second-hand clothes. Her major business challenges include seasonality (the rainy season), which hinders her movements, and transportation. She aspires to get a permanent residence.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes to sell at the market

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.en:
Zoraida is 33 years old, married, with two children, both of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Zoraida has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food business.

Zoraida has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en:
Alphonse is 42 years old. He is married, with four children. They all go to school. 

With the loan, he would like to buy fertilizer and quality seeds for use during the production of potatoes. The profits from the potato produce will be used to upgrade the well-being of his family members.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and quality seeds for use during the production of potatoes.

loans.name: Mweupe

texts.en: Mweupe lives in Kilifi County, north of Mombasa, Kenya. She is 36 years of age and married with five children. For four years, she has been operating a food cafe in her neighborhood. She started the business from her personal savings that she made over time. The business had been growing in the recent past despite the challenges of customers not paying on time. She knew Milango through friends and she decided to join so that she could access credit to fund her business. She now seeks a loan to buy two sacks of maize and five bundles of wheat flour. In five years time she wants to be running a successful restaurant in town. With the extra income that she will raise from the business, she will add a water business to her current business.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of maize and five bundles of wheat flour

loans.name: Panfilo

texts.es: El señor Pánfilo vive en la población de Entre Ríos, junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos, de los cuales cuidan y apoyan en su educación. Se dedica al sector agrícola trabajan en su terreno agrícola propio, que adquirieron con mucho esfuerzo durante la colonización, migrando de los lugares donde hay poco movimiento económico, actualmente  produce palmitos 3 ha y cítricos 1 ha, adicional a eso tiene un ingreso  de su tienda  de barrio, los productos  los venden a los intermediarios que vienen a comprar al lugar de cosecha, la producción es familiar y a la vez contrata personal eventual que le colabora en el mantenimiento y en la cosecha de los productos. Su parcela de palmito le genera buenos ingresos económicos y es de fácil manejo por lo cual el señor Pánfilo solicita el crédito para el buen mantenimiento de su producción y así obtener mejores cosechas. Con este crédito el señor Pánfilo podrá realizar lo propuesto con su parcela de palmitos.
texts.en:
Pánfilo lives in the community of Entre Ríos with his wife and three children.  He takes care of them and supports them in their studies.

He makes a living in agriculture on his own plot of land, which they acquired with a lot of effort during settlement, having migrated from areas where there's little economic activity.  Currently he grows fan palms on three hectares and citrus on one hectare.  He also earns an income from his neighborhood store.

Pánfilo sells his crops to intermediaries who buy where the harvest takes place.  It's a family production, but he also hires temporary workers who help him take care of the fields and harvest the crops.  His fan palms generate a good income for him and they're easy to manage.

Pánfilo's requesting the loan to take good care of his crops so he can get better harvests.  With this loan he'll be able to do what he proposes with his fan palm fields.

loans.use: to take care of his crop and his plot of land

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan is a farmer in Nyakazinga, Mashonga, Kyamuhunga. He has worked in farming since 2004. He mainly grows tea, which he concentrates on for six hours per day, six days in the week. Tea growing is his major source of income, and he would like to boost it by buying and applying fertilizer in his tea garden. He will buy the fertilizer using the loan funds from UGAFODE.

He started growing tea so he could have a clear source of income. His clients are mainly tea traders in his home area who have supported him. They provide a ready market for his harvested tea. The dry season is his major challenge, but he believes that with his shrewdness and vigilance, he will make enough profit and be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer for his tea plants

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith, a married mother of four children, two of whom attend school, resides in her own house, but the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.


Edith roasts and sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis. In business for five years, she works six days a week.   Her major business challenges include electricity which hinders her business operations.


Edith has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 100,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas for roasting. She aspires to build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas for roasting
